productDescription: Since 1970 the Mr. Coffee brand has been doing one thing and one thing only... brewing coffee. No one has served cup after delicious cup to more Americans than us! For us, bringing a rich coffee experience into your home is our top priority. Along with coffee makers, we are here to share everything coffee with you.

The Mr. Coffee Coffee Grinder makes personalizing 4-12 cups of coffee easy. You can choose your grind setting from fine to coarse. The removable grinding chamber and wide-opening lid create less mess and allow for easy pouring. The exclusive Chamber Maid Cleaning System scrubs grounds from the chamber walls eliminating messy residue and resulting in less coffee waste.
Unlock the delicious characteristics of the roast right before brewing.
As coffee brews, its richness, complexity, and freshness slowly unfolds.
Extract the fullest flavor and enjoy the truest taste as it's meant to be.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder with very slight imperfections
reviews.reviewText:
I almost didn't get this due to reviews citing horrible chemical smells, but took the dive and I'm quite pleased.

At least in my case, it turned out to be the typical electric-motor smell from lubricants that you find in many a mechanized appliance, albeit somewhat pungent. Further, it comes from the base of the device, which is well apart from your precious grounds; you can make a case for oils getting on the outside of the grinding chamber in a worst case, but I don't see them ever get inside and contaminate the grounds.

All 3 settings delivered the desired consistency in relative quick time.

Cleanup was fairly easy with a little improvisation: the chambermaid system requires you to turn the lid a few times to activate- a friction-inducing action which I imagine would test the seal./locking mechanism over time. I simply removed the lid and manually pushed the chambermaid around with a finger before shaking the grounds out and washing components by hand.

This would be a clear 5 star review, but for the slight odor (which really wasn't much of an issue to me) and the puzzling fact that use in accordance with manufacturer specifications may actually wear the product down faster. It is recommended for the grinder on a budget, who's willing to cope with slight imperfections.

I will be sure to update if anything changes for better or worse.

Update March 13, 2019:

How time flies! +1 year of nearly daily use & it works as well as it did on day 1. Chemical odor is gone & the chambermaid and I maintain a very cordial relationship.

I tried 3 other coffee grinders that I did not like before purchasing this Mr. Coffee. Because I use a French press, which needs course grinds, this little machine works perfectly. The mechanism allows you to choose how many cups of coffee you will make, tells you how many TB of whole beans to put in the grinder, and has a setting for the type of grind desired. Then, with the settings chosen, it automatically grinds the beans for the right amount of time. Easy to clean, and easy to use. Couldn't be easier!.

I just purchased this Mr. Coffee 12 Cup Electric Coffee Grinder to replace a more expensive famous brand model that held the coffee beans in a container at the top, and ground them into a container at the bottom. After just a few years of occasional use, it stopped working. I felt I had wasted over $50 for this name brand coffee maker I had. Then I tried using my Ninja all purpose grinder, but it didn't grind the beans down enough, plus what was ground, got stuck in the top, making it hard to remove and re-attach the top, as the grounds would get caught in any nook and cranny the lid and container had. So, I decided to look for a cheaper coffee grinder, and I found the Mr. Coffee grinder had a lot of positive reviews, and was relatively inexpensive, so I purchased it.

After washing the container that holds and grinds the beans and the top, I placed the beans to the fill line, and ground my Tim Horton's coffee beans finely ground. It worked like a charm!! The container has side scrapers to prevent coffee grinds to build up and cake on the bottom and sides of the clear container. This was a good purchase for me at an economical price!

You should know that if the clear plastic container is not placed back onto the base the correct way, the grinder will not work. I thought the grinder was defective at first, until I realized it was "operator error" by not reading the directions first. Once I had the container placed back on the base and locked in place. the grinder worked flawlessly. You should also know that there is no "on and Off" button. You need to select the amount of coffee you want to grind up to 12 cups and choose how you would like your coffee ground. Once you choose that from the side of the base, you simply push the "on" button on the top of the clear bean holder container until your grinder stops on its own. If you do not hold down the "on" button, your grinder will stop. That is a built in safety feature.

The cord is approximately 2' long. Also, when I'm done grinding, I unplug the grinder just so there's not any electricity running through it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Like the three settings for fine, medium and coarse grinding.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the Mr. Coffee Electric Coffee Blade Grinder to go along with a French Press coffee maker I also purchased from Amazon. The product arrived promptly and was packaged securely and had no damage to outer package or product package. I am going to enjoy using this grinder. The instruction booklet explains the different parts of the grinder and how to use it. I made my first pot of coffee this morning. It tastes so smooth and delicious compared to my old automatic drip coffee maker. Two observations: On the product box it is stated that you can use this grinder for spices; however, in the instruction book it clearly states not to use it for that purpose. That might make a difference to you if you intend to grind spices. Also I wish there were some way for your setting to default to your setting once it is unplugged. For example, if you unplug the grinder your setting must be reset every time. There is a setting for fine, medium or coarse grind and an automatic stop when that consistency is achieved. You may have to hit the grind button an extra time to get all beans. I ground 4 Tbsp of beans on coarse and had to hit it twice to catch all the beans. The cord seems short but actually is long enough for counter use as the cord is wrapped around the inside of the base. I would recommend this grinder especially b/c of the grind selection.Mr. Coffee IDS77 Electric Coffee Blade Grinder with Chamber Maid Cleaning System, Black

reviews.reviewTitle: Why Is This A Bad Grinder?
reviews.reviewText: I love my espresso, French Press and my regular coffee. I like coffee, so when my latest Burr grinder went out I thought perhaps I would get this Mr Coffee as a temporary. Seriously? This grinder has issues. The design isn't bad, even though there is a lot of plastic. If you set it on Course Grind, it grinds it but leaves way too many large pieces (even for French Press) and has a mix of fine and medium all together! Okay then, so I set it on medium, funny the grind looks the same as the one prior, maybe a hint of more fine, but look there's the big pieces too.... I even got a little theatrical with it shaking and grinding at the same time, hoping that would help.... Nope, still the same. Espresso? Not much better. It also says not to put nuts or seeds in this, so sad, Mr. Coffee use to produce good things. I could create a better grind of coffee with a Ziploc bag, a hammer and a cutting board.

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrible--not automatic, won't grind evenly, hard to clean
reviews.reviewText:
This is supposed to be an automatic coffee grinder. It has settings for grind coarseness and # cups. Just what I wanted. That should mean you set those 2 things, press start, and let it go. However, it is not automatic. You have to hold the button down the entire time for it to grind. So what the heck do the settings do? Nothing. You still have to stand there and hold the button. If you have to hold the button down, might as well get one of the simple basic blade grinders that's at least easy to clean.

On top of that, it is difficult to clean. The "chamber maid" system does nothing but trap grounds and get in the way. Can't get them out even with a coffee brush. You're supposed to wash/rinse the chamber and lid, but because of their design, water gets trapped in both the chamber and lid, and you can't get it out or hand dry it. Have to wait for it to air dry. So, if you want to grind coffee 2 days in a row, you can't rinse out the chamber/lid in between! You just have to have messy grounds spilling out all over the place until you have time to rinse it and let it air dry for 36 hours!

But the worst thing is it doesn't grind well at all (at least, the one I was shipped doesn't; maybe it's defective, but the other issues are still true). Half the beans are pulverized into a fine powder and the other half are left essentially whole. After multiple attempts, could not get an even and complete grind no matter what we did.

No wonder this thing is inexpensive--everything about it is bad. I bought it because it supposedly had the features I wanted, not because of price. I bought this to replace an old GE automatic blade grinder that let you set the grind/# cups, press start and walk away. Worked great for years. And even had a very easy cord-retraction/storage system. Unfortunately, I broke the lid lock switch, couldn't super-glue it back, and I can't find that same model of grinder anymore.

Am returning this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: UNWIND THE CORD!!! HOLY COW PEOPLE! ...
reviews.reviewText: UNWIND THE CORD!!! HOLY COW PEOPLE!! IT'S ALMOST 2 1/2 FEET LONG!! It even says in the manual that the bottom is cord storage.

reviews.reviewTitle: Extremely disappointed as this was a replacement for one that wouldnt ...
reviews.reviewText: Wanted a grinder that grinded beans coarsely, wasnt too big & held a large amount of beans to grind. Bought less than 3 mos ago; no longer works. Used ~10 times. Of course, beyond return time. Extremely disappointed as this was a replacement for one that wouldnt grind beans coarsely. Anyone have suggestions for one that does, moderate price? Disappointed in return policy!! ?????? Gave one star because Amazon wont let you leave a review without leaving at least one...that & the return policy needs reviewed...

I bought this because I drink a lot of coffee, and wanted to broaden my experience. I saw a video, liked that the top part came off and could be washed easily. The reviews were quite good so I decided to give it a try. The instructions were easy to follow, and I was able to grind the coffee easily. I was able to use it once a day for several days of coffee. When I got up this morning to use it, it made a terrible noise and started smoking. I had read one prior review that had the same thing happen. The device itself is nice, has a very small footprint which fits easily in my kitchen, and is generally designed well. Unfortunately the issue of it smoking makes it untenable. I guess I will have to look for another coffee grinder

Very surprised by the good reviews. This thing is so awkward to use, doesn't grind evenly at all, and is difficult to clean. I like to be able to dump grounds directly from the grinder bowl into the coffee filter in the coffee maker, but quite a lot of the grounds get stuck in the bottom of the grinder, making it very difficult or impossible to dump them without making a huge mess, not to mention wasting coffee because of how much gets stuck in the bottom of the grinder. I don't expect perfectly even grinding either, but I found myself over-grinding my coffee too finely in an attempt to get the large chunks of bean to grind down also, which didn't work. And forget about using a brush to clean this thing out--the coffee gets stuck at the bottom and inside of the plastic stir strips and won't come out when brushed (it just re-sticks over and over, even when you tip it upside down), so the only way to clean it is with soap and water, which isn't something I want to do every single time I use the grinder. I returned it right away!

reviews.reviewTitle: I would search for another grinder.
reviews.reviewText:
First impression is that this could be a great grinder. It. The top part is removable for easy pouring and cleaning. This section also comes apart which is nice for cleaning.
The first thing you notice when operating the grinder is that it is loud and sounds like the motor is going to fail. I still expect it to break each time I use it. The different sections do not seal tight enough to keep coffee grounds completely inside.
The autogrind feature might be nice for some people but I didn't like the final grind and end up grinding it further. That may just be a preferance for me.
I would not buy this grinder again. I will run it for now and see how long it lasts under normal use and I will update when that happens.

This little guy is a CHAMP, especially for the price. I bought this to replace an older verson of Mr. Coffee grinder that crapped out rather quickly. I figured I'd give 'em another go with a newer version, and boy am I happy. We have been utilizing this DAILY (literally at least once a day) for over a year to ground whole beans for our morning french roast, and it's still rocking it. This involves unscrewing the chamber from the base every day to pour into the press and re-attaching with no problems, as well as pouring beans in through the top flap. These are two areas where I expected some of the plastic to quickly get broken, but so far so good!

We have set it to one setting that we know is perfect for our amount of beans and never change it, and only ever used it for coffee beans, so can't speak to versatility of materials or variance.

reviews.reviewTitle: we have ground coffee for usein the coffee pot and that worked great. My partner and I are both blind
reviews.reviewText:
We bought this grinder so that we could have uniformly coarsely ground coffee to make cold brew at home. I havent actually done this yet, so I dont know how well it will hold up to my purposes. However, we have ground coffee for usein the coffee pot and that worked great.

My partner and I are both blind, so we needed some help to know how the buttons would work when we press them. We learn from the manual that when you plug the unit in, the settings are automatically set to 8 cups for medium ground. Top button is to adjust cups, and the bottom button is to adjust the coarseness of the grind. Pressing the bottom button once will change the grinder from medium to coarse; pressing it again will change it to fine grind. Pressing it one final time will bring back to a medium grind.

Same idea works with the top button. If you press it once, itll change to 10 cups, then 12, then to 4 cups, then to six, then back to eight cups.

The manual provide some information about cleaning as well. To top section do you unscrew and can be washed. The bottom section attached to the cord should not be submerged in water and doesnt think you need to be washed at all. The manual is pretty easy to read using Seeing AI app on our phone. I imagine it would also scan while using a scanner. Imagine you could also probably search for one online. If other folks have any other helpful instructions on use for cleaning of the product, dont hesitate to chime in.

I only recently started buying whole-bean coffee and grinding it myself in the mornings... and this is the coffee grinder I settled on for my first real foray into do-it-yourself grinding. I have to say, I absolutely love it, and I wish I had switched to grinding fresh in the mornings a long time ago.

The grinder itself is compact, which is nice; it stores easily, and the individual components come apart very easily for washing. The number of settings it contains is also great. I love that I can set the coarseness of the grind depending on whether I want drip or espresso, and how many cups I'm looking to make. I've also used it as a spice grinder, and I find that it is super handy for that, as well. I have used it to grind roasted cumin seeds, and while it took a little extra washing to make sure my coffee beans didn't taste vaguely like spice, it worked very well.

The only caveat: It's noisy. I grind my coffee fresh in the morning now, and the noise makes my cats very upset and is guaranteed to wake my partner if she isn't already up and about. Other than that, I have no complaints. I've been using this for a few weeks now and it seems to still be in excellent condition, but I'll be sure to update if it breaks or something happens to it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Do Not Buy and Thank You Amazon for your return policy.
reviews.reviewText: Stopped working after 2nd use of 10 seconds. Requested and received a replacement from Amazon, which stopped within 5-10 seconds of first use. This product is garbage. I ignored the negative comments, but this time they were right. From Where or What do the plethora of positive reviews come from? So much for trusting a name brand.

The only positive thing I can say about this product is that it works when you plug it in. Every other aspect of my user experience has been negative.
1. Even though it has a bunch of settings for grind and volume like many automatic grinders, you still have to hold the button down in order for it to work, thereby removing any convenience those functions might have provided.
2. The grinding cup has plastic struts along the inside of the walls that are meant to help remove the grounds. They actually TRAP grounds, thereby creating waste in the form of unused coffee grounds, and necessitating more effort than other grinders to remove the grounds into your coffee maker. It also takes longer to clean, thereby sucking more time way
3. Those same struts are made from flimsy plastic, and I was always afraid I was going to snap one while cleaning. Since they are part of the mechanism that secures the lid for operation, that in itself would have rendered the device inoperable of it had happened.
4. The lid is an over-engineered collection of plastic hinged together to provide maximum frustration. It traps grounds, making it a pain clean, the hinge itself is just a think piece of plastic just asking to be snapped (and once it goes, so does functionality), and securing it to the base/cup to operate the thing requires way more practice and finesse than most people have the capacity for while trying to make coffee.

This is not a well designed product. Save yourself some frustration and get something else.

Followed the instructions for the amount of beans to add, then used the maximum grinding time option, but still ended up with a lot of large chunks. After sifting them out, the properly-sized grounds were fine.

Purchased: Sept 8, 2016
So far so good...as long as you follow the instructions you can't go wrong....I hope.
I love the sleek design.
The cord was a wee bit of a pain to get out and it is short but it's all good...I got it.
Shipping was very fast and very well packaged.
Will let you know more later when we get to actually use it.
Thank you

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

Aug 16, 2017
OK...here we go....
We just started using this 3 months ago when our old one went bottoms up and followed the directions to a "T".
Unfortunately, after a few good runs (once a week) it decided that it didn't want to grind anymore by pushing down the lid. (Yes, we turned the cup till it clicked)
Then it start running continual and the only way to stop it was to unplug it.

So...instead, I had to unplug it, put the beans in, turned the cup to click and plug it back in, which it would start to grind (without me touching the top) for about 8-10 seconds then it would stop.

Then I would unplug it again and wait a minute or two and plug it back in and it would start grinding on it's own...all the while not needing to push the lid down to grind.

Each time, it would only grind for a few seconds then stop. We did not have it set to a time limit but did have it set to "Fine".

Basically, it works to a point but very annoying having to plug it in to only to have it grind for a few seconds and stop.

Thanks Bunches,
Royal

P.s...It would be nice to have a small soft brush to brush out the left-over grounds from the cup. The roundy-scraper thingy inside the cup doesn't get the grounds out very well...so, was thinking a little soft brush would work nicely.

I still love the look, plus....I did manage to find a short extention cord that works wonders with it's short cord.

This grinder does a good job on a variety of beans. The grind seems consistent and it is easy to operate. A few design flaws cost it a star with me. You have to set grind and number of cups each time you use it. I guess if it was left plugged in that would not be an issue, but I keep mine in the cabinet and not on the countertop. The other problem is the ridges on the inside of the basket. It is difficult to brush out and get a clean sweep because they trap grounds on the ribs. Overall I am satisfied with this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent Value, but not a good grinder.
reviews.reviewText: It doesn't grind fast, or even. It has blades instead of burrs, so it doens't even technically grind. In fact, I need to grind each batch about 3 times, stirring in between to get a passable result. But it's small, cheap and it's fine for occasional use. It's not objectively good- but that's not what you expected at this price. The value is decent, and it's a good choice if you mostly buy pre-ground, or want something to leave in the office, rental or vacation home.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not recommended for grinding your nuts.
reviews.reviewText: I originally purchased this grinder in 2011 and it lasted until recently when the black plastic stirring part broke. It has been a dependable coffee grinder with daily use. I make an 8-cup pot of coffee everyday using 64g of fresh coffee beans. I use the shortest setting, i.e. 4 cups, coarse grind. Any more grinding and it starts bringing out some bitterness. If you want your coffee stronger by all means grind longer, however, if you want to avoid "burning" the beans, then I would suggest pulsating the beans to a finer grind. This keeps the heat down and avoids scorching the beans. For under $20, you can't go wrong with this grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: An Excellent Buy For The Price
reviews.reviewText: This little item does a creditable job grinding up coffee beans and the price makes even a better buy. I'll tell you why: In the last two years, I have bought two different brands of relatively expensive ($35 to $55) "burr grinder" coffee mills, each of which failed before the year was up. The Mr. Coffee grinder cost me $11 and does pretty much as good a job as the other two, though there is the occasional unground bean and grinding 12cups on the "extra-fine" setting asks a lot of it. But the way I look at it is this: I don't use "extra fine" grind but occasionally and, even if this gizmo fails within a year, I've only invested $11 and can replace it for $11 not $35, $45, $55--or up--as with the others. The Mr. Coffee grinder is easy/intuitive to use, doesn't take long to complete its task. cleans up easily, and doesn't take up much space on my kitchen counter (unlike the other coffee mills). All things considered, for my purposes, this item is the best buy.

You get what you pay for! Spend 20 bucks more and get a burr grinder so you can get even coffee grounds for better flavor. This one creates powdery mess even on a coarse grind. I would have to sift the coffee to get the small powder out before I could make a pot of coffee. But hey, you get what you pay for. On the other hand this would be great for grinding spices or herbs where consistency is not as critical as it is for a smooth cup of coffee

reviews.reviewTitle: I drink too much coffee for this to be an effective grinder for me
reviews.reviewText:
It says 12-cup grinder. Does not fit 12 cups worth of beans, and definitely does not hold 12 cups worth of ground coffee. It will grind about 8 tablespoons worth of coffee.

the grinder also does not grind the coffee very well. there will still half ground beans left over after I used the grinder.

I think this grinder would work for someone who has time to grind coffee every single morning for their drip coffee maker.

I use a french press and have to coarse grind my beans. I like to grind my coffee on the weekends for the week.

This coffee grinder did not work for a weeks worth of grounds, and the coarse grind left half ground beans.

it does not grind the coffee well and does not fit 12 cups of coffee (beans or ground)

So give this grinder a shot if you are willing to grind beans every morning for your drip coffee maker. Otherwise, save your money.

I have had this coffee maker for a couple years now, and the most annoying thing I've noticed since day one is that it's impossible to get clean. The metal bottom of the chamber is not secured to the plastic chamber by more than the grinding blade assembly, so it moves ever so slightly and when you wash it, coffee gets in the space inbetween metal and plastic. Mine is permanently stained because of this and an eyesore in my kitchen. Also, for anyone hoping to use it more than once a day, or even once a day, it takes almost a full 24 hours for this to dry completely so you don't have water shooting out of the grinder assembly as it spins in the base. I would not buy this one again. But for now, it works, so I guess it stays.

This grinder works great. I love that you can remove the grinder module (top part) to dump your grounds into your coffee maker. Makes it easy to clean also. The settings feature on this product are kind of BS. It just sets the power button to stop grinding on a timer according to volume of beans added and how fine a grind you want. But you still have to hold your finger on the button the entire time it grinds. They should have had a one touch system, so that you could touch the button once, walk away, and it will stop when the grind is done. Regardless, this is a good product and great value for the price.

This thing has died after 2 months, and limited use. The lights came on but the switch had no effect, my beans just sat there, waiting, frowning. When it WAS operational, it did a poor job of grinding the beans. If you load it to its capacity you have to go through multiple cycles to get all the beans ground. They kind of get stuck atop the ground beans below unless you shake it around or something. You cant really adjust the grind either, just the amount of time the motor spins based on how many cups you plan to brew. Its a cheaper unit, Im not really surprised at its performance, just disappointed because I know Ill need to spend more money to get a more reliable grinder.

The settings are simple: between fine-coarse and 6-12 cups, it seems like the two settings determine the length of grinding time which will impact how fine the grinder makes the coffee bean. For a French Press user, this is all you need. If you have drip coffee or the reusable keurig cups, it's still good, you'll just spend a little time figuring out the best settings for your particular setup. A *little* on the loud side.

I bought this in 2018 when a blade on the Brother grinder I had since the 90's broke. Ever since, even after running it on the longest grind setting I would see chunks of beans left in the basket after brewing, which had never happened with the Brother model. This morning while cleaning the grind chamber I took the blades out and discovered they are not sharpened at all. I don't mean once sharpened and now dull, they were never sharpened to begin with like the Brother was. The Brother's blades are still pretty sharp after 20 years, while the Mr Coffee's blades have no sharp edge at all. Just like almost all Mr Brother coffee makers, this thing is just cheaply designed for max profit. I'm buying a different brand as soon as possible and never touching Mr Coffee again.

Pretty bad device, to honest.
I'm a coffee lover and very well understand what it supposed to be like.
Mr. Coffee grinder doesn't turn the grains well around and they stick to the plastic window and plastic divider (which was supposed to help turning it all around) and many beans can be untouched in the result. Grinned coffee doesn't smell as it was just grinned, I guess the problem is excess of plastic in the device.
Throughout my life, I've has so many coffee grinders and they are all about the same, never as bad.
This one after 3 month just got burned out blending a medium amount of coffee.
After this mistake I got KitchenAid coffee grinder and now I smell the coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job but could be better.
reviews.reviewText:
The grinder itself does grind coffee beans. The perks are just not that great. The Chambermaid sweeper does not get the grounds out of the bowl. The easy spout is rarely used since I had to remove the lid to get most of the grounds out. Lastly, I am not sure what the different cup settings are for since I have to count and hold the button any way.

So, it does work and I will keep using it but I would not get it again if I had the choice

If you like simple and functional - this is not it. There are three pieces to this grinder. And one piece has a moving part on top of it. It is big and you need two hands to operate it. And it is impossible to clean it inside due to many parts inside the chamber. Too much going on for a coffee grinder and too bulky to operate. And what is more - I was unable to get a finely ground coffee despite the time I was grinding. I am sending it back.

reviews.reviewTitle: Issue with grinding the coffee beans. But overall, it gets the job done.
reviews.reviewText: Great little coffee grinder, I am the only coffee drinker so its good for me and if I have a guest over, I can make some more for them. My Issue here is the quality of the grinding, I get whole chunks of the coffee bean in the grinder after I grind, I often have to grind the batch again in order to grind everything. I keep this one because it gets the job done and I cant complain about the price but if I had another coffee drinker in the house and cared a lot about the quality of the grind, I would purchase something else.

reviews.reviewTitle: Leaves coffee beans unground, not a hands-free option
reviews.reviewText:
I am disappointed in this grinder for many reasons. First, it is not hands-free, which my old Hamilton Beech was. You have to hold down the button until it stops grinding. Second, it does not grind evenly. There are often large pieces of coffee bean mixed in with fine dust. I could deal with holding down the grinder if it actually ground to the right consistency. I have to grind and re-grind, as well as tilt the grinder side to side to get a consistent, thorough grind.. Underfilling it does not eliminate the problem.

I don't recommend this product.

The product description makes it sound amazing. Really??? This thing has more unnecessary useless gizmos than Maxwell Smart. Grind timers, coffee amount setting buttons, bowl sweepers, lids that don't dump all of the grinds, very noisy (even for a coffee grinder). Seems flimsy and cheaply built.

We are using our solidly built, quieter Cuisinart grinder again (even though the button is taped on now). It has one button (ON), a grinder bowl and a lid. K.I.S.S.

If I didn't have to foot the bill for shipping I would send it back. Hopefully we can get a couple bucks for it at our next yard sale.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as I remember.
reviews.reviewText: I used this machine a few years back and remember it being nice. I went to the basic Hamilton Beach model for a few years and was really happy with that. Then that broke so I decided to come back to this machine. Bad idea. Ive only used it for about a week and Im ditching it for something else. The settings dont really work. Every day I make 6 cups and like the grounds fine. If I use the settings on the machine, I dont get enough grounds and its very chunky. I just dont have the patience to play around and find the right balance when I know its so much easier as wittnesed on my previous grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great machine! This is my second model
reviews.reviewText: This is a great machine! This is my second model... I purchased my first one at least 6 years ago, and it still works perfectly! I went to go study abroad in Latin America, and I actually took it with me. My host family loved it so much that I gave it to them. You can grind spices and other stuff on it too! They loved that. I purchased this second one to replace the the first, because I knew it was a good machine! Thanks Mr. Coffee!

The grinder leaves chunks of whole beans no matter what you try. I even use a 3 or 4 step process where I shake the grinder to stir the beans and change the grind level and cup qty., but nothing works...theres always chunks of whole beans left. You cant see how bad it is until after the coffee is done and then you can see the chunks in the filter, they rise to the top and center...its very frustrating. Spend a few extra dollars and get something that works better. I totally and completely regret this purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent service for an excellent product
reviews.reviewText:
The first 5 stars go to Amazon for the blistering fast service; ordered on 30 April & received the package on the 7th. That's one week to ship to South Africa, that's quicker than Takealot with a far much wider product variety and even with the shipping & tax I'm still getting better value overall.

The grinder is excellent, feels like it's well made and a definite smart device compared to most coffee grinders. I can decide on the coarseness of the coffee, dispense only what I need for the Brew and can also auto shut off. Just tested it and it performs well beyond coffee.

Money well spent for an excellent product.

My son broke my old Mr. Coffee Grinder, so I just replaced it and am thrilled that this one, is just as perfect as my old one was. I simply could not even think of finding one like it. None work as well as the Mr. Coffee Grinder. I love it, and since I use mine a couple times a day, and have been really rough on it, I can tell you, this grinder took a lot of hard work from me, and it worked great until my son moved back in. LOL
It's the only coffee grinder I will ever buy, it's really that good!

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent Blade Grinder for Coffee Beans
reviews.reviewText: For the price this is an excellent buy. I got it for work because I use a french press at home and decided I'd bring one up to work too. It's pretty easy to operate and straight forward. The only drawback is the cleaning. The little swipers inside the container that are supposed to get the extra grounds off the walls of the grinder don't work all that well but it's a small drawback. Other than that, it works great and grinds coffee beans for french press well.

Not sure how to review this.

If you need a device with several too many buttons, twisty compartment things, flaps and settings, than by all means buy this kajigger.

Most normal people will find this thing really just randomly grinds coffee beans to the same horrible level of grindiness regardless of what setting it is on.

Wife refers to this as the coffee grinder we like.

I'm going to stop refering to her as the wife we like.

reviews.reviewTitle: A little too awkward in design.
reviews.reviewText: I can't really recommend this one, because the bowl twits on and off and the bowl has a top that twists on and off and it can take time line up the fittings to reattachment them. The fittings are all plastic and you risk damage, not to mention it's just a little too complicated to use. It does grind well, but I returned mine and replaced it with the discontinued Cuisinart one here on Amazon. It's a very nice grinder that is more like your typical bean grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: So easy to use, love it, wish the cord was longer.
reviews.reviewText:
I had never ground my own coffee before, so I was a little intimidated, but this little guy makes it so easy. Fill beans to the line, pick the setting you want, then hold down the top. It will grind and stop automatically when it has finished. Easy to wash, easy to use.

The only negative I have is that the cord is like 6" long, so you need to have an outlet readily available on the countertop when you're ready to use. Not a problem in my kitchen, but it definitely could be in some kitchens.

Very nice unit, I like the grind adjustment buttons. I'm nit picking but the cleaning blades which are built into the unit gets about 90% of the coffee. Also, the fill line is a tad bit of a hassle. On my old braun you popped the lid off and filled it to the level where the lid goes on if you went over the beans fell out. If you're sleepy upon awaking that helps. On this you have to fill then lift it up to see the line. Again, I'm nit picking here 4 stars is very positive in my book.... so I gave it 5 since it was 12.00 that's pretty darn cheap...

reviews.reviewTitle: it's pretty easy clean and a useful item for a pretty ...
reviews.reviewText: So this guy works. It says not to grind spices but I do. I have also ground egg shells to add to my dog's homemade food (for the calcium and the eggshell membrane-good for joints). I would be five stars but there is no on-off button. You must unplug to get the lighted selection buttons to go off. Other than that, it's pretty easy clean and a useful item for a pretty decent price.

Can't believe the low price. I have a Mr. Coffee grinder that is still going strong after daily use for close to 10 years. I use this particular model for grinding dehydrated peppers and the like transforming my organic herbs and vegetables into various spices. The select-able grind feature is awesome and not a gimmick- it works. This unit also seems to be well built and also important it is really easy to clean. This is a true 5 star product for both function and value in my book.

reviews.reviewTitle: The solution to all your grocery store coffee grinding related complaints.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my dad because grinding his coffee at the grocery store is a constant source of trauma for him. I got sick of hearing him complain about how the shelf was too low so he couldn't open the grinder or how people didn't know you have to pull the bag all the way up so they'd dump a bag full of beans in and then leave it and blah blah blah... so I bought the grinder. He still complains because occasionally a bean or two doesn't get ground up all the way by this grinder, but overall he likes it. He has a few other complaints about this grinder but they all have to do with my mom washing washing the lid the wrong way or that he doesn't know which level of courseness he's supposed to grind at (even though he grinds his coffee daily now) but there's nothing Mr. Coffee could have done about those things so I still say 5 stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works like it is suppose to, but is loud.
reviews.reviewText:
The grinder is and improved bowl design over the same one I had purchased several years ago. I like the fact that the grinder/blade bowl is detachable from the motor. The lid is also detachable from the grinder/blade bowl. This is a must, for cleaning and ease of emptying the ground coffee into the filter. I also like the fact that I can make the beans ground as fine as I would like. I believe, the finer you grind the beans, the more flavor you get out of the beans. The motor is also powerful and will not bog down with the amount of beans you grind and the fineness of the coffee grounds.
The only negative thing is that the motor is loud.

I bought this grinder for the coarse setting since I've recently started cold brewing coffee at home. I like to do things myself, but I'm no expert on coffee. Would totally recommend for non-baristas. I love all of the options it has. The grind doesn't always come out even, but I don't always measure my beans well. I think it's a great little grinder that doesn't take up much space and cleans really easily. After a month, I'm fairly pleased.

reviews.reviewTitle: got this for herbs and spices, I use a ...
reviews.reviewText: got this for herbs and spices, I use a cone-burr coffee grinder. Study construction, the grind selection comes in handy so I'm not having to guess at grinding say pepper corns to the same coarseness as say Coriander or cinnamon or chili peppers when making curry - while I will still do hand-mortising this grinder takes the first 2-5 minutes out of the process - and I can finish up focusing more on taste and fine-tuning the sauce. Discovering that tiny amounts of different herbs and spices can change he entire flavor of a curry - before I used what I had started with, this way I can use part, set part aside, and try tiny variations - and the surplus goes into another curry sauce that gets saved for later use.

This is a good grinder as it has a number of settings for how you want your coffee ground. As many other reviews noted the cord is to short. I thought since my plugin is right next to my coffee maker it wouldn't be a problem, but it was much shorter. This does give a lot of control and options for a grinder.

I purchased this little guy a few weeks ago for one reason - to make espresso. We (wife and I) don't own one of those super-fancy or expensive espresso machines. We bought themypressi TWIST Handheld Espresso Makerthis past Christmas (gift to ourselves) and have been usingCoffee Bean Direct's Italian Roast Espressofor a few months with our grind and brew coffee maker. We figured this is good enough for the casual espresso that we want on the weekends. We didn't have a grinder though, so we went to our local S-bucks and bought a pound and had them grind it. If you've bought from S-bucks, you know how much a pound of coffee is and we didn't want to keep making separate purchases, so I looked for a cheap grinder. Now before you knock me for what I am using this grinder for, I am aware that the burr grinders are "best" for espresso, but given that I didn't even pay half of what Amazon (and other retailers) is selling my espresso maker for, I was not about to spend close to $100 for a grinder. So, about the grinder...

This grinder is pretty much what you expect it to be. It is compact, gets a little warm when I run it, and is a little on the loud side. As a matter of fact, most grinders are on the loud side, so that shouldn't be a surprise or a draw-back. The settings are about as basic as you can get - fine, medium and coarse. And depending on the amount you want to grind (settings from 4 cups to 12 cups and has tbsp equivalents for each cup measurement), the built-in timer does ensure that you won't over-grind your beans. In my case, when I grind 8 cups worth of beans on fine, I run it twice to get that "extra-fine" grind for my espresso. Since the machine does get a little warm, I wait a minute or so before running the 2nd grind because I am aware that too much heat from the machine can kill some of the flavor of the espresso. I do this because I'm picky, not because it doesn't work. As a matter of fact, if only run one time, the fine setting did give me a grind good enough for the espresso maker, I just wanted my grounds to look/feel like flour mixed with a little salt if that makes any sense. Running the grinder twice gives me that texture. Either way, I get a consistent grind that is exactly what is needed to run a shot from my espresso maker.

Other features not related to grinding: The cord is actually quite long. Some reviews complain about it being too short. In fact, it is wound up in the base of the grinder. Just unwind it and you'll have plenty of length to get your job done. The cup is sized very well - especially for my needs - and has a convenient lid that opens so you can pour the grinds in your coffee maker's basket or a bowl (like I do). The "Chamber Maid" does a good job cleaning the sides of the cup but doesn't really get to those stuck at the bottom. No big deal, as I just give a couple taps and they fall into my bowl.

All in all, I highly recommend this grinder. It is a very good grinder for the price. Very consistent from grind to grind. Has a timer so you won't over, or under, grind your beans (depending on the amount and coarseness settings). The lid opens for your convenience, has a long enough cord, and the cleaning system does a decent job.

As usual, Amazon shipped promptly in a well-packaged box.

My wife and I recently started buying whole bean coffee instead of pre-ground and let me tell you this is the way to do it! Fresh ground coffee tastes so much better when you grind it every morning. This little grinder does the trick, just set up your configuration on the buttons on the front and then press and hold the button till it stops. It doesn't do the greatest job but for the cost it is good enough!

reviews.reviewTitle: Does it's job. Does not have measurement lines for less than 10 cups.
reviews.reviewText:
It's a consistent grinder that does its job without fuss. The easy twist feature does help get any grounds remaining in the chamber loosened so they can be dumped.

My one complaint and the reason for the four stars is the lack of measuring lines marking out suggestions for 4,6, & 8 cup brews. It doesn't take long to figure it out though, and we use it daily to make 6 cup brews.

Very easy to use. I run it just about 6-7 seconds longer than the preset auto shut-off, as there are some beans left in the grounds if I don't. This is my second one, and when this one breaks I'll probably get a third one. Simple to run, light weight, and easy to clean up. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewTitle: WOW! 6 Years Later and Still Works Great!
reviews.reviewText:
Update: It is now January of 2017, and I am still using this coffee grinder! It works every bit as well as it did when I bought it six years ago, which is pretty incredible considering the price. For reference, I use this product 3-5 times/week. 10/10 I would buy this product again!

I purchased the Mr. Coffee IDS77 Electric Coffee Grinder in an effort to help me cut down on my Starbucks habit. I've had it for several months now, and so far I've been really pleased. This is my first coffee grinder so I can't compare it to any other models, but for what it's worth, I have no desire to purchase a different one. The grinder is so easy to use - just use the buttons to select the number of cups you're grinding for and your desired level of coarseness (fine, medium or coarse), add beans and press down on the lid. After just a few seconds, your freshly ground beans are ready to brew. When you remove the lid to pour the ground beans into your coffee maker or french press it is a bit messy. I always have to wipe my counter down after I use this product, but from what I understand, this is pretty standard for most machines like this. I love that I can clean the bean chamber in my dishwasher, and this grinder is a great value. If you can't decide whether or not to purchase a coffee grinder in general, I certainly recommend doing so. Coffee tastes so much better when your beans are freshly ground (particularly if you store the beans in an airtight container), and I don't miss the coffee shop stuff at all. I would also recommend purchasing this model in particular because of its low cost and easy operation and cleaning.

Not a great job... DO NOT fill to the "max fill" line; no matter what you do, it misses beans or over grinds beans. I use this for coarse grinding for cold brew... does a decent job and is simple enough. BUT... the bowl has little nooks and crannies that catch grounds and is a pain too clean. I still use my old manual grinder more often than is...

I love this little coffee grinder! I live on my own, so it's nice to be able to grind small batches of coffee at a time. The coffee tastes fresher, and I'm not limited to pre-ground coffee anymore! All of the pieces come apart easily, making cleaning easy. The only thing I've noticed is that the grinder heats up fast, so you should probably let it cool a bit between grindings. This isn't an issue for me though, since I only do one small batch at a time.

reviews.reviewTitle: WOW! Perfect Whole Pepper and Spice Grinder
reviews.reviewText: We absolutely LOVE this grinder! We needed it to grind dehydrated cayenne peppers to a fine powder. We bought other "electric spice/coffee" grinders on Amazon and NONE of them worked for our purposes except this one! It worked without a hitch! It was FABULOUS! We were able to ground down over 150 organic cayenne peppers from our herb and pepper garden (after we dehydrated them). Highly recommend this and because it has different grind options, it makes the grinder even more efficient and valuable when trying to meet multiple needs. Thank you Mr. Coffee and Amazon. Added bonus, it's a great price! Win Win!

reviews.reviewTitle: Intuitive to use and makes it easy not to spill grounds
reviews.reviewText: Used this model at the office for about two years. Ground a couple thousand pots of coffee with it. Worked very well. Intuitive to use and makes it easy not to spill grounds. It died (after an impressive tour of duty). I purchased another. The motor on that one failed within 60 days. Not impressive.

this is actually my second one i just bought, my first i used for years and burned out finally and liked it so much purchased the same one. i like that you can adjust the grinding from fine to coarse. love that the unit detaches from the base to make it easier to pour into my french press/coffee pot. if you're on the fence, buy it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for my first grinder, but its time for an upgrade.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because Ive never used a grinder before and I didnt want to splurge. I like this little machine however you get what you pay for. When I select fine ground it doesnt grind as fine as Ive seen other machines do. I usually do medium for when I make my cold brew coffee and that works great. I think Im going to upgrade soon but in the meantime this works fine. If youre a real coffee drinker Id recommend at least going to a midrange grinder over this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great even grind for small quantities; neat, convenient features; eventually parts broke.
reviews.reviewText:
Never owned a 'burr grinder', but this worked great for the past couple years until today: Feb. 2, 2015. The inner plastic ribbing (probably used to scrape sticky grindings free) just came loose, then broke off some how inside today and was chewed up by the grinder, thus un-repairable.
I think it can work / grind without that, but it was poorly made for that to happen in my opinion.

Capacity is adequate, tho smaller than you'd think, based on the size of the unit (could be quite a bit shorter in height, but no biggy).

Might work for you fine and hold up better, but I'm now trying and very much liking this one, which does spices and nutes:
http://www.amazon.com/Epica-Electric-Grinder-Stainless-Removable-Grinding/dp/B00JFHHMN2/ref=sr_1_5?s=kitchen&ie=UTF8&qid=1422936641&sr=1-5&keywords=coffee+grinder

I have a great, simple Black & Decker grinder that works like a champ, but is MUCH messier than this fine unit. You can remove the grinding chamber easily and hold it over the sink while scooping out your grounds for your filter.
I bought a lousy G.E. grinder has an auto-shut off variable grind sucks - large, small, powder all in same batch every time, and it no longer will run w/o holding it manually.

UPDATE 2018 AUG: VERY NOISY, the parts that broke make it must less convenient/neat and quiet. Unfortunately, the wonderful EPICA model linked above is no longer available. If you're careful with this one, it works great while it lasts.

reviews.reviewTitle: Now I know why people grind their beans
reviews.reviewText: It started when I was madly shopping & bought some 8oclock coffee WHOLE BEANS. Couldn't even make a cup because I couldn't grind the beans. Bought the grinder & it's as simple as could be. Read some of the silly reviews about "oh the cord's too short" and "can't clean the basket". The cord is clipped underneath & since I don't stretch mine ten feet to grind my beans, I left it short. As for the cleaning the basket, once a week or longer is sufficient for me. For heaven's sakes, you grind beans ONLY once a day or so. It's like the sugar bowl, in my eyes, and how often does that get cleaned? Not daily, even for OCD people. It has a little sweeper that you can spin around the basket to get the grounds out. You set the buttons for how many cups you need, the grinding level & VOILA! Push the magic button and it stops on it's own.

reviews.reviewTitle: Long time owner of this model - it is GREAT!
reviews.reviewText: I have owned this grinder for YEARS and it is great! Easy to use, works well and has multiple settings for coarse to very fine grinding. Don't bother with the more expensive models, Mr. Coffee will do you just fine. I ordered this one for my mom because I KNOW it is a quality product. I wish the cord was a little longer, but that is usually the case with kitchen products for safety reasons -- I get it. I was really happy to find this EXACT model. It was just want I needed. :)

I love this grinder! The little basket has ribs that move so that it scrapes the sides so all the grounds come out. The programmable # of cups and coarseness features are wonderful. For the price, this is an amazing and high quality item!

reviews.reviewTitle: I liked it but it was somewhat inconvenient to use and ...
reviews.reviewText: I have used a cuisinart coffee grinder for a number of years until it recently broke. I liked it but it was somewhat inconvenient to use and made a mess everywhere. This Mr. Coffee grinder is less than half the price, is very easy and convenient to use, and does not drop coffee grinds all over the counter top. You can grind just the amount you need and always have fresh ground coffee. The parts are plastic, so I will be interested to see how it holds up with use.

Much better than I expected. Grinds my coffee beans to perfection for a no-paper filter drip coffee maker. My settings are for 4 cups and fine grind and 4 rounded tablespoons of beans. Then I add three cups of water and end up with two 8oz cups of coffee. Been making it that way every day since late December 2016 and is still performing on Super Bowl Sunday 2017. Love that I can use the automatic dishwasher to clean the grinder + hopper.

This is a great grinder but there is always just ONE bean that doesn't get grinded fully. I don't know why nor have I ever had another grinder to see if this happens all the time (which I would assume it does). The best feature for me is that you can hold down the grinding button and it will stop on its own based on the setting you have it on. Overall it does the job and I'm happy.

This is probably pretty good for a bladed coffee grinder, but it left me disappointed. I have only used it a couple of times, but that was enough to make me wish I would have just bought a burr grinder instead of spending money on this and then buying a burr grinder. I bought this and a french press because I wanted to make a nice cup of coffee for my girlfriend on her birthday. For french press you need a nice even coarse grind. The grind this produces is anything but even. After several attempts and even rocking it back and forth while grinding, I have yet to succeed in a coarse grind that is anything close to uniform. I always ended up with some beans that were still fairly intact, some that were way too fine, and some that were just about right. I suspect it might do better at a finer grind where it runs much longer and can pulverize the crap right out of the beans.

Likes:
I liked the easy removal of the grinding cup for easy cleaning and for easy access to the grounds.
I also liked that it times the grind based on setting the volume of beans you added and your desired coarseness.
Dislikes:
Very uneven grind.

This was a last min purchase but I bought it based on reviews and am pleasantly surprised that they were correct. This is a very easy to use, clean and store. It does have the 3 ground settings and they work great. The grinder stops when it has finished grinder. It is great.

Great little grinder. Picked it up in a pinch after my husband broke my big burrmill, my only complaint is you have to sit and hold the top down while it grinds, an on button you could press and walk away from would be nice.

Works well overall. We have a burr grinder for our better coffee beans, but use this for flavored coffees and travel. I had an identical version of this that eventually failed because the plastic cage inside broke. Hopefully it will last just as long as the first one (many years). It's a little bit loud, but grinds consistently and is easy to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Havent't used it much yet but seems to work well
reviews.reviewText: It is easy to use as the controls are pretty self-explanatory. Once I figured out how to get the cover on right so it would start the grinding process; it has worked well. I have noticed a few un-ground beans in the coffee maker after brewing but not enough to be of great concern.

I like that this grinder has different settings to use depending on the amount and consistency. However, I bought this grinder to use with my French press (which requires a more coarse grind) to find that no matter the setting or duration, I am always left with a residue that slips through my press into my cup. It would be perfect for a coffee pot, but not a press.

I ordered this about 4 months ago. I use it almost every day and it works great. I like that you set it and then it automatically stops grinding when it reaches the settings you set it for. It arrived on time and in perfect condition. I do recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best coffee grinder I ever owned!
reviews.reviewText: This is the bomb! Seriously. It allows you to grind a normal quantity of coffee beans and also select between coarse, medium and fine grind (I'm presuming you don't have to grind really large quantities of coffee beans at once). The "chamber maid" mechanism helps to get the bottom, oily part of the ground coffee out of the grinder without getting the coffee grounds all over the place (or your fingers). BEST OF ALL, you can pop the entire grinding chamber off and put it in the dishwasher--you can't beat that with a stick! The snap on part is a little tricky to get used to and you have to play with it a bit to line up the grind chamber with the grind motor button. But this is a small inconvenience considering time saved not having to clean up coffee grinds that inevitibly get all over everything. Convenient, useful and very cost effective, I might add. Like I said, this thing's the bomb.

This is one of the loudest coffee grinders I have ever purchased it does get the job done the grind is perfect especially with the grind selections but it definitely is loud especially when you are trying to make coffee in the next room from where someone is sleeping
But like I said great grinder especially for the price

The top container part does detach, but there a few parts that water can get in that you can't get try so that bothers me. I've not actually ever had a different coffee Grinder so I couldn't tell you comparing it to anything else. I mean it seems to grind the coffee (or I've ground a few other things in it before) just fine, but just wish it was more cleanable. But this is the cheapest option I've found, so for the price I am fine with it!

After 27 years using my Krups grinder, I hadn't realized that the blades actually get dull, as does the pulverized coffee. With my Buy 3 Get 1, I decided to try a different grinder, and this one caught my eye. I like, very much, the ability to remove the grinder cup and use it alone (not the whole grinder) to transfer the ground coffee. And I like being able to wash it. I also like having an adjustable but consistent grinding time. I'm still trying to decide just which setting to use, but am happy that I have the choice and that, once set, the grind will remain consistent. I would prefer that water didn't get between the base and the bowl (you'll see what I mean if you buy it), but I think I'll try the dishwasher occasionally to prevent any "culture" growth.

Do note that the cord is not as short as it appears (and as has been complained about). While it's a good idea to keep the cord as short as is practical and safe, there's more cord available - you just need to "unspool" it. It's a tiny bit tricky, but you can unwind more cord from the base.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working after a couple of uses.
reviews.reviewText: I thought it was a good brand. I have used it only a couple of times but it has already stopped working. I always cleaned it after use and I do not understand why it isn't working any more. Unfortunately, my return window has already closed so I cannot even return it.

I didn't know a grinder could affect the taste of coffee this much. Using the "fine" setting I'm getting a lot more flavor out of good-enough Costco coffee.

I appreciate things about the design like the ability to remove the grinding chamber. I miss the self-storing cable of my old grinder. I just wrap the cable around this one.

Pleased with the value so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little grinder, can't beat the price!
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this for my Husband for Christmas, along with a few pound of coffee beans. So he has been using it several times a week since he got it and he loves it. This coffee grinder does it's job efficiently and quickly. No complaints other then how loud it is, but hey... it's a GRINDER, you can't expect something to be quiet while it's grinding coffee beans!

Pros:
-Fast
-Does a good job
-Nice appearence
-Small and easily stowed away
-Ample cord length
-Multiple settings that do work
-Great bang for your buck$$$$!

Cons:
-Pulling the cord out is a little scary and you think you're going to break it.
-Loud (It doesn't bother me when I'm still in bed and he uses it, but there was a night we had our Neice & Nephew over and because they slept in the family room off the kitchen I advised against not using it that morning. It definately would have startled them.)

That's really all I can think of! I would highly recommend this little grinder :)

reviews.reviewTitle: The cord is much longer than you think!
reviews.reviewText: I was seriously so mad when I tried to operate this grinder. I thought the cord was only 3 inches long. I read the reviews and realized it could be unwound to a much longer length. After finding out that information I am more than thrilled with this grinder. The cord storage is great (after figuring it out) and it grinds wonderfully. You do have to manually hold down the lid but, it is a timed grind so it takes out all the guess work. We have a small kitchen and this takes up a lot less space, can be stored easily, and looks nice on the counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: This company is impossible to work with!
reviews.reviewText: Weve had one of these grinders for years and when it broke we bought another one. The one we bought, however broke within 3 weeks of buying it. When we tried to contact the company they emailed once for more information and then we havent heard back again. Ive emailed 3 more times and heard nothing. Its not worth the money to die in 3 weeks and no way to get any answers!

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this - but it's not Sailor resistant
reviews.reviewText:
This is the second grinder of this model that I've had. Actually, this one seems more solid and better built than my last one. What I like most about this is that the bowl is removable so I'm not tipping it upside down to transfer the coffee from the grinder to the coffee pot. I also like that it has a timer that shuts off the grinder when the grind has reached it's desired coarseness.

<edit> I had my previous model for years and bought this because I liked it. Alas, I've had in onboard and in use for just over a month and someone has managed to break one of the tines on the chamber maid cleaning system. I had one of these break on my other one and everything still worked fine.

Everything still works, it's just that the cleaning system really doesn't do a very good job of cleaning the grounds from the bowl and the tines for it are not very durable.

Been using for about 7 months now and it works just like it should. The grind quality can be inconsistent at times. Easy to clean and it doesn't make a large mess all over the counter when it's used, unlike my other one that will remain nameless.

After some bad grinding of coffee beans at my local grocery store using their bad grinder, I thought it was time to do it myself at home. This grinder got some good reviews and it allowed for programming, which I preferred. It also goes with my Mr. Coffee brewer. After a few uses it seems to be just what I needed. Fresh ground coffee,

When I received this product, I plugged it right in to try it out. The motor was going, but the blade wouldn't spin. The nut that holds the blade on was completely stripped right from the get-go and wouldn't catch onto the motor. I called Mr. Coffee customer service and asked just for them to send me a new bolt. They said they would just send me a whole new grinder. Three weeks go by and it never came. I ended up going out and buying a nut myself that fit the blade, but it was all just a big headache. The grinder works fine for the price, but be aware that you might run into issues with cheap parts.

My old grinder died or and I replaced it with this. This grinder works great. I especially like the timed grind so it takes the guess work out of how long do I grind for. I use a French press and the coarseness of the grind is great. Makes for a nice clean cup of coffee.

Works exactly as advertised! Heres a tip though, I like my coffee ground really fine, so fill it, and push and hold the button until its done, then press and hold it again, only while its foing the second time, tap the edge of it, and it will help the coffee grounds recirculate better, and grind even finer!

reviews.reviewTitle: For some reason the coffee comes out weak for me ...
reviews.reviewText: For some reason the coffee comes out weak for me with this grinder despite following the setting guides. I have never had this problem before and don't have it when using already ground coffee in the same coffee maker. I think this doesn't grind coffee quite as well as it should and the measurements may also be off.

reviews.reviewTitle: May not produce the type of grind you want
reviews.reviewText: It mechanically grinds without any issues, but just don't expect the grind to be perfect. I'm using this primarily for cold brewing, so I'm looking for a coarse grind. I don't find value in the preset sizes and grinds. The results don't match up with what is intended. Most of the time it comes out as medium. I find it easier to just pulse and check.

Excellent product from Mr. Coffee! Though the "chambermaid cleaning system" is not exactly perfect, I will say this removable bucket is far easier to use than my 30-something year old grinder from Black&Decker (when they were really good products!). The fact you can remove it, place the cup in the dishwasher is reason-enough to purchase this product! You select the grind, hold down the button on-top until it stops, and voila! you're ready to brew! No guessing on how long for a certain amount of coffee! Using Peet's Coffee all the time, you get the perfect amount of grind for the type of brewer. I have both a drip and French-Press method brewers, so this grinder is ideal. Reasonably-priced, but does a great job for those of us who are not quite coffee-experts, but like the taste of the stuff! I am going to experiment to see if I can create a micro-grind with this grinder (like Starbucks uses for their instant coffee).

We bought 2 of this grinder, one worked great but the other one just worked for a couple times and stopped working. Bcoz we leave it in the vacation home, and we don't use it much. Amazon, Please advise what's your return/repair policy..coz i'm on my computer for almost 30 mins and could not find a solution? Very frustrating..Being Prime for so many years, first time trying to return/replace an item...

I like that it senses how long to grind the beans for, however I have a hard time lining up the lid so that it will press down and start. Also is hard to clean, and if you put it in the dishwasher, water gets trapped in areas and it doesn't dry.

Many years ago I had a high-end bur grinder and spent more timing digging in the tines getting beans unstuck than I did drinking coffee but yet I was worried about this being just a lowly blade grinder. Not too expensive so I thought I'd give it a whirl. This thing is great! Very, very happy and works like a champ.

reviews.reviewTitle: It has worked awesome so far
reviews.reviewText: I bought two. One for my coffee beans and one as a spice grinder. It has worked awesome so far. I haven't had any problems and its easy to take apart and clean. I would recommend this product for either coffee or spices. It does say that using as a spice grinder shortens the life of the product, but I have not had it long enough to know that.
Works like it should but after using it for a while the button you use to select the grind is stuck on coarse and will not change.

reviews.reviewTitle: I wanted a coffee grinder, not a lemon
reviews.reviewText: Stopped working for no apparent reason and has been rarely used. The capacity of the amount of coffee you can grind at once is pretty low.

Ive owned this exact coffee grinder since I was 18 and moved out of the parents house. It lasted me 24 years and when the husband broke it I made sure that we got the same exact one to replace it. I love this coffee grinder!

reviews.reviewTitle: Broken within one year, impossible to reach customer service for warranty
reviews.reviewText:
The coffee grinder broke within one year.
I tried calling them through phone and was put on hold for over half hour, i also tried sending email for support and so far receives no response at all.
Avoid this product at all cost and buy something else with better quality

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder for multiple methods of coffee making
reviews.reviewText: Great as you can select the grind and amount and it will stop automatically. We used this to grind coffee for our french press, pour over, and an aeropress coffee maker (I know, we somehow ended up with 3 coffee makers). Very happy with it! Perhaps my only complaint is that it is hard to clean, but I dont think this is unique to this grinder.

If you are on a budget of getting a good burr grinder then this blade grinder is for you. The trick to get consistent grind size is to pulse it and shake instead of pressing down the lid and let it do the work. Absolutely not bad but not perfect, but for this price what would you expect?

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not purchase unless you want frustration with that coffee
reviews.reviewText: This is the second unit I have purchased, and it failed after 3 grinds. Not 3 bags, 3 GRINDS. Just locked up. Engine gets REAL hot, and without warning the device refuses to budge or grind. First one I thought I broke, now I know its just crappy device.

I use this to grind espresso. I have to do two cycles with it set to maximum size and fines grind, but it does it. A nice powder.

It's noisy, sounds like a mini blender since that's basically what it is.

It could be easier to clean and it's kinda difficult to pour the grounds into the espresso tin basket without making a mess, but it's not huge deal.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product - especially for the price!
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this Mr. Coffee grinder for about 5 years and it's been spectacular. While moving to a new house I decided to get a new coffee maker and grinder, so the old ones went to Goodwill - well worn, but still functional - and I've just received the new replacement grinder that I ordered (same model).

reviews.reviewTitle: Shake it if you wanna make it.
reviews.reviewText: It grinds, but not uniformly. It tends to create a gradient of different coarseness from fine on the bottom of the container to coarse on the top. It leaves full beans on the top, actually, but not a lot. Maybe 5-10 beans out of a full container (fill line). I've found that shaking the grinder about halfway through the cycle makes it more uniform, but I'm sure Mr. Coffee would not recommend this action. Do it at your own risk, but it seems to work well for me.

The first one stopped working unexpectedly, so I purchased a second (YES I know, but we liked this one!!) Can remove and wash cup and grinding blades, BIG plus as we use it for herbs and seeds when we dry them for storage.

reviews.reviewTitle: Did a great job--when it worked
reviews.reviewText:
I'm getting this one to replace another which was a mess to operate. This model is easy to use and is much cleaner. Nice and compact too.

Addendum: I used it probably weekly, for about 2 months. I really liked it. Then all of a sudden, on a second grinding, it stopped. It looked like there was heat on the lower seam. The manual said that a thermal fuse probably burned out and see repair center. We are using it on our boat sailing in the Philippines--good luck with that! Why not a user replaceable fuse??? Now it's junk.

So be warned. Only use it for one pot of coffee.

If you have a proper espresso machine, even an inexpensive one like the Capresso or DeLonghi, then this will NOT grind the beans small enough to use effectively (I returned mine for this reason). You will need a proper burr grinder I'm afraid, although other that it seems like a fine machine for any other coffee making methods.

I bought this to make my own cold brew. I've used it twice and love it. I wish it would have come with a brush to get all of the grounds out. Otherwise, it's a great machine at a most affordable price.

This is an amazing little coffee grinder.Priced less than others, yet it does the job great. It also looks nice on my kitchen counter, a good conversation piece, since most people don't use coffee grinders.
I use mine to re-grind coffee bought in the can that's ground coarse , making myself fine ground espresso coffee.
I love getting things through Amazon, you'll find some incredible things...:)

We bought this for a friend. We already have one and love it! I gave 3 stars because the USPS delivery was terrible. The driver did not even attempt to drop off the package or ring the doorbell. Instead they marked ot as a failed delivery attempt and forced our friends to take the train, across town, to the post office to pick it up. Essentially that had to pay money for something they should have recieved for free. I feel like the hastle was not worth the value of the gift...

reviews.reviewTitle: Look no further - Ive tried them all
reviews.reviewText: Lost our (this) grinder during hurricane harvey. Looked up grinders again and saw a really cute one. Bought it. Big mistake - went straight in the trash and I came right back to this one. This coffee grinder is great! Different grind settings (fine - coarse), slim build, power cord wraps underneath, removable cup, all of it... look no further.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great coffee grinder for the price, just noisy!
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder is great, Mr. Coffee branded items have never let me down, so I decided to go with this one. You need to measure the beans you are putting in, select the right settings and hold the on button until it's complete. It's very noisy vs my old Hamilton Beach grinder, but, the cup also completely removes from the unit so it's very easy to clean. I use (right now) Kicking Horse HooDoo Jo, it's a very greasy bean, so tends to stick a lot (this being easy to clean helped here). Since today is the first day I'm using it, I can't comment on durability, though the construction seems to be solid. I gave it a 4/5 purely because of the noise factor...you are going to wake up anyone within 100 feet (not joking here).

This is my second purchase of the Mr. Coffee grinder. My first one hasn't worn out yet after about 6 years of daily use but I ordered one as a gift for a friend and bought myself a new one at the same time in the event that my first one eventually wears out. I'm a coffee snob, so when I got my first Mr Coffee grinder as a gift, I was skeptical but I really love it. You can set it to the number of cups you need and whether you want fine, medium or coarse grind. I drink expresso every morning, so I set it to 6 cups with a fine grind. It makes the perfect amount for 2 double espressos!

Not only was this delivered 4 days earlier than stated, it came solidly packed in a sturdy and padded envelope. Ever since receiving this, I've definitely put it through its paces. I've probably ground 25 pots of coffee in the past 3 days - yes.....I drink a LOT of coffee I guess - but it's held up wonderfully. It ground it perfectly for my FrenchPress, my Ninja with auto drip, and my stove boiler. This thing is well worth the money paid for it - heck - its worth it at 5 times the price!!!

Good powerful grinder. Automatically times the grinding time according to desired size of grounds and volume. I particularly appreciate the clever mechanism that sweeps the sides so that there is minimal coffee clinging inside. Coffee has a tendency to stick to the sides electrostatically.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty sure it wakes my neighbors up and thats all ...
reviews.reviewText: Pretty sure it wakes my neighbors up and thats all I really care about. I grind everything from baby teeth to loose screws in this bad boy and no matter what it sounds like Im releasing the kracken in my tiny kitchen. But really its very good at blending beans too.

Worked fine, until a few days ago - when it just stopped working. Indicator lights still illuminate, but now it won't grind at all. Used it maybe 15 times total. Beyond the return window with Amazon - so I would not bother with this product and keep looking.
Update: Contacted Mr.Coffee customer service via their website, and they are sending me a replacement. I upped the rating to 3 stars, and if it turns out the replacement does not have this same problem, I will up it to 5 stars. When it works, it is better than most of the others, and far better if you factor the price.
Update #2: Replacement item arrived within a week of reporting the problem. This one hasn't given me any problems and works great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Kind of uneven but it works
reviews.reviewText: This works nicely as were not horribly picky about how our grounds turn out however Ive notice that it does turn out pretty uneven, meaning if most of it is fine therell still be some coarse chunks no matter how long you let it run. Overall though it works perfectly for what I need.

Bought this as part of a wedding gift for the groom. I have had the same grinder for over 7 years, which I bought from Amazon, and have had no trouble with mine. I like all the features and is very easy to hand wash. Mine still looks like new and I use it all the time.
