I've been using this for a few months now and I really like it. I like that it has different grind settings. It works really well, nothing like fresh ground coffee in the morning!

reviews.reviewTitle: Must have for the true coffee connoisseur
reviews.reviewText: Great value....great product. Wife decided she wanted to start grinding her coffee fresh......so we got this for home and it worked so well I got her one for her office! Great and compact for the true "coffee snob".
Everything is good, Just a Little louder than I expected.. Could probably wake up your roommates when you try grinding coffee beans in the morning, so I always do it at Night..

The top screwing off is awesome for clean up. You can either scoop out of the top as the lid lifts, or you can just unscrew the whole top. It's really pretty cool. I run it through the dishwasher no problem.

I read a few complaints that its "loud". Wow. Seriously? Uh yah. Coffee grinders are loud. That's like saying "the sun is bright". Don't let that deter you.

This thing works great. Best grinder I've ever had.

Update: 16 months later with almost daily use, still works like new. Perfect condition.

Update 6-21-2015: Still works perfectly!! A little workhorse for sure.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for coffee beans! Also great for everything else, especially spices! (and even peppers with some reinforcement)
reviews.reviewText: This is an excellent coffee grinder! My first one was purchased on ebay, and it failed when I was using it to pulverize dried peppers. So I found the weak spots and fixed them immediately when I got this one. I removed the "chamber maid" completely, as it isn't that great, and when a pepper hits it at the right angle, it gets ripped off and jams up the blade, therefore stripping out the gear on the bottom of the chamber. In addition to that, i added a few drops of turbine oil to the shaft and covered the rubber gear with a thin coating of jb-weld to reinforce it. So far this thing is awesome, but I use my ninja for pulverizing peppers now, as it is quicker and holds more.

reviews.reviewTitle: The perfect inexpensive grinder with a digital timer!
reviews.reviewText: I enjoy coffee, and fresh ground coffee is the best. I know burr grinders produce better grounds, but they are usually very expensive and large. For less than $20 you get a small blade grinder that includes a digital timer that automatically shuts off according to the amount & grind setting you want. Super easy to measure, adjust, and just hold down the grind button until it is done. No manually timing yourself! The top tips up for easy pouring, and you can also as easily remove parts and clean it with a paper towel. Stylish with a integrated cord wrap, this is a great grinder. A few beans miss the blade and don't get as ground as they should, but overall it consistently makes great ground coffee for a super price point!

reviews.reviewTitle: THIS WORKS WELL, I LOVE IT
reviews.reviewText: I've used several grinders, this is the best one so far. Inexpensive, but grinds consistently to whatever setting you put in, as long as you DONT go past the "full" mark. I am going to probably buy another one for summer cottage. Very happy with this piece.

If your looking for an basic grinder thats economical... this is one for you. Smaller beans grind great but Ive issues with larger beams on multiple occasions .... cleaning is easy and its smalls - so it doesnt take up a lot of space.

reviews.reviewTitle: Spend more, buy a nicer one
reviews.reviewText:
Meh. I wish I had spent more and bought something nicer. This doesnt do a great job of thoroughly grinding all the beans. Even if I am only grinding a small amount it takes several tries. Lots of shaking, shifting etc.
most frustrating is that you have to untwist the cup holding the beans, retwist and then start again. It has to be at just the right connection point to work. Its aggravating.

This grinder has been great. It's easy to use and clean, and it does the job well. If you are looking for a grinder and don't want to shell out big bucks for the top ends one, you can't go wrong with this grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: This thing is a great value. I've had mine for a long time ...
reviews.reviewText: This thing is a great value. I've had mine for a long time now and it's still going strong after regular use. It doesn't offer the most consistent grind out there, but it does a serviceable job and I don't think it does anything to affect the taste. And you can't beat the price.

I like the different settings available depending on what cup you have and it's not super loud. You have many options on how you would want to twist it too (the whole ground holder, just the top, or the top and half more).

I went through the whole jungle of bur grinders out there, and thought it might be a little too expennsive right off the bat. I know blade grinders don't compare in consistency to the bur grinders, but I think this one does the job pretty well.

For a first grinder it works to my expectations. It's nice that it has settings for the amount of beans you want to grind as well as the type of grind you'd want to produce. It takes the guesswork out of thinking about how long to grind for. You just hold the button down and when it stops you're done. I will point out that sometimes the consistency of the grind is a little off. I've found half beans in the mix sometimes. No biggy though, just hit the button for a little longer. It seems the more beans in the grinder, the more consistent the grind, as the beans aren't hopping around everywhere.

For sure I'll be buying another bur grinder later, but this will definitely do for the time being.

I bought this for my husband for our anniversary and he seems to love it. It grinds the coffee to the perfect consistency and it does it quickly. It's pretty easy to clean and looks nice sitting on the counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: This grinder works great however there're a lot of bells and whistles that ...
reviews.reviewText: This grinder works great however there're a lot of bells and whistles that make it cumbersome to use. It is not automatic; you have to hold the button to grind and there's not an auto shut off or anything, which negates the measurements and choice of grind (fine, med. etc) The reservoir & lid can be a juggling act. For the price I'll buy another and donate this one to Goodwill.

This grinder is perfect for oily flavored beans. I use a different grinder for unflavored beans. This grinder is so easy to use and easy to clean. It prevents my regular beans from being tainted with flavor in my other grinder.
I love it.

This is the worst coffee grinder I have ever purchased. The grind is completely uneven and inconsistent. I bought it cause I make several different types of coffee brews (French press, pour over and cold brew) so I needed to be able to adjust the grind. The machine has settings to create the grind you want but it doesnt seem to me that there is any difference in them. Coffee also gets trapped under blades. Dont buy this! In my experience the best grinders are the simple less expensive ones.

This is so much better than my previous grinder, and costs the same. Soooo easy to clean and use. Nothing negative to say about this. I use it to grind course coffee for my French press and it works perfectly.

reviews.reviewTitle: You get what you pay for...
reviews.reviewText: I cannot say I'm thrilled with this product, as much as I would like to... It's footprint may be small, but so is the grinding chamber. I have to make three batches of beans to fill my cold brew filter. The grind is uneven, and in my opinion not coarse, even though it's set on the course setting. I guess it's time to invest a little more money and get a burr coffee grinder.

This item works as expected. I love to be able to grind my own coffee at home! I actually work around coffee so I know that it's best to have freshly ground coffee to have optimal flavor. While there are many nice burr grinders available, I wanted a little one that I could bring with me if needed! Works well for it's purpose. While I would love more customization for the grind, as opposed to "course, medium, and fine" it's understandable that such a price efficient grinder lacks these options.

I love this item. The fact that there is a space for the wire under the grinder is nice. It makes it easier to store in a cabinet. The reason this item received 4 items from me is that the default cup capacity and grind level are set up and they stay the way they were used the last time. I always use fine grinding and the maximum capacity, while the default is 4 cups and medium. This does not impact the great function of the grinder. It does not get hot after multiple round of usage and seems like it would last for some while.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great! The self-cleaning element described is basically a plastic ...
reviews.reviewText:
Works great!

The self-cleaning element described is basically a plastic piece that fits snuggly against the side. You manually move this piece back/forth, and it scrapes coffee grinds off the sides.

This is a great grinder with a low price tag. It grinds my coffee beans perfectly every morning. I use the ground beans in a French press and it works great. This product is powerful and doesnt take up much space.

I believe I got a defective unit, as in a lot of other reviews on products, a couple of people give an affordable great product a bad review. In this case I got what seemed like a great product at a good price point and the thing couldn't last 4 weeks on normal use, every other day or so. Thing just stopped working and the lights won't even come on. I'm past the return period and I don't know if there is even a warranty on this thing. I'll have to buy something else possibly dip into the $40-$50 category to get something that should last at least 2 years, not 1 month.

This grinder is great for the price. I have a delonghi espresso machine and the grind is very important for espresso. You are able to get the grind to be very course, or powder if you need. Keep in mind that if you don't rotate the grinder while you are using it, then you can end up with inconsistent grind. You will have powder at the very bottom and courser grinds toward the top. Rotating it back and forth and shaking it while pulsing the grinder helps with this. It is not perfect, but for the price, I highly recommend.

owned this grinder for five years before having to replace it recently ... purchased a Hamilton Beach grinder which I wasn't pleased with ... returned it and bought this one again and very pleased ... easy to use and in hopes this replacement will last another five years! very good for the price,

reviews.reviewTitle: Quality has really dropped to the point this is absolutely not worth it.
reviews.reviewText:
I got this grinder for the first time about 10 or 11 years ago. LOVED IT. Well made and lasted me until a month ago. A month ago the cleaning chamber broke but I was still happy I got so much use out of it. I decided I'm going to replace it with the same grinder so of course I came onto Amazon and ordered it. When it came home, I was very happy. I threw out the box immediately with the old one in it was excited to continue using the new one.
I have to say I am extremely disappointed in the new one. It doesn't grind well at all (when I empty the grinds after making coffee, I see quite a bit of unground beans on the top), there seems to be a gap between the cover and the main device (the cover being the one where you have to push down to operate it) which makes a lot of coffee bean mess come out. The sound of grinding too is just not great. Very very disappointed.

Works perfectly, exactly what we were looking for. Got a big 5 lb bag of Don Pablo Organic coffee beans on here, and bought this to go with it. Have had no problems at all. We grind enough to fill a jar and have enough for the week. Super happy with this purchase.
As far as blade grinders go, this thing is great. You can adjust the cups and grind size. If youre looking for a inexpensive grinder this one is perfect.
Works well& has a nice feature they call a chambermaid that you rotate inside the area where the coffee beans were ground that helps get more grounds out

reviews.reviewTitle: I think this is a good little grinder for the price
reviews.reviewText: I think this is a good little grinder for the price. I like that there is no guessing in how much to put or how long to grind the beans. I just wish the lid felt a little more heavy duty. I feel like if I drop it once on my concrete floors that will be the end of it

The Mr. Coffee Electric Coffee Grinder is very, very, very loud. It seriously sounds like I am firing up a weed wacker in my kitchen. I have tried placing it on a pot holder or wrapping it up in a dishtowel to muffle the noise with no success. For the past few months I have been grinding the beans at night so I don't have to hear it in the morning. I'm giving up. It is going in the trash. The unit is hard to clean due but I'd put up with it if it was quieter.
Does not grind very well, I see whole beans after grinding for a long time. Also it's hard to clean and very hard to put back together after cleaning. Get what you pay for I guess is the rule.

Bought this in June of 2017. It has been a wonderful tool in our kitchen, we grind coffee daily. Today I must purchase another one because the built-in scraper cracked. Over 600 pots of coffee for initially $13 was well worth it! The only reason for 4 stars was I have to buy a new one and the motor is still chugging.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great while it lasted. One month
reviews.reviewText: Great while it lasted, stopped women already. About a month of use. Only used for coffee , just won't work now. Ensured switch it being pushed and nothing. Sealed unit so can't look inside.
They said it grinds coarse... it even has a coarse setting. I got powder with half chewed up beans... I'll stick with my manual grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just a little extra work in the mornings.
reviews.reviewText:
I have had this grinder for about a month now and use it about 3 times a week, give or take. Thus far, it works quite well and I have had no issues. That being said, I do have one criticism, and that has to do with the design of the inside chamber. The lid is easy to take off but appears as though it was designed to stay on while you empty the fresh grounds into your coffee pot, but it might as well not be. Each and every time I have used this grinder, I have had to take the lid off and gently hit it against the base several times to try and knock loose the grounds stuck to the lid. What is worse is the amount of grounds that get stuck inside, either under the blades or against these 3 pieces of plastic that hug the walls of the chamber and attach to the lid. Instead of holding down the button and just dumping the grounds into my coffee pot, I spend a few minutes each morning trying to shake out the grounds invariably get stuck inside. I think today is the first day I didn't end up with some grounds on my counter. And yes, I do realize no grinder is going to be spotless when you empty the chamber, but I suspect most grinders wont hold on to anywhere from a teaspoon to a tablespoon of grounds when you turn it upside down and gently hit the bottom.

I concede this is my first coffee grinder, and perhaps this is a common issue for most grinders. While I wish I had known about this issue before buying this particular grinder, I can't say it would have prevented me from buying it. It isn't a terrible inconvenience, just a minor annoyance with a product I am otherwise quite happy with.

For fine ground coffee this is what you want. Good price, easy to use. It really does not do a great job with coarse grinding though. Lotta fine grinds in there so kinda tough to get a decent setup for french press and cold brewing.

BUT its a solid run of the mill drip coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: you could not really adjust the grinding size, although ...
reviews.reviewText: you could not really adjust the grinding size, although it has 3 different setting the grinded beans are about the same size. However it does the job perfectly and worth the price!

Great little grinder. Wish it would hold a few more beans at a time, but otherwise happy with the purchase. Especially love the easy clean system for getting the grounds off the sides of the container. Also very happy with the auto-shut off. Ground size settings work as expected. Would buy again.

reviews.reviewTitle: not as good as it used to be.
reviews.reviewText: I got one of these 9 years ago for my wedding. The plastic piece inside the grinder broke so I decided to order another one. It seems perhaps they aren't made as well as they were 9 years ago because the motor doesn't seem as powerful and it seems we have to grind for twice as long...

reviews.reviewTitle: Best coffee grinder for the money
reviews.reviewText: Best coffee grinder for the money, better or equal to others that cost much, much more. Good product, seems to be well made, especially for the price. I've had one for years that has been well-used and is working just as well as ever; this purchase was a second one to take to work and I'm just as pleased with it as with my old one, so far. Thankful they haven't made any design changes or "improvements" as companies sometimes do. This is fine as is and I highly recommend it.

Smells like battery that might explode only used it for like 2 minutes and it stopped tried it again it stopped i was wondering what the smell was it has to be the battery idk if its worth returning unless its free to return
Does it's job well. Takes time to figure out the right setting for what you want but that is just part of learning. It is not real easy to clean but with a little patience it gets done.

I have been extremely happy with this coffee bean grinder. It has very many nice features on it and easy to clean. The price was fantastic. Would recommend this to anyone looking for an inexpensive well made coffee bean grinder. Nice looking to boot!

Great little machine. You're clearly not going to get a burr level grind, but I've found this to be more than adequate for my coffee snobbery. I use it every morning to make coffee with a French press, and it does a great job.
Better for spices than coffee. It was better to use pre ground coffee rather than a blade grinder. Finally got a decent bur grinder and it was game changing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds beans just fine, except for espresso beans
reviews.reviewText:
Grinds beans just fine, except for espresso beans. This is never getting anywhere close to fine enough for espresso. We compared the finest grinds from this to a standard can of Lavazza espresso grounds and it was like softballs to marbles.

If you want it for coffee grounds, it's unbeatable for $10. If you want espresso grounds, save your pennies and buy a real grinder that's specifically designed for it.
I grind it on fine for a drip coffee maker. Medium leaves too many large pieces. Otherwise am happy with it. Does well on top shelf in dishwasher and appears to be made from quality materials.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'd buy a different one if I had to do it over again.
reviews.reviewText: Man this thing sucks. My old one you just hit a button and it ground until it was done. This one you have to hold. Its also a pain to clean this things, taking it apart and putting it back together is a small jigsaw puzzle. Very disappointing purchase.
I used this grinder while on deployment, about six times a day for 180 straight days and its stoll going strong. I bought two more, one for my house and one for my office.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent coffee grinder!! Multiple settings are fantastic! Easy to use and easy to clean! 100% worth the cost!! (Cheap!)
reviews.reviewText: An excellent coffee grinder that's got enough different settings for any type of grind you want and is easy to use and easy to clean. Perfect for anyone who really loves fresh ground coffee! Best coffee grinder I've ever had, and for a super reasonable price!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Effectively Broken, barely six months old.
reviews.reviewText: Well, I mean I guess it lasted a few months. All the plastic ripped off the seams on the inside and ground up into my coffee. Even when this piece of garbage did work, the grind consistency was really poor. Mozy on elsewhere for a piece of craftsmanship. On the positive side, it even grinds up plastic semi-effectively.
Only had it for less than a week and just stopped working. Used it about 10 times before it just stopped grinding. It lights up but will not grind when you push the button. Terrible product.

We had this grinder for just a few months and only use it 2 to 3 times a week, maximum. It caught on fire in my kitchen! Had to throw it away. Too bad. It was nice up until it almost burned my kitchen to the ground.

reviews.reviewTitle: Gets the job done pretty well, I tend to grind smaller amounts in ...
reviews.reviewText: Gets the job done pretty well, I tend to grind smaller amounts in it, otherwise you'll end up with more chunks. Kind of messy but dishwasher safe, so that works for me. I don't grind coffee daily, so for those rare occasions, it works great.

reviews.reviewTitle: This holds just the right amount to make a pot of coffee and the settings are super easy to switch
reviews.reviewText:
I started getting into buying beans instead of ground coffee so I decided to stop using a friend's grinder all the time.

This holds just the right amount to make a pot of coffee and the settings are super easy to switch. They work like they say and I have had no issues so far with the blades or motor smelling like it was going to blow. For the price this is such a good little grinder that also looks very sleek in the kitchen.

Also the plastic case comes off the top so you can clean this one which is super simple to wash everytime you use it, its just like washing out a cup as all the parts inside the holding tank move around the wall of the container so just stick a sponge inside and wipe and the parts will move with the sponge.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only used 3 times and the motor is dead.
reviews.reviewText: Bought this item over a year ago so I don't seem to have a return option. I don't grind a lot of coffee so I just used it for the third time and in the process of grinding some coffee beans, it stopped. I tried to let it sit for a while, tried different outlets but to no avail. Seems the durability is pretty low. If you think you'll want to use it more than a couple of times I would consider another product.

reviews.reviewTitle: This grinder does a good job so it gets five stars
reviews.reviewText: This grinder does a good job so it gets five stars. However, it is a little frustrating to put the grinder bowl and top to lock in place and to take apart. I am sure it's just me.

This works well but it is not a burr grinder. You put the beans in the top cup, set the grind and time, then hold down the top button until the grinding stops. You then take the cup off the machine and pour the coffee into your filter. The problem is, no matter how much grinding, there is always a layer of big chips on top of the grounds when the coffee is done. I never see them when I look into the cup or in the filter after I pour the coffee in. The coffee always tastes good, though.

I used to have two really nice bean grinder at home, made in Italy and made in Japan. Since I've moved out, I just want to get something simple and cheap. As a coffee grinder, this little thing does its job, sometimes the beans don't come out like they should be but good enough if you want to save time grinding your beans manually. If you're not too picky about details (EX, uneven sized ground coffee )it's a great product at a great price

reviews.reviewTitle: BROKEN AFTER ONE WEEK OF HAVING IT!!!
reviews.reviewText: I used my Mr.Coffee and started smelling this burning chemical or rubber/plastic smell. Then it stopped working. I though it might have overheated. So I pulled the plug out and plugged it in later and it doesnt work anymore. Not worth it! Very disappointed!

reviews.reviewTitle: A great grinder with several features for grinding
reviews.reviewText: A great grinder with several features for grinding. You hold down the button after youve dialed in the settings you want, and it stops itself automatically. (You most hold button down but it will stop automatically)

reviews.reviewTitle: Thing broke within a few months of using it
reviews.reviewText: It stopped working a few months into using it. Not really sure what went wrong but it just wouldn't come on. Was a waste of my money tbh
I put up with my old coffee grinder for years and finally broke down and bought a new one. Love it! The value from Amazon was $$$ cheaper than at Meijer.
This is the second one of this coffee grinder I have bought in 10 years. The old one still grinds great, but my sister wanted one too.

I wanted this to make espresso, and it worked okay. There were always larger chunks no matter how long you ground for and the settings didn't really seem to change anything. Then I dropped it and it stopped working, my bad.

I have owned this grinder for approx 2 months now. It is esthetically pleasing, you can leave it out on the counter. The grind in very good, I am not a coffee grinder expert but this grinder does the job and it does it well. I can see if someone is particular about how fine or how the coffee is ground, how they would have complaints about this grinder. However if you are a normal, everyday coffee drinker then this grinder will work awesome for you. The grinder itself is not very loud, there is some noise, I mean its grinding coffee, but its really nominal. The bowl itself has these spinning arms on the inside that you can spin around the get some of the loose coffee grinds out. The only complaint I have, is the way the bowl is designed, the base of the bowl is metal, but the clear plastic from the top pf the bowl wraps down around the metal part, when you wash the bowl, the water get in between the metal and the plastic. This does not affect the way the machine works, but if you're particular like I am, it will bug you to see the water stuck there until it dry out naturally. Any rate, I would recommend this grinder to friends and family, pretty darn good machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: There are times when a mortar and pestle are better, but for a quick bit of cooking
reviews.reviewText: Wife bought me this to grind spices for my BBQ and indoor cooing rubs. There are times when a mortar and pestle are better, but for a quick bit of cooking, it's pretty awesome and does the job VERY well.
Great product at a great price. Grinds very fine for my espresso. Not obnoxiously loud. This is great for doing small amounts at a time, which is what I do. Not ideal for a pound of beans.
I've used a magic bullet for the past 6 years to grind my coffee beans... This works extremely better... night and day difference! No joke, better tasting coffee!!

First off, Im a daily coffee drinker - black, no sugar, no milk. No frills. That said, I have only used the grinder twice, I like this grinder for several reasons.
1) It worked right out of the box.
2) The green lights on the side of the grinder light up. Cute.
3) It was an Amazon lightning deal. So it was very inexpensive.
4) The top is removable into which to pour the coffee beans. The blades are in the cup holding the beans which can be lifted out of the unit so you can pour the grinded coffee into your coffee vault, coffee maker, etc.
5) The exterior of the coffee grinder is mainly a shiny black plastic. Modern clean look.

Ive read many of the reviews for this grinder & others. There are many picky reviews for grinders under $20.00.
What do people expect for less than $20.00? I will update this review in a few months. So far SOOOOO GOOD!

reviews.reviewTitle: ... a couple time already & so far it's been great. Might have to grind a little bit longer ...
reviews.reviewText: I've used it a couple time already & so far it's been great. Might have to grind a little bit longer to get all beans grinded but it does do what it's supposed to do. I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: This thing is great! Cheaper than single speed models
reviews.reviewText: This thing is great! Cheaper than single speed models, but the different coarseness options are great. Also like the very simple but useful addition of the swipe cage - gets all the fine powder that gets stuck in the crevices

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not grind enough for 12 cups.
reviews.reviewText: Does not grind enough beans for 12 cups of coffee. Since that is the reason why I bought it I am disappointed. I decided to keep it because it does work well, just not what I expected.
I bought this as a replacement to my other mr. coffee that died I use this thing every single day when this one dies I will be buying another one one great product easy to use.
Feels like it is going to break. The last one I had like this that died. I had it for 9 years thought I would get another one just like it and I regret I had not
At first I didn't know this had settings. Great for smaller amounts of coffee or anything you want to grind. I mostly use this for when I want to get stuff very small like my cinnamon sticks.
Product came used and filled with dirty coffee grounds. The person who had this before didnt bother even rinsing it out before returning it. Really disappointed...

I bought this product so I could make good coffee on deployment. I brought it with me unused (packed in original box), and have been here for less than a week. Ive used it three times and it worked fine. I woke up this morning, used my electric kettle to boil some water, and this grinder wouldnt work. Ive tried multiple outlets, converters, and step-downs, it still will not work. Waste of money, and now I cant make coffee.
happy with the purchase, works perfectly. Well, i would call it a multi-purpose grinder, especially for a Indian kitchen when you grind the spices quite often. the best thing is, you can wash it.

These are made to start wearing out from day one.
The part that stirs the grounds is made of plastic sticks
that come up from the bottom of the cup to the top and attach
to a plastic ring. These thin plastic sticks get worn down
to nothing by the grounds. It's like sand sanding plastic.
It's a poor and known design flaw that they know does what it does.
Consider this like a disposable Bic Lighter. That's about how long
they'll last. Cheap, Cheap, Cheap. Never again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working. Not sure what is wrong
reviews.reviewText: The first one I had worked for many many years. This one stopped working. The lights are on. so it is getting the power but the blade is not spinning. The reason I order these things online is because I do not have time to go out and shop for it. When it broke I did not do a timely return and now I am stuck with it. I understand that the return policy is very reasonable but I am still left with a product that died on me for no reason. I wouldnot mind getting a replacement.
Love how it helps you grind just the right amount of beans for your perfect pot of coffee. Very easy to use.

I bought this because we grind a lot of coffee at much church. It lasted, literally, only one freakin' week. There's this old Polish woman who decided to fill the damn thing up all the way and pretty much burned the motor. So, maybe if you use it accordingly and follow the instructions it will last longer.

I was really... BROKEN UP ABOUT IT. (get it?)

By the way, we never got another grinder so now our folks drink hot water.

This is our second one in 6 years. When it's used every single day, sometimes twice a day, it eventually gets run down. However, I don't recommend this to be used to grind a whole bag of coffee at once (why are you doing that anyway? Isn't it better to take 30 seconds and grind a new 12 cup batch each morning?) Cord length is perfect, and the detachable canister thing is great for easy cleaning.

Good practical product. Product was packaged well. Small size and easy to use and clean.
It does not grind some coffee beans completely but it is enough for me. If you use a sifter to get rid of remaining beans it works really well. Great price/performance ratio.
I am using in fine mode for V60

As a student in a dorm room, I didn't want to buy some massive overly expensive coffee grinder, I just wanted something cheap that can also grind up coffee for a french press. I was really impressed with this little grinder. It works really well, and I've really enjoyed using it.
Not much else really needs to be said. It's a coffee grinder - it grinds coffee effectively. Job done. Would buy again.

reviews.reviewTitle: The greatest coffee grinder you'll ever own
reviews.reviewText: Oh my God! This is the greatest coffee grinder I've ever had! I've had many in the past none were as versatile as this model is. I absolutely love it. It's so easy to use and so easy to clean I use it almost everyday. If you need a coffee grinder this is the way to go.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easily grind more coffee at one time.
reviews.reviewText: I had a little grinder with "little" being operative word. Love the size of this product and highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can I give it Zero Stars?
reviews.reviewText: Can I give it Zero Stars? Used it a few times and dead within 4 months. Maybe the one I got was faulty. Who knows! Replacement? Money back?
Easy to use and the settings make getting the courseness just right. Love that the cup comes out.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's not worth it's low price.
reviews.reviewText: It's too noisy. It makes very uneven grinds. If you can't afford a good grinder, just buy ground coffee. I should have bought a burr grinder. I hate it every time I use it.
Perfect grinder, easy to use, easy to clean up. Now I can enjoy fresh ground coffee every morning. What a difference! Great product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working after about 10 times using
reviews.reviewText: I like the size, and that's the reason I purchased it again (I had bought it before from target) thinking it might have been that ONE defective. However, it happened again. It stops working after about 10 times of grinding. It's too bad because I really like the size and shape.

My last Mr.Coffee grinder lasted me about 15 years before it finally gave out. It didn't have any of the fancy settings this one does; I do like the extra settings. Hopefully it will last as long! Love it! Great value for the money.
Works great! It's actually the 2nd one I've bought. My kids took the other when they moved out. I'd recommend it to anyone. Great price too!

I love this grinder as it's super easy to use. You don't need to read the directions several times before figuring it out, and that's a plus for a senior like me. If you like freshly ground coffee buy this.

I love the fine grind which works better than any grinder I've ever had, but there's no way to be accurate about how many beans to use.

My old GE grinder would stop grinding beans at the appropriate amount you set. So if you put in too many beans, that unit knew when to stop and hold the remaining beans for the next use while letting you remove the cup of grinds to put in your coffeemaker. This Mr. Coffee machine doesn't do that as the same cup is used for the beans pre- and post-grinding.

I bought one several years ago and loved it. Bought one a month ago and not as happy as before. It is noisy, doesn't grind as well and has a smell that is not coffee. It works but wouldn't buy it again.

This probably the best grinder I have ever bought, nicer than the old ones where you just had a plastic cap and basically hard to unplug it, and till the whole gadget upside down just to get the last of the grounds. Love that its so much easier with this product! I especially like the per cup feature and its convient poor spout. Perfect for coffee addicts!
Ive had this for a couple of years now. Works just fine. Grinds my coffee like it should. Excellent product.

reviews.reviewTitle: First grinder and I have worked it! I use ...
reviews.reviewText: First grinder and I have worked it! I use herbs and nuts too and this grinds it all! Just need to remember to clean because those items can clog the blade, but very strong grinder! I guess no off button so I just unplug it.
Pretty good for the price. I don't know how long it will last though. If you have the money for a better quality one do it, if not this is fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Different grinds is also very nice. Overall
reviews.reviewText: We bought this to go with our Cuisinart SS-15 12-Cup Coffee Maker. We wanted to be able to grind our own coffee. This is adjustable to the number of cups you want to make, and that is very helpful. Different grinds is also very nice. Overall, we're very happy with this. And the price was GREAT!

Its an ok grinder but if youre looking to grind beans for espressos it does not grind uniformly. It leaves quite a lot of chunks throughout and if u keep grinding some of it turns to powder therefore neither can be used for espresso making.

I've used a few grinders in the past and by no means am I am grinder expert. So with that said,

This has been the perfect grinding for ME. Its nice not to have to bring the WHOLE unit to the sink to wash it. Or dump the whole unit over to pour out coffee. You set the blend, push down the top and it stops automatically. Then you LIFT the top portion up and pour that and then put it back on the unit. Thats what I like about it the most.

Pro- Easy to clean unit. Detachable chamber. Timer stops when done grinding.
Con- Has a small power cord.
i bought this for may self loved it so i bought another one for work! its great for the coffee lover that uses coffee in a french press or maker

I love this little coffee grinder! It works efficiently and is not as noisy as some of the others I've tried, so it won't cause a stampede of cattle like the one in City Slickers! At $16.99, this was a great bargain. It grinds coffee beans three different settings and is easy to break down and clean. Buy one!

reviews.reviewTitle: Motor burned out in 2 months! Don't buy!
reviews.reviewText: Motor burned out in less than 2 months. This product is a waste! The reviews are correct! Unfortunately, the only thing this product does is fill up landfills and use resources and pollute in order to make this useless piece!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Only lasted 3 months junk!! Waste of money
reviews.reviewText: Bought it in April and has already quit working and have no resources to have replaced

When the grinder was working it was great. Unfortunately after less then 8 months it stopped working. I have recommended this product in the past but after this morning I wouldn't recommend it. Never mess with someone and their coffee.
Had this for a while now and has held up well. Don't normally use beans so didn't want to invest a fortune. I'm very impressed with this grinder.

I liked the different settings but not sure it really made a difference in the grinding of the beans. They all looked the same. Also, if you like to store your grinder with the cord tucked away, the bottom where it goes is too tight. I had to fight to get the cord out each time and then the plastic around the wires started coming off. Id rather have a retractable cord.

reviews.reviewTitle: works great I have no issue getting the desired grind
reviews.reviewText: works great I have no issue getting the desired grind. I just wish there was a two cup option.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mr. Coffee 12 Cup Electric Coffee Grinder with...
reviews.reviewText: a little fancy for me but it works great . the price and brand name is what attracted me . now I see that the removable cup with grounded beans is a nifty convenience . I'm buying one for my favorite cousin

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice product but it broke after 6 months of daily use.
reviews.reviewText: I like this product very much but after several months of use the button you press to start the machine stopped working. The motor still runs but the little nub that's under the start button wore down or broke off and no longer engages the motor. A dissapointment to an otherwise very good quality coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder. The settings on the grinder don't actually ...
reviews.reviewText: Great grinder. The settings on the grinder don't actually do anything different. Even with the right settings you'll have to press for a full three cycles to get the full effect. Value for money though.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only use with a paper filter
reviews.reviewText: I bought this before I knew anything about coffee. For not a lot of money more you can get a refurbished burr grinder that will be more consistent and leave less dust. The chamber maid cleaning system didn't do a great job because this pulverizes some of the coffee beans in order to crush the other beans. It doesn't have any way to control how coarse you want the beans except for how long you grind, so only use this for a paper filter drip pot - no espresso or french press.

Great coffee grinder. This is my second one of the same model. My first one lasted me almost 8 years and only a plastic piece inside broke, otherwise it may still be going. When I had to replace it, there was no doubt I would get the exact same one.
Little but mighty!! I grind my coffee every morning and have no been disappointed yet!! I use the fine grind setting for my espresso machine, and it grinds it perfect!
I really like this coffee maker for the price. My only complaint is that it's hard to tell exactly what setting is being chosen because of how the light indicator is set up.
Very nice coffee grinder. Has very useful features, auto shut off for the grinding settings that you choose, and an inside scraper so the grinds get freed up easily.

It stops just as the coffee is perfectly ground. The fresh coffee sticks to the sides of the canister so there is some plastic on the inside that you rotate to help remove the coffee stuck in it. It really works well and is easy to use.

I have never owned a coffee grinder but got coffee beans from nairobi kenya from a friends mission trip so needed to get one. This grinder is easy to use. I like that you set it to the number of cups you are grinding for and push the button and it automatically stops when done. There is also a scraper that spins in the grinder to remove stuck grounds.
Been using this one for months - no issues, no problems. I like the timer feature.

All you do is set it to how many cups of coffee you want to grind, and set it to how fine or course you want the beans to be ground, add the beans and hold down on the lid to start grinding. It shuts off automatically when the beans are ground according to your settings! It also has a neat little chart printed on the side telling you how many tbs of coffee beans to put in depending on how many cups you want to grind, so you don't have to remember how much to use everytime, just look at the chart! I am very happy with the product and highly reccomend it to everyone!!!

An Excellent coffee grinder! Too bad there were no directions on how to operate it! I had to get
my neighbor to help me to make it work...no on and off switch....

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds the beans super well! Only have a second or two of ...
reviews.reviewText: Grinds the beans super well! Only have a second or two of your day to grind beans? Well you're in luck because that's how long it takes to grind up a cup of coffee beans!

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth more money than what it is priced!
reviews.reviewText: Use this thing every morning for the past seven months and has worked like a charm! If you're thinking about getting this product it's worth every dime.
Hey, it does the job I bought it for and holds a lot, has nice settings options. Get this over more expensive ones that are just charging more for name. Nice product.

Use it everyday. The separate container for beans is designed perfectly allowing you to clean it in the sink and pour grinds into your coffee maker of choice. Only qualm is the cup quantity and grind level doesn't seem to do anything. The blades appear to spin the same no matter what setting I use. I just give it a few quick pulses to manually apply my desired consistency for my french press.

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple to use and removable grounds container!
reviews.reviewText: Compact design was really good. powerful enough to make a weeks worth of coffee grounds in minutes! Best feature is the removable cup for cleaning and removing the grounds.
I've never had a coffee grinder before, but from what I know, this one is great. I use it every day to prepare my coffee. It's been a few months, no problems yet.
My Mr. Coffee grinder broke after three uses and I am having to throw it away because its no longer within their Amazon return period. I do NOT recommend this grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love having freshly ground coffee
reviews.reviewText:
impossible to get the grounds out without the help of a utensil. also cannot get all the grounds out of it.

I love having freshly ground coffee, i recommend it if you are willing to put up with above issues

reviews.reviewTitle: This coffee grinder does the job well.
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder does the job well. I always set it to fine grind. It is a little difficult to to get all the ground coffee out because it sticks to the bottom.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mr. Coffee Blade Grinder is great!
reviews.reviewText:
This grinder is best for where it's priced at. I used it for about 4-5months.
It's still running strong.
Best thing i like about it is that it has this separator you can rotate to get all the coffee grinds from the cup.
Other grinder i used in the past has all these coffee stuck on the wall that you have to scrape out on your own.
I can highly recommend this one for the price!

reviews.reviewTitle: breaks after using it for 4 times in the past 8 months
reviews.reviewText: the product is pretty fragile, I only drink coffee occasionally, so I have only used it 4 times in the past 8 months, now is already malfunction. fortunately, the repairing department is very nice that they will send me a new one.
Works great. I bought it as a gift for someone and they can't stop talking about how nice it is and how well it grinds the coffee beans.

reviews.reviewTitle: Seemed pretty good until it broke...
reviews.reviewText:
I liked this grinder until it broke recently after less than a year's service. I would have given it a higher rating, but I want products to last longer. The ability to wash the parts easily was a great selling point, and that was pretty easy to do. It's been treated gently and hasn't even been used every day. As a grinder, it worked fine. The way it broke was just by unscrewing the top to put in beans. That action, this time, caused the plastic part inside the basket to crack and a piece of it fell off. My guess is that the plastic part got brittle over time. I have left an email on the Mr.Coffee web site in addition to putting comments here.
Update: I contacted the maker through email and they have replaced the grinder as of November 1st. They responded promptly.
The worst product ever, it broke just after a handful of use, very poor quality. Do not waste your money.
Cool little inexpensive grinder but it does not thoroughly grind everything and I always end up with several large pieces in the filter.
Works better than a much more expensive one i replaced it with. Simple trim and no chunks! Zero compliants. Love it
I love freshly ground coffee! Grind just what you need. Easy settings and great results. Turns itself off when the grind is just right, so no guesswork.

Grinds coffee to fine grounds in no time at all!
Cup is a little small, but enough for a full pot at standard strength.
I received it on October 1, and now it doesn't work. Tried to call customer service and they hanged up.Husband called back never called back. The product is less than three months and does not work
Does what its meant to do, could be a little more friendly user.

Honestly I did not expect it to work properly when I opened it. But it did! I only used it for fine grind (and for just a couple of times, its a recent purchase!). So far I am satisfied Ill update the review if it turns out that the first impression was wrong.

reviews.reviewTitle: finally, one that works for little money
reviews.reviewText: I've had other coffee grinders, but this one works. Others I've had gave me a fine dust, some that were ground correctly and some that were still beans - all at the same time. This one seems to do a good job of producing a uniform coffee ground. It's easy to fill and easy to dump. The cup has three little fingers that do a good job of 'scraping' the bowl. I've really enjoyed this one without having to go 'big time' and spend lots of money for the more sophisticated ones.
I love this coffee grinder. Use it daily. Attractive on counter. Not so huge.
Super cheap. The start button is broken and it's my first time using it, just took it out of the box. Very disappointed.

Works great. Ive been using this product consistently for two months now and have not experienced any issues as long as you keep it cleaned out after use. I like the measuring visuals. Great product for the price.

Love this, had earlier Mr. Coffee grinder yet it tended to pulverized some beans and leave others in large chunks, that resulted in more sediment in my coffee as I use the brass type reusable filter. This grinds the bean much more evenly

Perfect for full pots, half pots. Easy to clean. A very nice feature is the grinding cup can be removed and taken to the Drip system without un plugging if not located next to the pot itself. A wierd feature is the 12 inch chord. Touted to reduce tripping hazards though I can't see many folks running across my counters. The ground scraper works to get all the bits loosened up to pour into the filter with out banging, spanking, or disturbing with finger. So that's nice.
I loved this grinder! Unfortunatly it decided to quit working today. It lasted 3 mos. It no longer came on when pressed to start. Too bad as I liked it. Will order anothet brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good deal for a very good grinder
reviews.reviewText: Very good deal for a very good grinder. This was the only inexpensive grinder I could find that allows you to adjust how finely the coffee is ground, which is a must if you use both a French Press and a standard drip machine. The measurement guide on the side is also very helpful! All in all would highly recommend.
I got this as a gift for my husband who loves coffee. He has been happy with it and I like that its dishwasher friendly.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love being able to grind my own coffee
reviews.reviewText: I love being able to grind my own coffee. It makes me feel like it is fresher that way. I've never had a problem with the machine unless a bean gets stuck when I'm trying to close it and I've poured to much in it. If I feel like it needs help grinding, I shake it a little while its grinding so that I can get the full beans to the bottom.
It is good. This is my second one. The last one I had it for many years

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this. Definitely the best you can get for ...
reviews.reviewText: I love this. Definitely the best you can get for the price. Automatic timer based on your settings helps you get a pretty consistent grind. Easy to clean. Thinner than most grinders for easier storage.
What a perfect coffee grinder, excellent product excellent design I love that there are different settings, and they work true to word

reviews.reviewTitle: I use this every morning for the freshest coffee ever!
reviews.reviewText: i bought this because my friend recommended it and now i recommend it to you! My coffee tasted so much better with fresh grounded coffee beans

reviews.reviewTitle: I've NEVER had something break on first use like this. AVOID IT
reviews.reviewText: This broke the first time I used it. I've owned a bunch of these over the years, I've NEVER had something break on first use like this. AVOID IT. Buy something else. I've already replaced this with another brand and am thrilled. This thing is junk.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is our second one. The first one lasted ...
reviews.reviewText: This is our second one. The first one lasted about 20 years, but it eventually broke. It grinds very well.

reviews.reviewTitle: This lasted less than a year.
reviews.reviewText: Really liked this grinder until it just stopped working after having it less than nine months. Cared for it well, never dropped or abused in any way. Very disappointed.
My husband uses this every day and is pleased with it.
Excellent value. Well worth the few dollars. Still going strong.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love that the lid opens at the top
reviews.reviewText: I love that the lid opens at the top. With other grinders, you have to pull off the lid, which results in coffee grounds spilling and those lids don't come off easily.

reviews.reviewTitle: Definitely big step up from other's I've had in past.
reviews.reviewText: Very pleased with this -- I like the fact that you can select the coarseness of the grind.
Very inconsistent grind regardless of setting. Doesn't work as well as the $10 sunbeam I had in college.

reviews.reviewTitle: Get one for you and a gift!
reviews.reviewText: Love this!!! You can choose the coffee ground size and you hold down until the auto timer is complete. Best purchase of October 2019 (I buy a lot of stuff)
Bought one 9 years ago and it's still going strong. I bought this one for my daughter so she could have a Great Grinder too!
It works as expected, although sometimes leaves some larger grounds even on the finer settings. It is also very loud.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great value and performing coffee grinder!
reviews.reviewText:
I had the old no frills Mr Coffee and it worked for years. I spend some time here comparing models,based on price,feature and performance. I am a self proclaimed coffee snob. I grind my own beans both fine and coarse for my press.
110% love this. Strong motor, performance is great and at a fraction of the cost of other models.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not the quality i expect from mr. Coffee
reviews.reviewText: Over- engineered piece of junk. Too many little plastic pieces to break after a couple uses. It turned some beans into dust while some were barely cracked in half. Returning after one use. I wish i had tested this on a cheaper bag of coffee because i bought it to grind a nice expensive blend we had splurged on and those beans were ruined

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful grinder, especially for the price.
reviews.reviewText:
For years I used a grinder that I always had to guess at how long to run it, and always made a big mess on my counter when trying to get all of the grounds out and into the coffee maker. I finally decided to give this one a try, and boy was it worth it!

Very conveneient, no longer have to guess, the grind stops automatically at the right time, provided that you set it correctly. The grind chamber comes off the machine quite nicely for pouring the grounds out and the top comes off the chamber for cleaning. The parts twist on and off very nicely, very well made. And cleaning is a breeze, with no more mess on my counter. All in all, a very good purchase for the price. And let's not forget to mention that the coffee tastes great.

I also want to remind everyone about something that other reviewers mentioned and I had forgotten: out of the box, the cord is really short, like only a few inches. The rest is tucked in under a ridge around the bottom and it is not obvious that it pulls out. Be sure to do this.

reviews.reviewTitle: All kinds of easy settings depending on how many cups of coffee you ...
reviews.reviewText: You can't go wrong with this grinder! It does everything but make the coffee for you. All kinds of easy settings depending on how many cups of coffee you want to make and how fine you want your beans to grind. No guess work when to let off the button because it stops automatically when it reaches the settings you set it at. Love it!
So so disappointed!!! I literally used this grinder a few times and now it wont grind at all!!! Buyer beware it worked for about 5 grinds then died so irritated. DO NOT BUY!!!

Recently, my Cuisinart Grind and Brew coffee unit broke and I decided to go for the coffee grinder because the Cuisinart Grind and Brew model tends to have problems. I looked at various grinder and finally decided to purchase this one. Unlike the conventional model, the top unit of the grinder house can be detached for cleaning and puring the ground coffee into the coffee maker filter easily. When I set the unit for medium grinding setting, I can use less coffee in comparison to the use of my Cuisinart Grind and Brew coffee unit. And the good thing is that the power is not too fine to pass thru the filter either. If you have a black color coffee maker, it will fit very well with it. The grinder is not loud when it operates. Overall, I am very pleased with this product.
Have had a few of these throughout the years! Love it and it grinds the coffee so well. Comes with a little brush to make sure you get all the grounds out Everytime.
I have used this product for years. Easy cleaning & multiple options for grinding. Gave with coffe beans as gifts recently.
We had one of these for years and it finally broke inside. I was so happy to see that they still make them. Minor changes made but still the same operation.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder. Easy to remove locking cup for pouring grinds in to coffee maker.
reviews.reviewText: Great grinder. I bought one for my parents a few years ago and it is still kicking. They liked it so much that I bought another for myself.

coffee ground is more consistent than blade grinder from Krups
mostly used on medium setting for french press
I buy whole beans, grind them coursly and cold brew the beans. This grinds them perfectly. Highly recommend it.

Purchased this to grind a bag of Starbucks coffee beans. Did fine at first, then it just died. I have not decided whether to trash it or try to have it serviced. Think I might look for a manual grinder.
This has a horrible design. Lights stay on all the time. Settings make no difference on grinding or amount. Difficult to align to grind.
Very easy to use, comes apart easy for pouring, cleaning. Flip top for adding beans and pouring. Adjustable lit up buttons for easy operation. Short cord but not too short.
It's fine I guess. I wasn't expecting the quality of a burr grinder, but the sizes of grounds this thing makes is incredibly inconsistent.

reviews.reviewTitle: lasted 3 months and now will no longer grind. ...
reviews.reviewText: lasted 3 months and now will no longer grind. 3 stars cause the one I have at home and rarely use still works but the one I use every day no longer does.
Simple, small and perfect fit for little counter space. The manual self clean function comes in handy to get all the grounds.Mr. Coffee 12 Cup Electric Coffee Grinder with Multi Settings, IDS77

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little coffee grinder. Just as advertised.
reviews.reviewText: I had pretty low expectations of inexpensive coffee grinders, but was pleasantly surprised with this one. Everything worked as advertised. I am glad I read the reviews about the cord storage. I am not sure I would have figured that out on my own. I like that you can remove the grinding container to pour the coffee into the filter. With my last cheapy, you just tipped the whole thing upside down.

It does everything that I need it to! I had coffee beans accumulating in my cabinet and no grinder, and now I can make all the coffee I want. It is a little tough to clean out sometimes, but it's that way with any coffee grinder, so I'm not knocking any points off for it. This one in particular also has different settings, which is nice, and a handy little guide for tbsp of beans to number of cups on the side of it.
This grinder is terrible. It leaves many, many beans and parts of beans underground no matter how much you do to it.
I purchased this product maybe about a year ago now. It is still grinding and helping me make my morning cup of Joe fresher and more delicious. I would definitely recommend this.

First time I used it I was grinding dried chill peppers that I had already blended, the second time was milk powder and the last time was white sugar. Never overfilled the base, oh well glad I'm well within a return timeline.
I love this thing. So easy to assemble and easy to use.

My husband and I used this "upgraded" coffee grinder for about 6 weeks. When we first used it, it was not like the previous version, in that the top does not click into place to let you know it is ready to grind as did the previous model. Next, it leaves a lot of unground beans, which is a waste of expensive coffee. This grinder used to do a good job grinding beans, for the price--but no longer. I would not recommend it. We are beyond the 30 day return or we would send it back. Do not waste your money. Furthermore, the replacement Mr. Coffee 8-cup drip coffee maker doesn't heat the water sufficiently nor distribute it evenly enough to make a good cup of coffee, although the previous version used to. We are so sick of how companies these days are putting out products of less and less quality just to shave off greater profits for themselves. It is finally to the point where products sold in the US are junk, all made in China, to which US jobs and pride of workmanship were lost.
Not as good as expected. A lot of lining up dots and turning and not self cleaning as stated. NOT WORTH THE MONEY. COMLicated and not easy to use compared to others
Best grinder out there. Will grind coarse or fine. Very happy with product.

Bought this coffee grinder around February after our old mr. Coffee grinder died it lasted around 10+ years. For the price you get an awesome grinder that can be used to grind many diffrent items. You have choice in coarseness or how fine the beans come out. For the price its unbeatable.

reviews.reviewTitle: This does not control coarsness of the grind.
reviews.reviewText: This is a terrible fail. It is complicated to operate. Clumsy to handle. It does not grind the beans consistently.
It has a bunch of settings i haven't tried, does what I want which is course ground coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: This grinder is a solid value and well-built.
reviews.reviewText: All around, this is an excellent piece of equipment. Hint: if you want a properly coarse grind for cold brewing, fill to "MAX" with beans, but set to 10 cups instead of 12. It's easy to get a feel for, but let it dry thoroughly after washing. Cool beans!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works so well coffee snobs steal it from my house!
reviews.reviewText: Works so well my 19 year old stole it for her house. I bought another and my ex stole it for his house. I don't even drink coffee, but have friends over that do. I'm now on my 3rd. It even cleans easy and works well on my almonds I use in my facial scrub!
I like that I can pick the fineness of the grind and how many cups I've put beans for. with one push of a button, even half asleep, my grounds are perfect.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best coffee grinder on the market
reviews.reviewText: Best coffee grinder on the market. That is why I think they stopped making them. Our old one just needed replaced after 5 years. It still grinds well, the scrapers that get the coffer out from under the blades finally wore out. This is the only grinder that has scrapers built in so that you can easily get the grinds at the bottom of the grinder out. Separate settings for number of cups and fineness of grind basically control the timer. This is good as it takes the guess work out of it.

Great coffee grinder, especially for the price! Only problem with it is that sometimes it doesn't grind the beans fine enough, so
you have to grind a second time or you're left with some chunks.

This grinder is very good. It grinds the coffee quick and evenly. Each compartment can be taken apart to clean and pour the grinds out. I am super impressed by the built-in scraper within the container to scrap out all the stuck-on grinds along the wall of the container. Has a super small footprint so doesn't take up much space on your countertop. I can't think of anything g negative.

Would have been a great product if it didnt quit working within a couple of weeks of use. Hopefully it was just my luck to get a faulty one but unfortunately the company and amazon will not allow a return. Disappointing.

I don't recommend this little toy if you want to grind the full 12 cups. I measured the amount of beans as outlined in the instruction booklet and I got chunks of beans and lots of whole beans left in the chamber. I boxed it back up and sent it back. I'll just keep using my old Sunbeam Osker Chopper, it takes about a minute and it's noisy but it grinds all the beans consistently to a medium grind with no chunks!
Works as it should, has held up well

I recently purchased the Mr. Coffee IDS77 Electric Coffee Grinder for my office place and we absolutely love it. It preforms as advertised and has not had any problems grinding the beans to the perfect consistency. The Chamber Maid system is sort of a gimmick, but it does help dislodge some of the grinds from the wall when pouring them in the filter.

Overall I'd say it's certainly worth the money!

It works great! A friend recommended it to me after I complained that my Turkish hand Grindr is too time consuming! I only use to grind fine coffee which is not really fine but its fast and convenient. I use it every two days or soo.
This coffee grinder is really nice and grinds very well. It also grinds spices. It is tall and slender so it stays on the counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: For a perfect cup of coffee
reviews.reviewText: I love this product so much, I ended up ordering one for my parents at Christmas. I've been using mine daily for about 3 years. Consistent performance and so easy to use. The auto shut off feature is very nice to ensure you get the right grind for the perfect cup of coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this, uses it to grind everything and I ...
reviews.reviewText: Love this, uses it to grind everything and I love that I can set it to the consistency that I want

1st one didnt work and was replaced, new one used 3 time and now doesnt work

Thanks China
Loving my little machine fresh coffee
I havent opened the box until recently! I grinded some coffee beans and second time already broke! The light still on, but it wouldnt grind! I wish I could return this product! Its bad buy!

reviews.reviewTitle: I absolutely love this coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this coffee grinder. I have had it for about four months now. We use it multiple times daily. I have been experimenting lately with different types of coffee beans and it has always performed with excellence. Each bean is so finely ground you could almost spread the coffee; however, the strength of the grind can be adjusted which allows use for all sort of coffee consumers.
It's a little loud but I like the sound lol, very easy to use and makes me happy

Don't really know if it actually works good because I sent it right back. Ordered a "new" one and got a used grinder. Grinder box came unsealed, white residue on the rim, button labels already starting to wear off. I would have purchased USED if that's what I had wanted.

I've tried quite a few coffee grinders. This one beats them all for everyday household use. Mess free, no guessing when the beans are done because it shuts off when it's ground to the setting of Course Medium or Fine. It also has an amount setting for less grinding time from 2-12 cups. It's nice because it's easy to pour out when ground. Just twist the top section and the entire grinding mechanism becomes portable. Great for grinding homegrown dried peppers, herbs and spices from the garden. The grinding blades will not spin unless the safety lid is down. The lid is the switch. Just push down and hold and it does everything else but clean itself. Simple to clean but watch out for the blades if you are accident prone...certain to make you spring a leak!

This is not a burr grinder, but it's convenient, cleans up easily, and does a more than adequate job. I've had more expensive grinders that didn't work as well. Other grinders have caused some problems with static electricity, where the ground coffee sticks to the plastic and then ends up everywhere...not so much with this one. Would definitely buy another one; in fact I may buy one just to use for spices.

Nice looking, doesn't take up a lot of space. Can't beat it for the money!
Product died less than 6 months of normal use.

reviews.reviewTitle: So while it works better than my old blade grinder it doesn't make a ...
reviews.reviewText: Not a burr grinder. I set the Amazon search parameters to burr grinders and this came up. When I saw the price I jumped at it. So while it works better than my old blade grinder it doesn't make a fine enough powder for Ibik Khave. But it makes a decent espresso grind and the price isn't horrible so I guess I'll keep it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Happy after 5 years of daily service
reviews.reviewText: It been about 5 years since I last ordered this product and I loved it the first time. The motor still works great but the cup needs to be replaced and the plastic scrapers (these are what removes the grounds from the cups walls before you pour them into your machine of choice) the side broke a few years back and I had to trim them off but it still worked fine. It's was just time to replace it I hope I get 5 years out of this one!

This product worked well for about 7 months and then unexpectedly broke. Seems like the gear on the bottom warped as it would not grind an emitted an electrical burn smell. I always followed proper instruction for use. Disappointing. Would not buy again.
Looks big on the pic but it's small and not to powerful
It works really well. Its actually really well-made and was a great price.
For the cost this is a great buy and do the job super, equal than expensive one.

Revised .....
It. Broke at the 2 month mark so I couldn't return it....

Love this! Works well. Glad to be able to grind my own beans. My advice is stop when the grinder auto stops, do not regrind. The smaller the beans are ground makes for lots of "residue" in my coffee and I don't like that. But the device itself works great!
I really disappointed .I use it for 2 time and it's don't work and I brought it not even a month ago
Just as described!
Great grinder. Had one for years and it was my go to until I moved to US!

reviews.reviewTitle: but I have to hold the button down - which is fine! grinds
reviews.reviewText: I was under the impression it was an automatic grinder, but I have to hold the button down - which is fine! grinds great
It was great for the handful of times that it worked! Unfortunately, I bought it in April and it no longer will grind the coffee beans.

I have not owned other coffee grinders (i.e. this is my first), so my comparisons and comments are not compared to any other similar products, but this coffee grinder works well. It grinds the coffee quickly and the motor seems strong enough to last a reasonable amount of time (hopefully at least a 1.5 years or maybe 2). However the quality of the chamber itself seems a bit questionable. The chamber isn't that sturdy, but if you're careful I really don't see how this could break except when subject to extreme use. Great deal for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke after one year of use
reviews.reviewText:
I liked that this coffee grinder had different settings so that it could make coarse ground coffee to use in my French press. Unfortunately, it just stopped working after only a little over a year of use.

Update: Contacted Mr. Coffee and they are sending me a replacement free of charge!
My husband loves it
works great. usually have to grind twice, just don't let it run the whole grind
this works very good. has many settings for the way you would like your beans.
Works really well. Not a total grind, but if you shake it while grinding it works

i had a Hamilton Beach grinder that stopped working so i bought this one. the design is not very good: the grinding chamber is not smooth so coffee is always stuck in it, yet no little brush is provided with it.
it is very noisy compared to my previous grinder and you need to keep the button on lid pressed for it to run. the ground coffee is coarser than expected and the no mess opening is not very useful.
overall not a good grinder design

reviews.reviewTitle: Great coffee grinder for small spaces.
reviews.reviewText: Small. Easy to use. Has different options so you can control the grind.
Nice coffee grinder

works really well. took a tiny bit of trail and error to get right grind and size but it was easy .
very easy to clean, well built and no complaints to date.
works much better than the mini food processor I was using.
This is a fantastic coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Must for Coffee Lovers! Great product for a great price!
reviews.reviewText: We love fresh ground coffee and this grinds perfectly with options for our French press and kcups!

reviews.reviewTitle: Adjust the two setting switches at each use and rock the grinder gently while grinding the beans
reviews.reviewText: Works great and it easy to clean. I really like the internal wiper feature that gets the coffee bean dust knocked down. Good design

Love the coffee grinder when it was working, but the "chambermaid" cleaning system broke after 4 years. And I only use it about once a week on Saturday. It seems to me it should last longer than that. So now I am buying another one. At this price, I guess I can do this every 4 years - but I don't have to like it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Just takes a bit of stopping and shaking to do a good job.
reviews.reviewText: It's hard to get a consistent grind, but for the price, I'm okay with it. Just takes a bit of stopping and shaking to do a good job.
Works as advertised, easier to use, more consistent grind, than my old manual mill.
No problems, works as expected. Good size for my use and dependable product.
This is the best grinder Ive ever used. I liked it so well I bought it for Christmas presents for friends.
Does not grind beans completely

reviews.reviewTitle: Definitly NOT for a Coffee Enthusiast
reviews.reviewText: I should have expected to get what I pay for... I just had no idea a simple machine could be so poor at its job. Unless you want whole beans left in your grinder do not buy this so called coffee grinder.
Do not buy this. Does not last

reviews.reviewTitle: I dont usually have good luck with weird little things like this but honestly ...
reviews.reviewText: I dont usually have good luck with weird little things like this but honestly it works amazingly. Bought it to grind flax seeds and it ground them in 10 seconds flat. No issues. And flax seeds are tiny. Nothing else I have will grind them . Very happy with my purchase!

Like other reviewers said, the blades of this hit the sides and slowly grind off the plastic of the "chamber maid" and mix it in with your grounds. It's ground ours completely in half so that it no longer sweeps across the bottom of the container. That's the only design flaw with this. Otherwise it's perfect. But unless you wanted to be ingesting plastic, that's a deal-breaker.

I use it just for grinding coffee beans. It does a good job. Once in awhile it can get a little courser than I want on the fine setting. But not often and just do a quick regrind. I recommend this product

I've tried several and this one is by far the best!! Great grind and stops grinding when it's done, several settings which makes a big difference depending on how you are brewing the coffee, and a long enough cord!
Great grinder
Works great so far. I love the auto-stop and the way you can twist it to scrape the bottom. Only complaint is that if you unplug it, it resets your size and coarseness settings.
Love it, works well.

reviews.reviewTitle: I still have big coffee bean bits but it's ok
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is ok. I still have big coffee bean bits. I have to grind more once the setting is done and still have big bits. I probably wouldn't buy again.

Does an ok job
No matter how long you grind still big chunks left
This coffee grinder was great until it gave. I got it in August and the motor failed in January. It didn't even last more than 6 months.
I bought this just for me and it's perfect! Works fast and so easy to use. And clean up is as simple as rinsing and you're done!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good grinder, especially for the cost.
reviews.reviewText: No issues at all with this coffee grinder. Easy to use, auto shut off feature (just keep holding the button until it turns off...). Easy to clean, however on the lid water can get stuck under the button. I let mine sit out for it to dry.
Great Product. easy to assemble and arrived right on time.
Item arrived in excellent condition as promised
Lasted 32 days & quit. I have used identical item in past & loved it. Too late to return.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mr. Coffee Grinder works as expected
reviews.reviewText:
Pretty simple to use. Self explanatory buttons. The top comes off pretty easy making it easy to clean and easy to handle.
Only used it 1x so far and it works as expectd with no issues out of the box.

reviews.reviewTitle: GRINDS COFFEE FOR MY K CUP
reviews.reviewText: Purchased to grind coffee to a better consistency for my k-cup. Use on fine grind. Pours perfectly straight from the grinder into the small k cup holder. No spoon needed. Works great!
Motor stop turning after the 4th or 5th use. Worked fine until then
I one of these for years, and it finally died. Bought another. Good quality, consistent grind.
I use it for my fresh coffee beans and is perfect for 1 or 2 person
Not consistent at all. But it's okay for the price.
A bit hard to clean. Other than that. It does the job.
Very good quality product. My wife is happy. Saving a lot of money doing grind in the house to the proper level and having high quality morning coffee cup.

I got this to grind fresh coffee each morning... and it worked! Only used the normal grind (no expresso) with no problems. Love that it goes into the dishwasher. I cant compare to other grinders because this is the only one I have owned, with no complaints.

Yes, you do need to shake out the left over coffee stuck inside, but its no big deal.

Yes, it makes noise to grind, but dont they all?

My favorite part...
I needed to grind some baby food, so I used the coffee grinder, and ooooh lala.... gave me yummy baby food. I only ground it just enough to get it like a #2 gerber - which was great.
So if you already own one of these, no need tu run out and get a baby food grinder!
Does what it says and we grind our own beans for coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder. I like the automatic settings
reviews.reviewText: Great grinder. I like the automatic settings. The kids love to grind the beans and now I don't have to worry about them not grinding long enough or too long.
Very nice product
My favorite grinder for many years.
This grinder is a beast. Love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: grounds aren't as fine as a would desire but hey
