I've had the Krups grinder over 20 years and now use it to grinds spices. It's quick and easy.

I would NOT reccomend the Mr. Coffee grinder and will buy another Krups soon.

I bought this 2 weeks ago (brick and mortar store) and the motor burned out last night.

I had the older Mr. Coffee model for 3 years right before that, and gave it away at a garage sale. That one still worked great -- shouldn't have given it away. It doesn't seem I was using this new grinder any differently than the 3-year old model that was still going strong. Just a heads up.

I own a french press, k cup, and auto drip maker and this grinder is perfect for all of them. About to order another since a busted pipe upstairs fritzed out my current one, and for the price u cant beat this. I also have used for spices, it grinds my roasted fennel for my marinara sauce great. I have had burr grinders but I really can't tell the difference.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice features, but do not buy
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this unit on 31 Jan 2012 at a local Target store. It's a nice product, with auto shutoff and easy-clean grinding chamber. However, after about 20 uses, it abruptly shut off only 5 seconds into its usual 15-second grind.

The manual's troubleshooting section suggests that the "thermal fuse is broken" from an overheated motor, and states that the only recourse is authorized Sunbeam service center. Although the unit has a 1-year warranty, for a $20 item it's just not worth the time to pursue warranty service. So I searched online in vain for DIY repair instructions. (Turns out a lot of people have run into this same failure.) Then, I decided that for the benefit of others who might be tempted to do their own repair, I'd sacrifice my unit and post my findings here.

This failure occurred when the motor hadn't been running for long and the base was not warm to the touch. So I believe the manufacturer has specified an insufficient fuse, and/or should redesign the unit with a circuit breaker or automatic-reset fuse.

Here goes with the technical repair info: You open the unit from the TOP, not the obvious-looking plastic cover on the bottom. There are 3 Phillips-head screws hidden underneath plastic caps located in wells around the inside perimeter of the bowl seen when you take the grinding chamber off. To get those caps out, you need to whack them sideways with hammer and screwdriver from the side closest to the center, forcing them outward and up. Obviously the manufacturer never intended them to be removed (and never considered the possibility that blown fuses could aggravate consumers).

Once the screws are removed, you can lower the base off the unit far enough to see a hex nut holding the circuit board in place (behind the front control panel). Remove this nut with needlenose or a socket wrench. On the underside of this circuit board is the offending fuse. I have yet to be certain which device it is, but I believe it's a copper-colored cylinder 4mm long and labeled Z01.

The part may or may not be readily available from third parties, but there are no published tech specs and the manufacturer does not sell replacement parts. Life is too short to chase down warranty service on poorly-designed devices. I rate this product Do Not Buy.

I bought this product about 5 years ago of almost every day usage and it worked very well! A few years into usage I switched to a French press from a drip machine and kept using this grinder. It does well buy has a very inconsistent grind for a french press course grind but still worked. Like a few other people, the plastic black strips on the inside of the bowl (that help clean the bowl) have finally broke and now I'm ready to move onto a burr grinder. It is also quite load but most of these type of blade grinders are.

Highly recommend for a cheap coffee/spice grinder just not for a french press.

I've had this coffee grinder for years and years. At least 5 now. It always works perfectly without issue.
I then bought a spice grinder from Krups and after, no joke, 4 uses, it died!
Now I'm buying myself another of these for spices because I realized I can choose the courseness of the spice! Love. Don't waste your time on any other....

Just bought another one, I had my original for at least 8 years without any problem, using pretty much every day. I hope i can get another 8 years out of the new one...works well, I can't give comparison with other products but can say my original worked without any issue until it finally broke...actually i replaced my coffee maker twice before the grinder finally gave out 8 years later..

reviews.reviewTitle: Yes, eventually some plastic parts will break. (>ten years)
reviews.reviewText: I am ordering a replacement for one I bought at least 10 years ago and have used every day. Eventually, the plastic scrapers connected to the top will break. Still grinds coffee as well as it did the first time, so I'll keep the old one as a backup. Maybe the new ones will last longer. ;-)
Ive had this grinder for 14 months. The push to grind function failed a week ago. It worked fairly well before then but did leave a few whole beans after grinding.

Junk! Stay away from this one.
There are much better grinders that this piece of garbage.
First off, the grind is extremely uneven. Set for a medium grind, you get everything from powder to half bean chunks.
Beware that the plastic scraper will break off and you will be grinding plastic in with your coffee. Yum!

It lasted about eight months before it stopped working. The green lights still come on, but it won't grind. There was no usage that I'd call excessive - it was grinding one day, and the next time we tried it there was nothing. After running through all of the obvious solutions in the troubleshooting guide, a forum search suggests that the thermal fuse might be the issue. There's even a DIY fuse replacement guide for this particular model (ISD77): [...]

While I'm enjoying the learning about thermal fuses and testing out some new already-ground coffees, I'd prefer a coffee grinder that worked. If you're thinking about picking this model up, I'd suggest a hard pass.

reviews.reviewTitle: has always worked well for me
reviews.reviewText: I don't know if this is a lifetime purchase, but it's worked well for nearly a year and feels solid. I like that I can set it to grind properly so I don't need to try to calibrate the timing myself, and I've found the grinds pretty accurate for fine and coarse. It does 12 cups no problem, and isn't insanely loud. Using the "chambermaid" and rinsing has worked fine for cleaning, although I guess it might be tricker with non-coffee substances. I'd get this again if the price is right.

Negative stars if I could give that. Poor grind quality regardless of setting. Leaves large chunks of beans, some unground entirely. So I had to experiment. Shake while grinding. Not much improvement. Shake and pump it up and down while grinding? A little better, but not great. Don't bother trying to do a full pot of coffee. It's junk. Absolute junk.

reviews.reviewTitle: This has without a doubt been the best grinder I've ever owned
reviews.reviewText:
I've had mine for about 3 years and use it daily! Sadly though the motor is finally starting to burn out. This has without a doubt been the best grinder I've ever owned. It will be a sad day when I have to toss it, but I'm ordering the exact same grinder to replace it.
Positives- selectable grind level, easy cleaning. Very durable!
Cons- none!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: It doesn't do fine or coarse grind that well
reviews.reviewText: I've had this for approximately one year and it has served its function well. It doesn't do fine or coarse grind that well, it will always have a bit of the other left in it unfortunately. As others have noted, there is always residue that sticks to the bottom which can be a pain to deal with. You get what you pay for, for 15 bucks it ain't bad.

I have had this grinder for almost 10 years. It still works well. My one issue is one of the plastic spokes inside cracked and now they do not turn easily. I like the grind settings and the capacity. I also like I can remove the cup and clean it fully. It's definitely a great entry level grinder for someone that buys normal coffee beans and is using a drip coffeemaker. I cannot speak to how the grind works for press or espresso.

I bought this product after looking at reviews of other products. I chiefly wanted it to grind spices, but was wary because it was not listed as a 'spice grinder'

Not only does it perform quite well on spices, the fact that its an easy clean means you can switch back and forth between spices and coffee quite easily.

1) Every spice I put into the machine came out adequately. It has three settings, so you can have a course, medium or fine grind. The fine isn't magnificent, but if you put it in a bag and sold it, I doubt anyone would notice.

Thus far, I have ground chiles, seeds and even fresh lemongrass. I got the results I wanted each time.

2) It also grinds coffee well. Put the beans in, hit the button, and it looks like the stuff you buy at the store. I don't know if I would call it really produces esspresso-grade grinds, but I have gotten my regular coffee buzz every morning.

3) This is the biggest selling point. IT IS FRIGGIN EASY TO CLEAN! It has a detatchable grinding cup and dishwasher-safe lid. But seriously, you don't even need to go that far. Since the cup is stainless-steel, and since it has this plastic rig that lets you sweep loose grinds, all you need is a small-cicular brush and hot water to get it clean.

The time? About 15-20 seconds. No leftover grinds.

Because of this, you can grind multiple fresh spices rather quickly without worry of cross-contimnation. I can also say with confidence that I have had no fennel-tasting coffee. The fact that it is so easy to clean makes it versatile.

Is it loud? I guess. And you may have to grind more than once to get a desired texture.

But the fact that it does what I want it to do and cleans easily makes it worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder, but motor stopped working on both of mine.
reviews.reviewText: I loved this little grinder, so when our first ones motor unexpectedly quit, I bought the exact same model again. Unfortunately our second one just stopped working, too. We got about a year and a half of life out of both of them. Too risky to buy a third one at this point.

reviews.reviewTitle: One thing I absolutely dislike about the unit is the trouble I have getting ...
reviews.reviewText: The grinder works very well, although I can't say that it's any faster than my old one. One thing I absolutely dislike about the unit is the trouble I have getting all the coffee out of it. I like a very fine grind and I have to scrape it out, a real pain - didn't have this problem with my old grinder. My next grinder will most likely be a burr grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works okay but settings do absolutely nothing.
reviews.reviewText: I have had this grinder for about 9 years and so I can say it has lasted and it grinds coffee ok. However, the time settings do absolutely nothing. They have never done anything. No matter what combination of settings you use it always grinds for the same length of time.

reviews.reviewTitle: I had to grind it twice even on very fine just to get it fairly well ground
reviews.reviewText: Uneven course grind. Supposed to be designed to pour from the grinder but it sloppy and heavy. I had to grind it twice even on very fine just to get it fairly well ground. Will be returned.

reviews.reviewTitle: I recommend that you exclude this model from your search for ...
reviews.reviewText:
Because of the lack of reliability of this unit, I recommend that you exclude this model from your search for a coffee grinder. It cannot be relied upon to work on a day to day basis. I am currently usng a 10+ year old Hamilton-Beach that my wife has been using to grind spices and seeds. This unit has never failed me,

I recommend you spend your money elsewhere and reduce your stress level.

Reg. Vince

Bought this grinder for my son (he's serving in Airforce & I like to send him care pkgs...this one was Coffee-Time themed...the grinder along w/alkl other products were delivered directly to him from vendor) Upon second usage, grinder refused to work. It's dead Jim.

Sadly, the reason I bought THIS particular grinder is that I have owned & continually used it's older sister for the past ten years without incident. I trusted that it would be the same quality product that I had bought for myself (yes, even though it has been a decade). This was a total waste of money.

I didn't want a large coffee grinder since I brew one cup at a time. This seemed to fit the bill. After using it for a week, I can't say I'm happy with my purchase.

Pros:
- Compact
- Not too noisy
- Grind settings work

Cons:
- Doesn't grind evenly, large bean chunks will be hiding under fully ground mounds.
- Timer is useless.
- Grounds go everywhere when I try to empty it.
- Basically impossible to get all the grounds out. Some are always left behind in the basket or caught in the top.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you're a coffee lover, look for another grinder!
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is not worth the low price I paid for it. Unfortunately it was the only one in stock at the store I was shopping the night I bought it. The grind size selector and cup selector are useless as it grinds all exactly the same. I repeatedly got a grind that ranged from powder to half beans reguardless of the grind size I selected or the amount of beans I put in it. When I first pushed the start button, nothing happened. I only got it to start grinding after removing the grinding chamber and lid and replacing them several times. It's advertised as being "hands free" but that is false. You must hold down the start button in order to grind. I'm pretty disappointed as I feel as if it wasted 12 cups of my favorite expensive coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: It works fine but the cord was too short
reviews.reviewText: I had this grinder for over 2 yrs and it works fine. Not until today did the plastic inside the container cracked. With it being so cheap, I got more than my money's worth. I normally use the fine grind and pack it to the max if not slightly more and have no problems. What I dislike about it is that the cord is too short and it's not the easiest to clean. Other than that, it's still a good buy.

This was my first coffee grinder, so I don't have any comparisons. However, the settings never seem to work - no matter what I press I get a mix of powder, fine grind, chunks, and whole beans as the end product. I've tried simply using the settings and letting it grind, as well as jostling it while grinding, no good either time.
At first I just thought I would try to eyeball it and guess for myself. Now I'm donating it to my local Out of the Closet and buying a different brand entirely.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent cheep grinder(works for me anyway).
reviews.reviewText: I picked this up because I wanted to start brewing fresh ground coffee. At the time I only had a drip coffee maker and it works great for that. I recently bought a French press in an endeavor to broaden my coffee making horizon. Although it works OK for the French press it tends to leave more grounds in the second cup then usual because of the blade grinders inability to make a consistent grind. I will keep it around until it dies and then I will get a bur grinder. But for a cheep blade grinder this one gets the job done.

reviews.reviewTitle: Priced nice. Worked really well first three times
reviews.reviewText: Priced nice.Worked really well first three times, but then it quite working altogether. Still lights up, but doesnt spin. Very disappointed. I had a another brand for ten years before the gear under the blade stripped. I wish I would have stayed with the same brand.

I have had different grinders in the past. I thought the features on this grinder sounded intriguing so I bought it to give it a shot. I was disappointed. It doesnt fully grind beans but also leaves some grounds to a dust like consistency in one serving. I would not buy again and am looking for a new one to replace.

This grinder was a gift from my kind brother-in-law, who tried and failed to fix my 20-year-old Bosch a few years ago. It exaggerates the flaws of that old workhorse and adds more to the list.
Pros:
*faster than grinding by hand
Cons:
*leaves more large chunks and dust than other blade grinders I've used
*timed grinding feature is absurd and useless for me
*chamber has moveable plastic ribs (the "Chamber Maid" feature) that catch and hold powdery grounds and so are worse than useless as a cleaning feature--they broke off anyway
*even noisier than others I've used
So all in all I've found it to be an inelegant, needlessly complex, and noisy tool that fails to do a simple job acceptably. I think I've put up with it long enough!

What a waste! Failed during my first use. It seemed under-powered. Yes, I read the instructions (helpfully printed in 4 languages.)
A cheap Proctor Silex I got for $12. It lasted 4 years.
I roast green coffee beans. ...So, YEAH, I know how to use a blade coffee grinder.
Perhaps it was a fluke. But it's ALL I have to go on.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works but you have to work for it
reviews.reviewText: Straight forward, has adjustable settings, but it is very loud, takes a long time to grind, and I have to pick it up and shake it around while grinding to get an even batch.

reviews.reviewTitle: grinds well but the plastic pieces inside the bowl break ...
reviews.reviewText: grinds well but the plastic pieces inside the bowl break off and grind into the coffee! I bought 2 simultaneously because I keep one for coffee and one for spices, and it happened to both.

I bought this inexpensive coffee grinder because it had some nice features: grind settings, removable grinding chamber, clear windows, etc. The electrical cord only runs about 12 inches, not enough length away from the wall socket. Even with the finest grind the grinder shuts off before the beans are sufficiently ground. Worse the beans at the top of the cup aren't ground at all, leaving whole beans in the cup. I was so disappointed and dissatisfied with this grinder that I went out and bought another one just a month or two later. I've read where others were satisfied with this one, but for grinding large quantities of beans or for fine grinding, better try another model. This is the least satisfying grinder I've ever owned.
My mom purchased this unit from Amazon and it caught on fire after a year. Dangerous! Be careful!

reviews.reviewTitle: Who knew? Not customer service at Sunbeam.
reviews.reviewText: When I took this item out of the box, I was stunned that the cord was only 3 inches long and would not reach any of my kitchen outlets. I read the manual to try to find out if the cord pulled out in some way. All it says is that the cord is short for safety reasons so "someone doesn't trip over it" (the cat? - that is hilarious in itself) It worked fine with an extension cord. I called Sunbeam to complain about the ridiculous length of the cord and the girl said she was sorry but offered no suggestions. It was not until I read a review of the product that I learned the the cord is actually hidden under the grinder on the bottom and you have to wiggle it out of the slot and work it around; How stupid! Why?!!!?

I use this for more than just coffee! I use it for me home dried herbs and teas. Great for mixing that dry rub as well. Ive had mine for 5 years and need to replace it as the plastic inner side has cracked and snapped off from over use Im thinking. Love this little guy!

reviews.reviewTitle: i like it! grinds the beans perfectly
reviews.reviewText: i like it! grinds the beans perfectly. easy to pour the coffee into the filter and cleanup is great because you can separate the grind chamber from the body and put in dishwasher and your are done. also cord is hidden so just unwrap and wind it back up when you are done. PERFECT!

This is hands-down the best coffee grinder Ive ever owned. My grounds come out perfect, and its really easy to clean (hand wash with a bottle brush, or just put it in the dishwasher). Its also survived two deployments (with the hubby to Iraq in 2011, and Afghanistan in 2013).

reviews.reviewTitle: At Least We Had 4 Days Of Coffee
reviews.reviewText:
We bought this item at our neighborhood Walmart (which should say something, right there) about 5 days ago on April 11, 2012. It worked well enough albeit a bit loud, but how quiet can a coffee grinder get anyway? It functioned within it's normal daily parameters and we were very happy with it - until today.

I was woken up by my husband this morning who had to bare the bad news to me without getting himself killed, "The coffee grinder doesn't work."
"What do you mean, 'it doesn't work'?"
"It doesn't turn on."

I rolled out of bed and stomped to the kitchen and to my dismay, the coffee grinder indeed did not turn on. I tried multiple outlets in the house - nothing. I tried opening up the base - no significant findings. I even tried the caveman approach and hit it against the counter - zilch.

I did not save my Walmart receipt.
Lesson learned.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder for the price....just one flaw to mention
reviews.reviewText:
When our expensive Braun grinder went on the fritz we needed a new grinder which was significantly less expensive. This grinder fit the bill and the reviews on here were pretty good.

I like how easy it is to use. It has 3 settings, fine, med., and coarse. It also has cup settings so it will grind it just right. I use to grind coffee for 2 weeks- now I just do a daily grind and I love having such fresh coffee.

I also love throwing the top in the dishwasher. Very nice feature! The cord is short but it's not a problem in our kitchen. Excellent value!

***UPDATE 7/18/07*** This grinder still works fine and no major complaints but it has one flaw that the supports inside the grinding cup have all been cut by the blade so they no longer twist. I have to twist them manually once I grind the coffee to get all excess grounds out. Not a big issue but annoying and I will be getting a different grinder once this one goes. Just an FYI...Still a good grinder for $20.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mr. Coffee IDS77 Electric Blade Grinder
reviews.reviewText: I finally found a grinder that doesn't spray coffee all over my kitchen! I've used the traditional "bullet" grinders, burr grinders, and even manual grinders. They all left a certain amount of counter mess to clean after the beans were ground. I'm not a fan of "Mr. Coffee" brand products, but I decided to try this grinder after reading other favorable reviews. I was pleasantly surprised to discover it grinds very evenly for a blade grinder, and doesn't make a mess while doing it. The "chamber maid" feature is somewhat useful, but on the fine grind setting, a lot of coffee still sticks to the inside. I have to use a little brush to free the grounds. It's not "the perfect grinder" but it is a "clean" grinder and I'm very satisfied with the performance so far. Still, it is an inexpensive unit constructed predominently of plastic parts, as I'd expect from the "Mr. Coffee" brand. So, I don't know how durable it will be, and I just can't bring myself to give it more than four stars.
I owned one for years and am please to be able to purchase another

reviews.reviewTitle: Does its job. Grinds beans. However, it ...
reviews.reviewText: Does its job. Grinds beans. However, it likes to leave some big beans behind. I often have to mix the contents up and re-grind my coffee.

Ordered this item in July and didnt get a chance to use it till today. I followed the instructions to the T but the motor just stopped working after a few seconds. Since the purchase was made over 30 days back, Amazon Customer Service refused to assist and said to call the manufacturer. I would not buy this item ever again !

reviews.reviewTitle: Not very consistent. Doesn't fully grind every bean.
reviews.reviewText: It works okay, but doesn't fully grind all of the beans. After making a pot of coffee, I'll find several beans in the basket that are nearly whole.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder even for the "coffee snobs" like me!
reviews.reviewText: I am quite the coffee conisseur, and thus am pretty picky about my coffee products. My husband bought me this for my birthday, since our last "cheapo" coffee grinder was not grinding consistently anymore. I was skeptical, as I had been in the market for a burr grinder this time around. I thought I would try it anyway, and save the difference in money that it would cost to upgrade to a burr. I have to say, I was very impressed! While you do have to hold the button down the whole time it grinds, it does shut itself off when finished, which is nice. The selling feature for me is the removable coffee chamber. You don't have to tip your grinder upside down and tap the coffee into the lid. Nor do you have to hold the entire unit over the sink while you wipe the inside and around the blade with a paper towel, hoping you don't nick your finger! You just pop out the cup, open the spout, and pour your grinds into your filter. Then comes the best part...you just wash the cup in the sink or place in your dishwasher, and voila! Clean as a whistle. And it seems to produce a very consistent grind, which makes me happy, knowing I will get a great cup of coffee. For you other "coffee snobs" out there, the grind chart is obviously way off. Unless you like your coffee to taste like Folgers, use more than the 3/4 tbsp per cup that they recommend! All in all, I am very pleased with this product, and for the price, you can't beat it!

The main reason for this purchase was because the previous grinder was broken, but still usable- it was too ghetto keeping it around, so I bought a new grinder for my Mom.

Originally my Mom didnt want to use this grinder because it looked difficult to use, but once you get used to it, you'll love it! She actually threw away her other grinder after giving MR. Coffee a try (took me a week to have her give it a try).

My Mom used to wake me up in the morning when she made coffee (my room is next to the kitchen), but this grinder is quieter than the one we had previously. I can sleep peacefully in the mornings :)

I like how the cord wraps around the bottom- I dont like when there are wires or cords all over the kitchen, it makes it look messy.

It's easy to clean. It was confusing at first with the twist this to get the lid off, twist this to get the cup out so you can clean it, but once you start using it, it's no biggie!

You get what you pay for. Inconsistent grind - I end up with chunks roughly a 1/4 bean in size randomly in a bunch of "fine" ground coffee. Only the fine, even at 12-cup, "Fine" settings, is definitely not fine... don't try to use it for espresso!

As others have mentioned, the plastic scraper arms eventually break. Ours broke within a year.

That said... it kinda does the job. Kinda. It might work well for a drip coffee machine...or possibly for french press, but definitely not for much else. I wouldn't use it for spices either because of the grind inconsistency.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... the end and I could hear it slow down like it was overstressed
reviews.reviewText: When using this grinder the motor would become very hot once the timer reached the end and I could hear it slow down like it was overstressed. After about two months the motor must have burnt out because it smelled like burning plastic. This is a very cheap product. I would recommend a grinder that actually grinds the coffee and doesn't chop it if all your doing is grinding coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: but it's not exactly a sturdy piece of equipment
reviews.reviewText: I'm on my second one and the plastic "bars" inside that spin around to loosen the grounds broke quite quickly, as they did on my first one. It still grinds, but it's not exactly a sturdy piece of equipment.

First off, I have to say that many of the people who have complaints about this grinder may not have actually taken the extra few seconds to read the manual and understand how the device works. The grinder does a great job and my coffee is always perfect.

to address some issues that others had:

1. The plastic cleaning blade inside the grinding bowl needs to be manually spun (with your finger) to loosen the packed coffee grounds. Usually a single revolution will accomplish this task, then you can put this coffee in the maker!

2. This grinder makes it easy to get the coffee into your coffee maker -- someone was complaining that it was more difficult to clean or use because it comes apart -- this makes it really easy! Detach the bowl from the motor assembly with a short, counter clockwise turn of the wrist, and do the same with the lid (extremely easy, I assure you) -- then dump the coffee from the grinding bowl into your filter, use your finger to agitate the plastic cleaning blade for a second or two to get as much usable coffee out of the bowl as possible, then wash out the bowl with a little water, and dry it with a towel (it is important to dry it immediately to avoid any chance for oxidation) - and you're done! I am not sure why a previous reviewer was using a spoon or scoop to get the coffee out of the bowl -- that's why it detaches from the base! The bowl is marked on the side so you will know what amount of beans to use -- after a few experiments, it is very easy to judge how high to fill it. I just can't understand how it could be more difficult to clean the bowl when it is separate from the base than to clean a grinder that does not detach from the electrical portion...

2.1. if you need to grind your coffee coarsely for a percolator, you should not be buying whole beans - buy your coffee from in large cans from companies that have television commercials and easy-listening jingles, as the end result is going to end up tasting awful, no matter what, if you put it in a percolator.

3. The power cord - other people have addressed this -- the cord is tucked up inside the bottom of the grinder -- simply pull it out, and it is plenty long.

4. Another reviewer said he preferred a different grinder that shuts off automatically -- this grinder does that as well -- put in the beans, choose your settings with the buttons on the side of the unit, and then hold down the grinding button -- continue to hold the button down until the grinder automatically stops -- it will stop when it has achieved the level of grinding that you selected with the buttons.

5. Lights wasting electricity - the reviewer who wrote that the grinder's lights are just wasting electricity is just a sillypants and wants to nitpick. The reality is this: the 2 LEDs that would be lit up while this device is plugged in would draw an almost nominal level of current. At 3.3vac a 100 Watt light bulb uses 30.3 Amps (30,300mA). At 3.3vac each LED would use 20mA -- so, both LEDs would use, at most, 40mA - which is less than 1/750th the amount the 100W bulb would use. You would have to leave the grinder plugged in and turned on for over a full month for the LED lights inside to use the same amount of current (electricity) used by turning on that 100 watt bulb for a single hour.

I have been using this grinder every day for 3 years along with a swissgold coffee filter (if you are still using paper filters you are just wasting trees and missing out on better tasting coffee...) and I have not had a single problem with it -- it grinds the beans consistently to the settings I punch in, and my yield is a delicious pot every morning.

If you couldn't tell, I am quite happy with this grinder. So buy one already!
I bought one of these new on eBay. I used it for less than 2 minutes & then it stopped grinding. I could smell hot plastic. I will never buy a Mr. Coffee product again.
I got this because I thought I would have it for a long time. However I only had . It a couple bbc.co of months. I guess . It was my fault for overloading it.

reviews.reviewTitle: This thing was useless for trying to get a nice
reviews.reviewText:
This thing was useless for trying to get a nice, even coarse grind required for my french press. I would have beans on their way to being a fin grind and still have half or whole beans left in the chamber. Only reason I'm still giving it three stars is that I'm planning on getting an ibrik at some point and I'm assuming that this grinder can handle utterly pulverizing coffee beans...but I'll get back to you on that.

Tl;dr version is: don't bother, buy a burr grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Was super frustrated trying to dish out plastic pieces of my ...
reviews.reviewText: The Plastic pieces inside broke off while I was grinding! Had a friend tell me she had same thing happen. Was super frustrated trying to dish out plastic pieces of my coffee I ground and ended up having to toss it all. I wouldnt have said anything except someone else told me she was on her second one because same thing happened to her!

reviews.reviewTitle: Much better than the hand crank grinder I had before
reviews.reviewText: This grinder works really well to grind my Starbucks coffee beans. Much better than the hand crank grinder I had before.

reviews.reviewTitle: I loved this item until it blew up yesterday
reviews.reviewText: I loved this item until it blew up yesterday. I purchased 3 months ago but I've only been using it for 7 weeks. ??

reviews.reviewTitle: ... had this for about three years and it works pretty well. I am about to purchase another one ...
reviews.reviewText: I had this for about three years and it works pretty well. I am about to purchase another one however, because the plastic clearing wheel inside slowly disintegrated. There are three plastic blades and they broke off one by one until finally the whole wheel gave way and was ground up into the coffee! Its a design flaw that could be fixed with at least some metal parts, but this is what we get from Chinese manufacture!

The grinder works fine, but the lid is difficult to keep clean because things get trapped inside the plastic cavity. Also the mechanism that is supposed to help scrape the coffee out, don't really help that much. We found ourselves going back to our much simpler Hamilton Beach grinder.

Hamilton Beach 80365 Custom Grind Hands-Free Coffee Grinder, Platinum

reviews.reviewTitle: This wouldn't be that bad if it weren't for the fact that now its ...
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder is terrifying. I got it for Christmas, so it's only about 3.5 months old, but already something about it has broken. Something important. You're supposed to be able to have it whir on and off by pressing a button on the lid. However, mine has broken so it stays on ALL THE TIME. I have to plug and unplug the whole thing to turn it on and off. This wouldn't be that bad if it weren't for the fact that now its only safety feature is completely gone. Let's just say that if any wee ones are in the house, I won't be keeping this thing on any low shelves... goodbye fingers!

reviews.reviewTitle: Okay for the price I guess?
reviews.reviewText:
I recently bought one of these. It's okay, but to me the chambermaid and timer features are more gimmicks than useful.

I think this is louder than our old one-- something I don't like.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't burn the coffee like some blades
reviews.reviewText: this is my second one first one about 10 years old still works good just wanted a new one in black not white very very pleased with this coffee maker I have an espresso maker and the percolator and they work great

I have tried so many coffee grinders that I am on my way to becoming a professional coffee grinder critic.

I bought this grinder to use at my workplace. Yes, it's not really a grinder, it's a chopper. Yes, you have to hold the top down to grind. It's actually not too bad. It's not great, but it did the job.

Until it decided to grind the plastic pieces that make up the "chamber maid" cleaning system. Right into my coffee. The grinder lasted just short of four months. I would not pick up another of these unless I really had no other choice.

reviews.reviewTitle: This review is for your protection
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased one of these several years ago from Wal-Mart - and they haven't changed. There is still ONE BIG FOIBLE: A ridiculously short power cord  and Mr. Coffee's excuse for this literal shortcoming? To save them a few cents on raw material costs? Nope - That's too honest. Wait for it.... Wait for it.... The short power cord is provided for my safety  My safety? I have to use a six foot two wire extension cord or unplug this every time in order to dump the coffee grounds - Which _also_ resets the grind and volume settings. Is that for my safety too? What a bunch of Irish blarney. I reckon it does protect my leprechauns from tripping or entangling themselves on that dangerous eight inch power cord as they merrily skip across my kitchen counters at night.

Even Amazon's best seller, theKRUPS F203 Electric Coffee Grinder, has customers complaining of its shortened power cord length (per customer review, reduced from 48 inches to 24 inches). Still, 24 inches is three times the length of a Mr. Coffee power cord and will work for me just fine. BUT - If KRUPS has reduced their power cord length to 8" in an effort to save our lives - It's going back to Amazon via leprechauns pronto. Si, pronto! Si!, travs de los duendes irlandeses pronto  and Macht Schnell to boot!

UPDATE: 2016 September 29
Yes, theKRUPS F203 Electric Coffee Grinderpower cord IS 24" long. Profit motivated safety NAZIS foiled again!

As of this writing I have owned this a week. First off my two complaints. The cord is too short. It is less than 12 inches long. I can see some safety reasons why they did this. You cannot actually fill up the container at the front of your counter while it is plugged in. You have to unplug it bring it to where you can reach it to fill and empty then move it to the back of the counter to reach a outlet. If you have other appliances you have to move them to reach. Seriously, the cord is crazy short. I guess this keeps people from grinding their fingers by accident since it becomes a major thing to plug and unplug. Human factors engineering I suppose.. Second thing is the coarse isn't really all that course. I use exclusively a French press and like a really coarse grind. No matter how I do this it always comes out fine. The preset timers is useless. I basically just have to bump it till it looks tight. It has a clear grind chamber so I can see the grind. I suppose if you do a days worth of grinds for a drip coffee maker then this would be ideal but for a small one person French press type of use, this isn't quite right. I will keep using this but I will keep searching for a better one for my type of use. The grind chamber is all steel and so are the blades. The motor pulls strong and shows no sign of struggling. It grinds pretty quick and is not to noisy .... It does make some noise, it IS a grinder. For light sleepers in the house, it might wake them up. The unit has a good bit of heft so I surmise there is a fair amount of metal in the motor and gearing which for a grinder is a good thing.

We could not figure out how to make this work right. The directions tell you to hold the button down and it will automatically shut off accordingly. It never would shut off on when we thought it should and for some reason, it would go from soft to extremely loud when grinding. We are taking it back tomorrow!!
motor just died after a few dozen uses!
Works for what I need it for: grinding coffee. Cant ask for much more than that.

reviews.reviewTitle: Horrible product and could have chopped my finger off!
reviews.reviewText:
I just purchased this today and was anxious to use it.
1st - No instructions, but figured it was pretty easy since I've owned other grinders before.
2nd - Set the cups and grind medium and hit the push "on" button which I needed to hold in order for it to keep working. I thought it was supposed to grind and shut off automatically to whichever setting I put it.
3rd - The next time I plugged it in, without the top on and the thing shot coffee all over my kitchen! It immediately started upon plugging it in and the plastic top with the on button wasn't even on!
I am taking this product back to WalMart ASAP and also calling the company on it. It's an unsafe product! Or maybe I just got a complete "LEMON"!
The beans are never grinded consistently Ill be looking for a different grinder you should too

The grinder works fine, but the cord is only 5 1/2" long from end to end, so I have to hold it up in the air while I grind it. It is very inconvenient.
They said the reason it is short is to prevent shock hazard. You would have to have an outlet on the top of the counter in order to set the grinder on the counter, now that would be a shock hazard.

So because of the cord I only gave it two stars and I'm not sure it deserved that.

After 2 months, and AFTER use, it was still plugged in (rare for us, it would have happened sooner probably) and started to smoke. Totally melting down at the bottom. Contacted Mr.Coffee as i think this is super dangerous. Sent it back for investigation, got a new one and it happened again after less then 2 months! NOT SAFE. This could burn your house down... I d say to stay away from this thing for safety reasons alone already.

reviews.reviewTitle: dependable grinder at a good price. ????
reviews.reviewText: I have used this to grind beans for my daily cup of coffee since my boyfriend and I got together- 6 YEARS AGO. The fact that it is still functioning so well so much later inspired me to leave this review. This is a solid, dependable grinder at a good price. ????

reviews.reviewTitle: Very pleased and enjoying the better taste of freshly ground coffee!
reviews.reviewText:
I am very pleased with this affordable grinder. My only complaint is the super short cord. It has to be basically right up against the wall to reach. Aside from that, I have no complaints really.

***EDIT: After owning for less then a year, things started breaking. It's still functional, but the plastic is cheap and parts are falling apart. The lid is also a bit cumbersome to get on and off. I would make a different choice if I had it to do over again, but it still works for my purposes.

The chamber maid cleaning system is amazing. I have had many other, more expensive grinders but this is hands down my favorite. Also because the top comes off there is NO MESS when dumping ground coffee into the filter. I wish it was made of metal or looked a little better and the lights on front are too bright but the chamber maid and detachable top make up for everything else. The Best!
I would love to give this five stars as it works great, but there is a flaw in the design and grows mold quickly

reviews.reviewTitle: There's nothing like freshly ground coffee beans to make a fresh cup ...
reviews.reviewText: It grinds my coffee beans to perfection! There's nothing like freshly ground coffee beans to make a fresh cup of coffee in the morning. Very easy to use!
I've never had a coffee grinder that knew how to treat me before
I bought This grinder and it broke the second time I used it. I returned it and got another one, that broke few months later after been used a couple of times. It is a horrible quality.
This quit after two times using it. Poor quality. Dissatisfied customer!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder - and I've never used it on coffee beans
reviews.reviewText:
I and husband Paul use this grinder for numerous items we then use for making nutritious smoothies and hot cereal:
- whole buckwheat (only in the cereal, since it needs cooking)
- flax seed
- sesame seeds
- nuts of various kinds ie. almonds, walnuts, hazelnuts
- hemp seed extrusions

I even use it for dry spices - works wonderfully!

We have had different grinders that all had a plastic piece holding the blades - all of these began cracking within a couple months and soon then broke off. This blender is still in excellent shape after 4 months use every other day. The cleaning features of this model are especially handy, both to remove the contents easily (detach from motor base and easily pour where you want it) and to actually clean. Being able to put the bowl portion right into the dishwasher is great! We liked the first one so much we bought a second so that we have one in each of our 2 homes - one in US and one in Canada, each for 6 months of the year.

I hate this grinder. The cord is about a foot long so if there is anything in front of your outlet you have to move it to grind your coffee. The lid is fiddly and loaded with nooks and crannies that hold coffee grounds and spill them all over your counter when filling or emptying the cup. The "Chamber Maid" cleaning system does nothing useful, and the Coarse-Medium-Fine setting needs to be reset every time the device is unplugged.

reviews.reviewTitle: Thermal fuse blew after 10 uses, rendering it useless
reviews.reviewText: Shorted out after only 10 uses -- and we didn't abuse it. Lights go on but it won't grind and impossible to replace the thermal fuse. Looks like it could be good, but seems a design flaw.

Christmas present looked good. Sub-par operation and construction killed the joy. Grind timer did not work. Ground as long as button held down. Obviously not 'timed' as promised, so grinds as likely to turn out 'fine' as 'coarse' or 'medium.' So called 'Chamber Maid Cleaning system' required several minutes of hot water and soap to clean after use. Not easy. Actual chamber maid would have been fired before lunch. Chamber Maid system thin plastic and likely to give up as in earlier review. Does not clean coffee off the side of the chamber. Cord storage very poor. An excellent example of promises not kept, poor design and construction. Got to be a better one out there.
An excellent grinder for the price. It should be noted that a "fine" grind requires several consecutive operations.

Excellent quality for the price, nice sleek design, and the different grind settings work very well. The self-cleaning mechanism doesn't remove all the grounds from the chamber, though...you do have to wipe the residue out, but that's a minor detail. Very pleased with the product overall!
Works well! Has different grinding settings for any type of coffee! Great for the price too!

This product is a true piece of junk...some idiot engineer came up with idea of a automatic controlled coffee bean grinder?...One can't judge how long to grinder coffee beans?..this unit is terrible, I threw it away after 2 days...I bought it only because it was the last coffee grinder on the shelf, anyway, this unit has these 4 plastic ribs running vertically inside the plastic bean cup, what for ??... ya can hardly wipe it out with a paper towel and if you wash it you have to blow dry it out with a hair dryer so you can grind your flax seed or spices....I like to grind flax seed for my cereal then grind my coffee beans...what a ridiculous pain to clean, it should wipe right out easy..now Mr, Coffee has a simple very basic unit that is a few bucks cheaper, this is the good model you want, the motor in the basic model sound like a good coffee bean grinder rather than a obnoxious cheap sounding plastic unit Mr. Coffee unit IDS77 offers...And I am not paid by the other companies to post a bad opinion about this Mr. Coffee unit..

The 'Chamber Maid' cleaning system is useless - it doesn't scrape the coffee loose, just clumps it up. The cord is too short to be useful, and also - what use is an 'auto-grind' feature if I still have to hold the button down? The grind quality's crap too. If I was allowed to rate this ZERO stars, I would.
Not bad

Had this grinder for maybe least 3 years. It does a good job for grinding very fine. Cleaning is not that easy, the "chamber maid" thing doesn't remove all the grinds from the sides. You still have to tap it a bunch of times or use a spoon to scrape all the grinds out. If you take it apart to wash, it's a struggle to get it back together. And it is very noise when it grinds. But really, it was OK. I gave it up last month to buy a burr grinder instead, but it was still working ok.

reviews.reviewTitle: Product used to be great. In the last 2 years went through 3
reviews.reviewText:
Product used to be great. In the last 2 years went through 3. Strike 3 means your out!!
The Motor and or push down switch failures. Garbage.

reviews.reviewTitle: Power cord is ridiculously too short.
reviews.reviewText: The power supply cord is so short, one has to use an extension cord or literally hold the grinder in one hand adjacent to the wall outlet. It is aggravating to the degree I have abandoned it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Spend a little more for a better grinder
reviews.reviewText: Only worked well for a few months. I still use it but takes a few runs to get my beans to a grind I desire for pour over. I'll find whole beans in the center after 1 run on "fine"
This is the only coffee grounder that I have ever owned. I had it for 8 years now.. It does what it's supposed to do I never had any problems with it.

I have owned this coffee grinder for about a year (used three times a week). I noticed the plastic framework in the coffee receptacle was starting to break last week. I don't know if shards of plastic were getting mixed with my grounds, but its not worth the risk. Going back to the older design.
Perfect for our daily coffee

Plugging in the device, selecting size and coarseness and holding the lid down where indicated do not cause this device to operate.

I've checked the outlet, all the components, and the integrity of the parts but the device does not function. I'm going to return this.

About 3 months in, the button you push on the lid had one of its hinge clips break. Can't push it down now to engage the motor so it's been introduced to the trash can. It worked well till then but too flimsy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for high school or college student!!
reviews.reviewText: I am a freshman in college and I have been using this product for almost 3 years now. It has never once failed to work! It is very easy to clean, simple to use, and effective. The only caveat I would give is that it's a bit of a learning curve on how long to hold down the button for smaller amounts of beans because at 4 scoops and fewer the programmed times don't work anymore. That's not a real problem though - it took me maybe a week to get that figured out. Perfect for any high school or college age student looking for a reliable, effective coffee grinder on a budget!

Keep it simple, stupid. Certainly applies here. Chamber maid cleaner is held together by thin plastic strips that break easily. Never really scraped all the coffee of the bottom anyway. Grind size selector is just a gimmick, much easier just to grind until you get the grind size you desire by holding down a bottom and taking a peak. Take my advice and go with a simple model. You'll be happier in the long run. I give it 2 stars because it actually grinds coffee. It just does so in a more difficult way, and to me, that's just the wrong approach.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked fine when using once / twice in a day
reviews.reviewText: Yesterday I used it 4-5 times in a row and the motor seized. (A quick internet search revealed this is common w/ this product.) I'd choose a different model next time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked great, and then it basically died
reviews.reviewText: Ive had this for about 4 or 5 months. Ive been grinding things like cacao beans and dulse, not constantly, and then recently it basically stopped working. The motors runs and the blade spins (if nothing is in the chamber), but otherwise the blade doesnt really spin now at all.

My husband and I are what my father-in-law calls "coffee snobs." Translation, we grind the beans each morning. I bought this model grinder to be used as our travel grinder. After struggling again this morning to use it, I am ready to share my opinion. The grinder has 3 parts that must be lined up perfectly to work. If you are not fully awake and wearing glasses, you must wait until you are fully awake and have the glasses on to grind the beans. For me, this defeats my reason for needing coffee. My other regular home grinder has 2 parts. A person in a coma could easily grind the beans using it. If I was unethical, I would list and sell mine, but alas we may be coffee snobs, but we aren't unethical!

The three plastic scrapers wear out and disintegrate, you will be drinking them :) and its loud... except for when the motor dies.. then its quiet :)
There are grinders with stainless steel containers, and the coffee just slides out, no scraper necessary.
It did a good job for a while, and it was cheep.

reviews.reviewTitle: Chamber Maid feature not very durable
reviews.reviewText: I bought this coffee grinder about 8 weeks ago (not from Amazon.com) and it has been used twice a day regularly. The Chamber Maid system seems like a good idea, however it doesn't seem to be made in a durable fashion. One of the vertical bars that sweeps the side of the chamber has already cracked where it connects to the top ring. The grinder still works however, and I will use it until it is no longer functional.
Wish the grind was a little more fine but it works great for the price paid

We have used many. This is the best so far. Grinds almost 1/2 pound at a time and as fine or as course as you want. Cleans up easy and doesn't make a big mess. Have had it about 60 days. Routine use. No mechanical problems. Will probably use this model for Christmas presents.

I've been using this grinder (or perhaps an earlier model although it looks exactly the same) for the past 6 or 7 years. I use it to grind beans for drip coffee and I tend to grind somewhat fine and let the coffee soak by preventing the outflow for a couple minutes. It has performed exceptionally. It still grinds as well as it did when new. I have not done anything to maintain it, didn't even know about the long cord hidden in the base until I came to this review page. It just works. Highly recommended. I'm now wondering if I can use it for spices.

reviews.reviewTitle: there are better grinders for same price
reviews.reviewText:
I got this as a replacement for one I'd had for a few years (different brand). This one, the grind can be inconsistent, the button is diffucult to keep pressed. Then it is all guesswork. The "easy clean" system is a joke: this is simply some plastic that scrapes the edges of the chamber - one of which has broken in less than 6 months of use. mine is used daily and has started to make off sounds. The settings save if left plugged in, but not if it is unplugged - a pain considering I use a press and have to readjust each time.

I would not buy this model again.
Extremely loud! Not sure what changed but the old one was no where near as loud. Grinds ok. Typically I have to hold it down longer to get it fully ground
Very easy to use but it lasted about a year and was not used more than 10 times. You get what you pay for.

You know I was really skeptical when I purchased this item. but I am truly astonished with it! It works far better than I anticipated. After iI finished cleaning the chamber maid and she finished screaming; she was spotless!

reviews.reviewTitle: Lasted only 5 months, ok cheap alternative
reviews.reviewText: Well it grinds your coffee and if you are looking for cheap this is a cheap alternative. It wasn't the greatest at really grinding at different levels. If you needed something coarser than fine it wouldn't really evenly grind. The biggest reason we are giving it 3 stars is because it only lasted a few months. It lasted us 5 months. It was used about 3-5 times a week. We are not buying it again, going to try a different brand.
Works great
Best coffee grinder I've owned!

reviews.reviewTitle: If you hate someone, buy them this grinder
reviews.reviewText:
I had hoped that it would grind somewhat evenly. Boy was I wrong.

Possibly the worst grinder ever

Bought this product because it said that it works for spices aswell, used it three times for flax seed and on the third time near the end of the cycle there was a pop and smoke started to come out of the bottom. It was not hot to the touch and did not even give a warning that it was getting to hot. So disappointed because I only owned it for two months.
good!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Fast shipping and easy to use.
reviews.reviewText: Fast shipping and easy to use.
The settings on this grinder are ridiculous. You just get varying degrees of ground with unground or incompletely ground beans on any setting. Sorry I bought this.

reviews.reviewTitle: the scrapers inside grinder break off.
reviews.reviewText: I thought this tool would be great after it was recommended by Consumer Reports. After several months though, the scrapers break off. Not only that, the plastic pieces end up in your coffee. Not healthy at all. Buy something else.

I was excited to receive my Mr. Coffee electric grinder for Christmas. I've used it 10 or 15 times and this morning it broke. The blade will not spin and the motor smells hot. Nothing appears to be blocking or broken from the outside. Also, you are supposed to be able to pull the cord out, but try as hard as I can pull...I can barely reach the outlet with my cord without tipping the grinder over. It was such a fancy, pretty grinder that worked good the first 10 or 15 cups of coffee... =(
This coffee grinder sounds like a jet engine is taking off! Not good a six o'clock in the morning.
I purchased this for grinding pepper. It made some pepper corns into powder and left others whole.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds unevenly. You'll get some of the grinds that ...
reviews.reviewText: Grinds unevenly. You'll get some of the grinds that turn to dust and some that are large chunks. Get a burr grinder, not a blade grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just about acceptable for infrequent use, but the cleaning system actually makes it twice as hard to clean...
reviews.reviewText:
This is *okay* for infrequent use but there four major drawbacks which stop me from giving it a pass as a day-to-day product.

1 - The "chamber maid" cleaning system is near-useless, it actually makes the whole thing harder to clean - especially bad if you're trying to grind other things such as spices or seeds - major flavor transfer.
2 - It's really, really noisy.
3 - The digital grind selection thing looks nice but it's just a timer at the end of the day - and it doesn't remember the setting when you switch it off, so it becomes annoying fast if you want to fine-grind things a lot.
4 - The lid is fiddly and impractical, it's hard to get all the coffee out unless you remove it entirely.

Quite simply, there are far better grinders than this for the same money.

I have purchased several coffee grinders over the years and the Mr. Coffee IDS 77 the worst ever. The cord is so short that you must unplug the grinder to pour the coffee into the basket. Each time you use the product, you must dig out the packed grounds by hand (tapping does not free them). On the positive side, the detachable chamber is easy to clean.
If you are looking for something compact for your counter, look no longer! This goes great with a French press & doesn't take up much counter space! Works great!

I just purchased it,and have used it like 4 times,it does what its suppose to do.PPl, I paid 21.99 for it at Grocery store I suspect I'll use it till,like a year than upgrade but for now Its cool.What did I expect?What i recieved from the product.4stars

reviews.reviewTitle: a piece of junk I should have known better than to buy b&d they must have cheapskates or ...
reviews.reviewText: a piece of junk I should have known better than to buy b&d they must have cheapskates or idiots for engineers I bougt this in wallmart where selections were few .iused it ten times & the motor burned out . typical b&d . spend your money wisely and stay away from b&d guess I will never learn.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just quit on me after a month.
reviews.reviewText: Pretty much sucks. The lit buttons on the side are just for show. It broke. It has ceased to be. I had to grind coffee in the blender. Screw Mr. Coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought this grinder four weeks ago. I have ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this grinder four weeks ago. I have used it 3 times. This morning it refused to work. It is a piece of junk!

This is much nicer than my previous grinder. I like how the grinding bowl easily lifts off the base for easy pouring. A quick twist of the lid, scrapes most of the grinds off the side of bowl too. Two buttons with LED indicators, adjust the courseness of the grind and the grinding time. The grinder automatically stops based on your adjustments. No guessing. Works perfect for me everytime. The cord is more than long enough, you just need to pull it out of the base.

reviews.reviewTitle: Self Destructs After a Few Months Use
reviews.reviewText: First, this grinder is awfully loud. Second, the plastic arms of the "chamber maid" cleaning system cracked after only a few months of daily use. The thing ultimately self-destructed. On the positive side, the blade and grinder mechanism seems to be pretty effective -- considering it ground up the plastic chamber maid part into bits. Off to find a new coffee grinder.

I got this grinder for Christmas. My husband and I brought it home, and after one week the inside grinder broke. We returned it and got a new one. We had it for a couple months, and then the inside grinder partially broke. It has been grinding our coffee pretty well, so I haven't felt the need to get a new one yet. I would say that the grinder is VERY loud for first thing in the morning, but grinds the coffee well.
Messy. Coffee spills easily from lid as well as from removable cup. Hard to clean.
The price is a little too high on this coffee grinder, they should pay you. The power is minimal,grinding bowl too small, the cord is too short. Need I say more??

This coffee grinder is wonderful! It has 3 grind settings so you can grind coffee beans to best suit your coffee maker. Easy to use and has a very convenient flip open lid for easy pouring and is easy to clean. A great product at a great price! Looks classy too!
The black plastic arms in the bowl slowly wear away, putting small amounts of plastic into your coffee every day. Not cool.

reviews.reviewTitle: Have had this baby for 6 years and it still works great
reviews.reviewText: I received this coffee grinder as a gift from my sister when I moved into my own place in 2007. Since then, I have used it on a daily basis. It has never given me any trouble and always grinds for the perfect amount of time. And for the price, you can't beat it.

reviews.reviewTitle: OK but have to press and hold til done.
reviews.reviewText: Used it almost daily for about two weeks. Grinds well. However, last one I had, the lid and chamber were very simple. This one is a bit not user friendly because you have to hold the chamber and lid consecutively while turning opposite while also supporting the base. Also, you have to press and "hold" down the on button til it's done grinding. I don't really like this. My other one, you simply set your grind and press the button. While it's grinding I could ready my coffee cup, condiments, etc. It get's the job done, but it's not as enjoyable as my other one. I'm going to return it and search for another one.
Works great
does what it says and the price was right works perfect cleans up without washing very happy with this purchase

reviews.reviewTitle: The new one works perfectly and I am very happy with it
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a replacement for the same model I had been using for more than six years which had recently started to malfunction. The new one works perfectly and I am very happy with it..
Works OK once you figure out the interlocking parts. The automatic shutoff for various grinds and number of cups is rather unnecessary.

Found one of these at a goodwill (thrift store), thought it'd be a good replacement for my old krups. It wasn't.
It struggles with fine grids, not getting all the bean pieces and having what it actually espresso ground stick to those cleaning arms. Works well enough for French, Drip, or Pour. A bit more difficult to clean (especially after attempting fine grinding) than other blade only models.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just got this from a store and was shocked at ...
reviews.reviewText:
Update: The cord does come out, it unravels underneath, I was trying to pull on it. Not sure why they just don't mention that! Changing rating to 3.

Just got this from a store and was shocked at how short the cord is! Really?! So a person or pet wont teip over it?! Hoe about making it long enough to plug in. I have to set the grinder on top of something to reach the plug, hows that for saftey Mr Coffee? It grinds well but it doesnt grind a lot of coffee at one time. I have read some reviews about this thing smoking and stopping. I guess one gets what they pay for. I am suprised it is still on the market with all its safety issues and lack of perfomance...
This grinder stopped working after 3 months.
Bought at brick and mortar, died after 6 months.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a good grinder if it lasts
reviews.reviewText:
It's a good grinder if it lasts.
I bought mine from Walmart and after using it once a week for 4 mo, it broke.
I'll never buy this brand again.

It's easy to use. The timing system helps.

But the grind is just not consistent. Course grind for french press will have big and small coffee bits. Same with a finer espresso grind. If you really care about your coffee, this won't give you the best grind results.
THIS IS AN EXCELLENT COFFEE GRINDER. I USE THE FINE COURSE TO GRIND MY COFFEE AND IT COMES OUT REALLY SMOOTH EVEN THOUGH THE DIRECTIONS SAY TO USE MEDIUM. YOU CAN'T GO WRONG FOR THE PRICE!

reviews.reviewTitle: Bad for grinding finely for espresso machines
reviews.reviewText: the "fine" setting doesn't grind it fine enough to make decent espresso, so you are stuck guessing how much extra time to add (I haven't yet figured it out). Does a good enough job for drip, though. Very messy, the flip top doesn't help at all. Would not recommend this product.
This thing quit on me yesterday. Just quit. Resigned. Played dead. This brand is over.
Ours finally broke...after SIX years. Way worth it!
grinds perfect
Works great!
I got this grinder for Christmas in 2005. I still use it everyday! The course grind is not truly course though.

I bought this in hopes of getting a functional grinder, even if all the bells and whistles didn't work. Unfortunately, this was a waste of money. The smell of hot plastic permeates the entire grinder and the beans become a powdered blend of unevenly ground, burnt, plastic tasting grounds. I recommend spending another $20 on a better grinder - like a burr grinder.
Does the job perfectly...very little noise. Three different settings are great! Would recommend!

This seems to be a spectacular grinder for the price. I like being able to choose how fine I want it to grind it. It's not too loud either, but naturally, it is not silent! It's fairly clean too and I never make a mess with it, like I've read is the problem with other inexpensive grinders. It has a nice little pour spout so it's easy to just pour it into your coffee filter.

2nd unit worked for awhile, (only sporadic use, wasn't every day) & burned out like the first w/a strong electrical smell. Sunbeam is replacing this one with a different model. Other than that, the features were great, & looked good! Just has a crappy motor.
I am new to the whole "grind your own bean" routine. This grinder is so easy to use and easy to clean. (I usually hand wash because I like the results better.) Worth the price!

This is a poorly designed grinder, downright insulting, in fact, if you consider that the designers think you are stupid enough to fall for the Chamber Maid or the "benefits" of all the other rinky-dink features, like push-button grind control and timer. You don't need that stuff. And it takes two hands and more negotiation than I should have to give to get the grinding cup on and off. A simple grinder is all you need. You grind the coffee til you decide to stop. You tip it over to empty it and you can clean the well with your finger, a brush, or a towel. You don't need Mr. Coffee to think for you. Get outta my way, Mr. Coffee, I don't have time to play with you. Give me my simple one-hand operating grinder, and let me take care of the rest myself.
Works great!
Wonderful design, performance, and quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: So easy a caveman could do it
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to go along with a French press. The grinder sits perfectly on the counter. Simply select the number of cups of coffee you are going to make, then select how you want the beans ground and click the button to start. After a few seconds you can pull the top off the grinder and pour the beans into the coffee pot.

This is a GR~8 Coffee Grinder. You input how many cups of coffee & if you want it ground fine, medium or course. It's great, you put your finger on the grind bottom at top & hold the button down. It stops when it has ground to the desired coarseness.
Easy to use I love it

reviews.reviewTitle: Will never purchase Mr Coffee again
reviews.reviewText: Motor burns up if you grind for too long. Company refused to replace.
I was not expecting it to be that efficient since it is very good in price. But it is very efficient, well product.

It may have been a little too much to hope for a grinder that cleans itself. The only thing that the plastic blades intended for wiping the coffee off of the sides are good for is providing more surface area for coffee grounds to stick to. The removable cup and lid only become nuisances to fit back into place. Green lights that reflect the number of cups the maker is set to grind and the current grind setting only make me think that I'm unnecessarily using extra power (granted it's only pennies, but it's still waste). My last simple coffee grinder lasted 15 years. I don't think I'll last 1 year with this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mr Coffee IDS77 coffee grinder with hambermaid cleaning system
reviews.reviewText: Sturdy, well-made, recommended by Cook's Illustrated and effective. Requires rinsing after use. Automatically determined grinding time depending on grind selected and amount of coffee used convenient. Grind particle size mostly consistent. Instructions helpful.

This is a good grinder for the price, however, it doesn't grind all the beans in one session. You kind of have to shake it a little bit to get the beans mixed up and go to the bottom and grind again. Usually the 2nd times all the beans should have been grind.

WHEN I SAW THE SIZE OF THIS MACHINE I THOUGHT WHAT DID I BUY.BUT WHEN I USED IT THIS MACHINE IS AWESOME.VERY EASY TO USE AND MAKES A PERFECT POT OF COFFEE.THE ONLY WAY TO MAKE COFFEE IS THE OLD WAY ON THE STOVE WITH A OLD PERK MAKER.THIS MACHINE IS THE BEST.PRICE I RIGHT TOO.
I like this product very much.
I bought this coffee bean grinder for my husband as a gift to replace his old one. He has really been happy with the results! His favorite aspect of the grinder is the built-in cleaner.

To say that the Mr. Coffee IDS77 is the worst coffee grinder ever made, is an insult to the worst coffee grinder ever made! This product simply does not do the job right. Even on the "Fine" setting, you have to run the beans through twice to get them all ground up. You have to continuously hold down the button on the top to get it to operate, unlike other coffee grinders on the market (Cuisinart, for one) where you just set it, start it and walk away. I would never recommend this product to anyone anywhere. Other coffee grinders are the same price, so save yourself time and headache, get one that does the job without having to babysit the darned thing!

reviews.reviewTitle: Mr. Coffee IDS77 Electric Coffee Grinder
reviews.reviewText:
This is our Second replacement....Luckly both were under warranty..
My HONEST opinion ....Look for something else made of a BETTER QUALITY !!!
Again don't waste your $$$$....

reviews.reviewTitle: Good as long as it works
reviews.reviewText:
the bottom of the grinding chamber that attaches to the grind shaft, is plastic.
the blades are attached to this plastic base. the plastic melted and the blades will not turn any more.
small design flaw rendering the unit useless.
I've had this grinder for about 6 months. My biggest issue with it is that I get a very uneven grind. Lately I've ended up with chunks of whole beans. Also, the electrical cord is way too short.
Works great and pretty quite.
Works well, easy to clean. I have used for coffee and spices and the detachable grinding cup/bowl works excellently and is easy to empty and clean. I would give this as a present.
Product was Damaged , returned
I was very pleased with the coffee grinder. It is very easy to clean. I use it for grinding flax seeds and it does a very good job turning the seeds into powder for my drink.

reviews.reviewTitle: Take it back if you have a normal kitchen
reviews.reviewText:
The box descriptions sound impressive and the price is right, but if you have cabinets hung over your counters and outlets in the wall under there, you're out of luck.

The cord is so short, you'll be grinding beans at arms' length, hoping you don't bop your head on the cabinets. The instructions say it's a safety feature, but it's an annoyance.

We have a cooking island counter in the kitchen, and can't use it. The cord won't reach from the outlet to the countertop unless we have the grinder perched on the very edge. An extension cord would be silly and hazardous in the kitchen.

So, take it back and get another brand. Check the cord length before purchasing. The display models all had their cords cut off, so we ended up opening a taped package to check the Black and DEcker replacement we selected. But we were buying it, so no harm, no foul.
This product works great. I use it every mourning and it always grinds my coffee to perfection!
This unit works well but the power cord is so short that I have to hold it to be able to reach my power outlet. I will try to take it apart to install a longer power cord.
I was quite surprised by how easy it is to use and keep clean...A keeper for sure!
This coffee grinder broke after two months of using it once a week. Do not buy this grinder. Manufacturer needs to improve quality.

i got this grinder from lowes store yesterday, got the extra year replace/return warrenty so i will be returning it real soon once i get a new one.
my suggestion, DO NOT BUY THIS!! spend the extra 15$ and get a good one.
it is wonderful,easy to use,set at how fine you want your bean,it shuts itself off

I had it for few months, after several use. The motor stopped working and burned out.
Don't buy it period!!
I bought this coffee grinder because my son needed to have his formula thickened and I was instructed to grind the rice cereal...it broke in a week after daily use!
The power cord is about 3-4" long. Stupid excuse is so that persons or pets will not become entangled or trip over it. Ridiculous!

To be fair, the manual explicitly says not to use this mill for spices, but that's what I used it for, and it only lasted 8 months before the plastic parts broke and the drive shaft lost its grip. The removable (and dishwasher-safe) grind chamber is a nice feature, though.
The electric cord is exceptionally short and the grinder must be within a few inches of an outlet.
Don't do it!!! Get a real grinder!!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great idea so much better than previous grinder
reviews.reviewText: I just bought this and used it once. The old Mr. Coffee Grinder would accumulate this fine coffee powder around the top of the metal bowl and when you put the lid back on over and over, eventually it would get pushed into the motor area and come out the bottom vent. When this happened to our first grinder, I decided I would use the end of the coffee scoop to scrape this rim clean so the coffee powder wouldn't get pushed down, but eventually there it was all over my counter coming out the bottom because there was no way I could scrape it all. I opened the bottom, thought I got it all out and put the bottom back on, not two days later and more coffee on my counter. All that extra scraping did nothing except maybe buy me a little time. Not anymore, this grinder solves this problem totally.

reviews.reviewTitle: very long cord cable over 2 ft , can be reduced to as much you want .!
reviews.reviewText:
First of all the cable is over 2 ft , just pull it out , half of the customer complains about short cable , does anybody have brains those days? if not you should go on something stronger than coffee . If even stated in the MANUAL
The grinder works as expected , also great for making sugar powder and other stuff . Easy to clean , easy to set up
The only thing is that you need to press the button while grinding and wait until it is finished , if you left your finger the result will be not as expected .but I know it was made for safety purpose so child will not put fingers inside or those with less brain start grinding without closing the lid .. you know .
I grind beside beans my regular grounds for my cappuccinos sometimes make it much fine for more aroma and taste

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great appliance. Affordable and easy to use
reviews.reviewText: This is a great appliance. Affordable and easy to use. For some reason, we had not had whole beans at the house because we thought this was going to be too complicated and expensive. We would buy whole beans from a big box warehouse store and grind them there ... this is just too easy though. You set for the amount and the fine/rough grain -- then just press down until it stops. The clean up is easy as well --- just wash in the sink (not in the dishwasher). The cap/top just unscrews really easy and boom; its done. We can tell a difference in our coffee.

This is a great coffee grinder for the price. It has four settings for the amount of beans and three for the type of grind (course v. fine) you are looking for. The chamber that grinds the beans is easy to screw on and off and washes easily, so water never has to come in contact with the base that includes the motor. I also appreciate the lid that screws on and off and opens to pour out the beans. When I make coffee, I grind the beans, remove the chamber with the top, then shake the chamber with the top closed to make sure none of the grounds are stuck to the bottom.

Great product for a coffee lover who isn't super serious or technical about grind levels, but likes to grind their coffee every morning. Will work for french press, pour over, or regular drip (e.g. a Mr. Coffee).

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Grinder On So Many Levels!!
reviews.reviewText: We bought this same grinder about 5 years ago to replace one by another company which broke after 1 year of use. We have loved this Mr. Coffee Electric Coffee Grinder. I am a Barista at Starbucks and I like the fact this one has a Coarse setting for use with my French Press, a Fine Setting for Espresso machines, and a Medium setting for a paper cone filter.
