Love that the cup is removable to pour out the grounds. LOVE the chamber maid thing you turn and it scrapes most of the sides and bottom. I've only used it for coffee but plan to use for spices. There is timer. You set the type of grind and how many cups.

reviews.reviewTitle: Never have I been more disappointed in a well known manufacture
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this product in May 2017 ,and it died August 2017...Only 3 months !!!
Save your money, do not buy this grinder..
Never have I been more disappointed in a well known manufacture...

Aside from the coffee beans not being ground like it should, the chemical smell from the plastic was unbelievably overbearing. I had to rewash the dishes it was with in the dishwasher to help remove the smell. I can't even get it out of my hands. I followed the instructions to grind the beans and was disappointed as the beans in the center were barely touched. Very disappointed!

reviews.reviewTitle: Smelling the coffee being ground up was amazing! The next day
reviews.reviewText: I have never used coffee beans before. A friend of mine invited my husband and I over for dinner and she ground coffee for us for an after dinner drink. Smelling the coffee being ground up was amazing! The next day, I ordered mine and this machine works perfectly! It takes seconds to grind and pour it into the coffee basket to brew. Love this machine!

Never grinds evenly: there are always almost whole coffee beans even though I chose fine grind. Also, the options on the front keep resetting each and every time I unplug the machine. Lastly, the chamber maid feature is not great. It is easier and quicker to use the back end of my coffee scoop to remove any remaining grinds.

works good. I use ti for the office. It resets itself every time you unplug. But that is good for me since it goes to what I use. It is a good buy. It grinds very good. But you may have to push it down a few times and shake it to get it fine enough. But that is to way most inexpensive works.
I purchased this and it just stopped working. Im not sure why but it did and Im going to have to return it. I liked it while it worked so I will try it once more.

Works great. We don't use it a lot, but when we buy the wrong type of bean (whole beans instead of ground) it saves us from taking another trip to the store to exchange them. We use less coffee than they mark the tub because their mix is too strong for us.

Works wonderfully! I was very nervous, having never ground my own coffee beans before but I was told that it was a "must" This grinder makes it nearly full proof and easy to portion. Small enough to store in limited counter space but strong enough to grind enough for several cups of coffee.

need I say more. I took the trouble to buy this. unpack. put it together. then guess what. It does NOT even turn on.
miserable experience. I will NEVER buy anything from this company ever again!

I've has more expensive grinders that ultimately failed. This unit is quite basic but very effective and reasonably priced. I use it every day in two different locations and the units have lasted years.
Horrible. Just tried using this the first time and it would not turn on. Had to remove most of the beans to get it to start and the few beans it ground still had big chunks.

We have one for coffee and another at the livestock barn for medications. We also use on occasions to grind herbs and peppers that have been dried from the garden.
it's GREAT

It is not as good as my first one. This one I gave to hold down a button till it stops. The first one did it by itself. The first held more beans than this one. That is why I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars.

Not impressed. "Chamber Maid" does not really sweep container. Still need a small stiff brush to remove. The removable grinding chamber is very very hard to twist off. As far as grinding, does that well. But if thats all you want is something that grinds, there are cheaper grinders out there.

Have had the white one for a couple of years now, and other than the three little plastic bowl scraping fingers - which broke off a couple of months ago, with absolutely no decrease in operation,m it's been perfect. Recently I wanted one in black for a different kitchen. At the price, I couldn't resist getting two (which brought my purchase up past the free shipping threshold.
My original still functions fine, but can you imagine the bad morning you would have if all you have is whole bean coffee and no coffee grinder? Too terrible to imagine. So I keep the second black one for a back-up. At the price I paid, it's really cheap "happy morning" insurance.

I love this coffee grinder because it has grind settings that actually do what they say and the chamber maid cleaning system which totally works. I used to get annoyed trying to scrape residual grounds out of the grinder and now I don't have to. Although, it is worth mentioning that this system works better in low humidity. I used to live in a humid climate and the chamber maid system didn't work quite as well - I guess because the grounds would be slightly moist. In a drier climate it works like a dream. I had my first one for years and only got rid of it because I was moving and trying to minimize my boxes. But I immediately purchased a new one - for price and function this is the best you will find.

This coffee grinder works so well - I feel guilty about how inexpensive it was!

1. I have two of these grinders - one black, one white - one at the office and one at home.
2. We have been using them for over a year - daily!
3. Our favorite feature is - the grinding bowl comes off! So you simply remove the container with the grinded beans after grinding, "spin" the lid back and forth a couple times to get the grinded coffee off the sides of the bowl, remove the lid and invert the grinding bowl to pour the grinded coffee into your coffee maker.
4. And once a month or so - we just put the grinding bowl through the dishwasher - and it comes out looking like new. Nice.
5. Reliable, attractive, ingenious design...We love it!

Our Mr. Coffee grinders have worked perfectly for us - and we have recommended this product to a lot of our friends, and they have all been happy too.

Enjoy!

Okay, used to have a really expensive grinder that constantly clogged up. Spent more time cleaning it than enjoying coffee.
Friend gave me a 3lb pound bag of Costco coffee recently, so I thought I'd buy a cheap grinder.
Well let me tell you: this is one well designed little gizmo. It's a blade grinder that can actually grind coarse or fine.
It's top lifts off, which means transferring the coffee to a bowl or container is way easier and cleaner.
It cleans up in about 30 seconds.
I love this little grinder.
You will too!

Worked for 3 seconds, then stopped. The most I can get out of it now is a little buzzing sound. Nothing is blocking the blades. I tried it with and without coffee beans. I do not recommend this product.

This coffee grinder has 3 settings: fine, medium, coarse. Once you set the amount of cups you want and start the grinder it automatically stops for the proper setting! The top comes off and the cup comes out to easily wash it. I would buy it again!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Coffee Grinder for the Size and Price
reviews.reviewText: Fantastic little grinder! Love that it has a tiny footprint and easily fits on the counter next to the coffee maker. I had a Cuisinart coffee grinder that was much larger and consistently clogging up. I'll update the post in a few months to let you know how it's holding up.

reviews.reviewTitle: We love the fact that you can choose the grind size
reviews.reviewText: My hubster breaks the coffee grinders fairly regularly, so we've had a few. This is an upgrade to the last one we had. We love the fact that you can choose the grind size, and we especially love that the entire bowl comes off the grinder. The removable bowl makes it so much easier to get all the coffee out and for cleaning. Hubster promised to be more careful and not break this one!
This grinder worked great for about 4 months, then it started acting up. You would have to unplug and plug it in several times to get it to work. Today it just quit working all together.

I got so excited about this coffee grinder. The last one I had would make a mess and leave coffee grounds everywhere. This coffee grinder is the perfect size and shape and doesn't make a mess everywhere. It is also easy to clean. I am so happy I made this purchase.

I love my mr. Coffee, coffee grinder it works fabulously I usually buy coffee beans in bulk and then grind as necessary and I love it because it lets me grind a lot of coffee really really fast. Yet is a small enough to fit in a kitchen cupboard with no problem. Clean up is quick and easy and the top can easily go into a dishwasher just make sure the water temperature is lower

reviews.reviewTitle: Good quality grinder for the price point
reviews.reviewText: Good quality grinder for the price point. Has a few too many buttons and pieces but it's fairly easy to work and clean. Bought in March and now its September and sadly the motor must have failed maybe manufacturer defect. I have only been using it to grind my coffee evey other day. Now I have a ton of coffee beans and no way to grind them to drink

I used the settings for 10 cups and a medium grind and still had whole beens after to programed time for grinding was done. Made 10 cups this morning with cup setting for 12 cups and fine grind and that was too much. will have to keep experimenting. Cleans up easily

Bought this for my specialty Sunday morning coffee. Grinds very well and has varying levels of grain consistency to choose from. Grinder is small, but produces decent quantity of grounds. Would recommend.

Absolutely terrible. I ordered one off Amazon, it broke a few weeks later. I had Amazon return and replace the item because the first one broke. I gave this second one a chance, and it broke TWO DAYS AFTER the 30 day return window. I'm beyond disappointed. I wasted my money and now I can't get a refund because the second one broke right after the time period. I only used it three times!!!
It works well. There are 3 grinding settings, that work well ! Simple review, of a simple and easy to use small grinder. A great price too !!
Fast grinder. Like the fact that it stops automatically when finished grinding to your choice of grind size. Very nice. Yes, of course it is noisy.
I've been using it for close to a year now. Super easy to use, it grinds the beans at many different grades, and it just works as it should.

This is my second Mr. Coffee grinder and I love it. I got the first one many, many years ago and it's still operational. I got a second one just to have. I don't grind a lot of coffee but the coffee that I do grind gets ground perfectly.

reviews.reviewTitle: and I liked him so much that I bought the same one ...
reviews.reviewText: I can never decide how I want to make my coffee in the morning--espresso, french press, drip? Luckily this grinder has settings for all 3 grind types, which is fabulous! This guy has been working for me for a while now, and I liked him so much that I bought the same one for my friend (another coffee addict). I really like that there is an auto-timer for the grind (hold down the lid until it stops), which eliminates a lot of the guesswork, and the dreaded cowboy coffee when using the french press... 10/10 would buy again!
I like cold brew and a coarse grind is best. This unit does that very well. It's also hands with spices, etc where a fine grind is required. It'll come in quite handy.
The lid seems like an afterthought. It wiggles and is hard to pour. Its impossible to get the product all out.

Been using it about six weeks works every time no faults I can find. Sure it cannot read your mind if you demand a very particular grind but is easy to master and end up with the result you need. Some reviewers are awful judgmental of a Twenty dollar item. I grind Ten cups worth at a time it has met my expectation each time and nothing has broken. Reading these reviews before purchase and again after some just seem silly.

It is somewhat loud I presume any grinder in this range would be.
I took advantage of Amazon's 4 for 3 offer and highly recommend anyone do so if possible.

Bottom line it works is easy to clean and inexpensive.

We've been using this for several months now and haven't had any issues yet. And whether we're using our French press, Italian espresso maker or k-cup machine, this works great at grinding our coffee beans to whatever fineness is needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great little grinder
reviews.reviewText: This is a great little grinder; easy to operate. I only use it to grind coffee beans but I suppose you could use it to grind spices or hard cheeses like Parmesan. At first I thought the cord was only about 6" long because it was wrapped inside the base; The cord is actually about 2 feet long. The settings are coarse for American coffee or fine for espresso. You must hold down the button for about 10 seconds, for the grinder to work. The price is right especially if you join Amazon prime.

I decided for this grinder based mostly on its good pricing and looks. It works very good and the removable chamber for cleaning as a very welcomed improvement over other grinders. This feature alone makes this purchase a good one. Another bonus is the automatic stop after some time has lapsed based on your settings on kind of grinding and number of cups. You can stop it earlier but this feature prevents you from grinding too long.

The look is nice and goes well on the counter top as it has some hi-tech air.

Regarding the noise I didn't find any difference when compared to others. Its noise but the grinding takes just a few seconds.
I use it to grind stuff other than coffee. I found this thing works as advertised. Therefore seems worth the inexpensive price.
Bought it for my husbands cpffee bar over a year ago.. Nd he has yet to use it. But it was easy to clean since i cleaned it after our move

Don't come at me with that hipster ceramic grinder BS. Yea sure, that's cool and all. But this right here. It's dope. Grinds a ton of coffee and has these little prongs that you move back and forth to gather all that powered, compacted coffee at the bottom. Get one.
I'm completely satisfied with the ease of cleaning and the smooth operation of the coffee grinder. As you can see I use the grinder to grind raw cashews for baking.
Nothing beats fresh ground coffee and this grinder is easy to use and inexpensive. The reports of a short cord are certainly true, but it's something I can live with.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like this. It grinds quickly
reviews.reviewText: I like this. It grinds quickly, but even on the smallest grind setting, it sometimes leaves larger grounds. It doesn't bother me enough to send it back, but if you had a true espresso maker could be a problem.

I had this coffee grinder for a couple weeks before I used it. Once I did, I noticed the coffee beans would grind unevenly, leaving fine, powdery grinds stuck against the sides and below the blades. The rest of the beans weren't completely ground. I used the machine a total of 6 times over a couple of weeks, when it finally died.

I'd recommend spending a few extra dollars for a better brand/grinder.

I'd give it 5 stars if there was an easier way to get the finished product out and if it had a memory setting of some sort. Other than that, really easy to use and grinds beautifully. My mom got one of this exact same grinder and uses it regularly and has for almost 20 years!
Works great, way better than my old Kitchen-Aid coffee grinder. Nice and quiet. Love the self timed grinding and adjustability. The only drawback-It is a little cumbersome to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mr Coffee has cheapened the construction!
reviews.reviewText: We had one of these for many years and it provided great service but eventually wore out, so we bought another one. It has a much cheaper fit and finish than the old one. The bowl has a looser much less positive fit. The lid used to snap fit closed, now it does not, so when emptying the bowl it makes a mess of grounds on our kitchen counter. Worse of all, they shortened the electric cord by so much that it no longer reaches a standard height kitchen outlet, this means the grinder must be held up in the air with two hands near the outlet when ginding. We are now shopping for a different grinder and this one will end up in the garbage.

reviews.reviewTitle: you get a mix of fine and really course grinds
reviews.reviewText: Due to the fact that courseness of the grind is only based on the length of time in which you grind the coffee beans, you get a mix of fine and really course grinds. Doesnt work so well when your using a percolator.

I was very excited about this coffee grinder, but when I received it, it had a horrible, strong chemical smell. I tried airing it out, washing it, nothing worked. It smelled up my whole kitchen. There was no way I was going to grind coffee in that thing and then drink it. It was horrible smelling. Returned it.
Nice little coffee grinder I like the options for what grind you prefer. The cup comes out and is easy to clean. the only thing is the burnt plastic smell from manurfacturing I hope it passes.

reviews.reviewTitle: I've had several grinders before and this works better than anything
reviews.reviewText: Not big on product reviews but going out my way on this one. I've had several grinders before and this works better than anything. On con is the light on the side, I could do without those and would be better to be analogue. Lots of control and cleaning is so easy, you put in the dishwasher. Also, NO FREAKING MESS!!! Every grinder I've had spills something and this one the top comes off and pour the coffee without spills. Best part - 17$. I'm ordering a 2nd one because I know because I like it - it will be discontinued.
Love this. I kind of wish it was just a pinch bigger though. Great price. Grinds very fine like I like mine done. Many settings to choose from. Easy to clean. Very pleased.

I have bought two of these, one I've used for several years and now one to give to a friend. Does a fine job grinding coffee to different grinds while handling different amounts of coffee. I use mine every day. The cleaning system does work well though you need to be careful not to break it as it is light plastic. Overall a great product for the cost. I had a costlier system which lasted less than a year and could not come close to operating like this product does. It certainly rates five stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: First Blade Grinder I Have Ever Liked
reviews.reviewText:
Normally I would only use a blade grinder for spices, but my burr grinder started dying. The grinder produces a consistent grind for the auto drip maker I have. I haven't tried the coarse setting for my percolator yet.

Plus Side:
- Simple to use.
- Easy to clean.
- Consistent grind.

Minus Side:
- The grind bowl has a maximum fill line and 10 tablespoons of coffee beans reaches the limit. If I am following the manufacturers directions, I can only grind enough for 10 cups.

Bottom Line: I would buy it again and recommend it to a friend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Used this about 4-5 times. For some reason, ...
reviews.reviewText:
Used this about 4-5 times. For some reason, it stopped working a few months ago. It cost very little but expected more usage out of it.

Now, I have about 30 pounds of Starbucks coffee that is sitting on my shelf.

reviews.reviewTitle: I've had this grinder for a few years now and ...
reviews.reviewText: I've had this grinder for a few years now and it still works well. I don't use it very frequently - about once a week max, so if you grind daily you might have issues? I'm not sure. But it still works as new for me.
This has converted me to buying whole beans and grinding them myself for better tasting fresh coffee. Cleaning it could be easier, but you aren't buying this for quick and easy.

reviews.reviewTitle: works as a coffee grinder but self clean is underwhelming.
reviews.reviewText: I like the different settings even though I use them for different levels then labeled. The self clean function doesn't fully work and I still have to clean it out manually each morning.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... if you follow the instructions of steeping you will love this grinder
reviews.reviewText: Grinds well and if you follow the instructions of steeping you will love this grinder.

You can not beat this little grinder for the price. Compact, doesn't take up loads of space, it's not very loud and grinds nicely. I like that there is a settings button on it so you can choose your grind. It's easy to take apart and clean as well. It also grind up spices nicely!

reviews.reviewTitle: Not impressed, already searching for its replacement.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this December 2016. Apparently this is only good for grinding up very small amounts of beans at a time. It gets very very hot and overheated very quickly. It does not grind the beans down smooth at all, always leaves a lot of chunks. Not very with happy with it at all. I guess this is a ' you get what you pay for' type of thing.

This is a great little coffee grinder. Emphasis on little, which is fine with me, as I only brew enough for a couple days at a time. You do have to reset the preferences after unplugging the grinder, but that seems fairly common. The only thing I am not a fan of is that you have to hold the lid down the entire time it is grinding, but otherwise I think this is a great item, especially for the price!

reviews.reviewTitle: it worked good while I had it
reviews.reviewText: i bought this grinder back in March and it lasted for 6 months, it worked good while I had it. So I ordered a new one. Hopefully this one will last longer.
It automatically grinds the beans to whatever you set it for strength and how many cups. It shuts off automatically. Perfect grind every time. Very reasonable price too.

Love this grinder! Operation is easy and you get the perfect amount you need for the amount of coffee your making. The self cleaning feature, spout and choice of grind makes it easy to make a great pot of coffee.
Didn't turn on after a few uses. Returned.

reviews.reviewTitle: I do like that the cap of the grinding cup/bowl twists
reviews.reviewText:
does the job. not sure about the need for the settings lights/buttons....

I do like that the cap of the grinding cup/bowl twists, which moves a mechanism inside the bowl to scrape grounds off the side.
It was used lightly for about 17 months, and then it just overheated and died. It worked well during the 1.5 year.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best coffee grinder for the price.
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder works great. Just simply measure the amount of beans you'll need as stated on the side, select your level of grind, and hold down the button until the grinder stops. Its easy to clean because the lid and the grinding cup are removable. I highly recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: I don't mind starting it with a pen though and its pretty awesome.
reviews.reviewText: Within 6 month i lost the plastic pin that engages the grinder. I don't mind starting it with a pen though and its pretty awesome.

Depending on how many beans you put in and what setting it's on it can take 15 seconds to a minute to grind em up, grind for a few seconds, stop check consistency and continue till you get to how you like your beans. I also give it a few shakes in between the grinding, seems to help. My only grip is the cord could be longer.

This is a very disappointing product. It tries to do too much, when all that's needed is a coffee grinder. After trying to turn it on numerous times, I ask my son to help me. He got it to turn on, but only with difficulty.

Ok, I have had this since 2009 and I have not had any problems with it at all. It has been so nice to have freshly ground coffee. My wife and I follow the directions for grinding and for cleaning. If you do this you won't have any issues. The unit is small and it does what it was made to do. The description tells you all you need to know. I cannot say anything bad about it as I just follow the directions and it works as it should. I highly recommend it to anybody who loves freshly ground coffee and the smell associated with it.

Happy drinking!

reviews.reviewTitle: Very Difficult To Get Coffee Out After Grinding!
reviews.reviewText: Grinds great but a major pain in the you-know-what to get ground coffee cleaned out. Will never buy again.
I absolutely love this. Its small enough to keep on the counter or tuck into a cabinet. Easy to use. Perfect results.

I used it once and it broke down, It does not work anymore.
I followed all the instructions to troubleshoot it, and it did not work.

Love this coffee grinder. I bought one for my girlfriend because she is just starting to get into using a french press and buying whole beans. I have 2 others at home that get a lot of use. I try to avoid washing it too often, for I dont like to get soap or anything in it that could effect the taste of my coffee, so I have one for light roasts and one for dark roasts. It is nice to be able to decide the grind size and it also has the option to adjust for the amount of cups as well.
Grinds coffee to my liking. Works great. This is my second one. The other was 14 yrs old. I ground coffee daily and the inside wore out. I'd say the small investment is worth it.

This is a good coffee grinding machine built with the Mr Coffee quality. It works fine, does what it says it will and given my once a day use will likely be around for a long time. My ONLY fault with it is that it might be a case of overkill. I don't need all the settings that are built in for my last machine used the fly by the seat of your pants approach: press a button after loading and guess how long to grind by looking. Now that I have them though I'm learning to use them. Time will tell, I suppose.

Great coffee grinder....does what it is made fo very well...only con would be there is always some coffee clinging at the bottom....likely from bean oils?...I imagine they all do? This is a breeze to clean.....good product...good value
You wont find a better grinder for the price-- easy to use with great controls. So good i bought one for my daughter and she loves it
This is the second Mr. Coffee grinder we've had. Had the other so long we wore it out. Nice unit, had no problems with the first one. Ordering was quick, delivery was right on time. Good experience.
Replaced a more expensive grinder. Works flawlessly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good coffee grinder at a very attractive price.
reviews.reviewText: This is the second time I bought this coffee grinder. The first one lasted 3 years despite frequent use. It grinds coffee well, has easy to use controls, and the cord is long enough to not feel tethered.

I bought this to get course ground coffee but using the button settings provided it leaves whole beams behind. If I do it manually it works better. This is my first coffee grinder so I have nothing to compare it to but it's not too loud.
Fantastic item replacing the ol' venerable BRAUN. this is by far the best bang for the buck. in fact is way cheap for the features. My wife is totally in love with this new boy in town.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great coffee grinder, small and convenient
reviews.reviewText: I've owned this coffee grinder for about 3 years and love it. It's quick, powerful, and small enough that it doesn't require tons of storage space. I docked one star on my review because the plastic arms inside the grinder bowl broke and the entire turning grinder mechanism became useless. I ended up buying a new grinder online. So, the short story is to GENTLY HANDWASH the grinder bowl and don't stick it in the dishwasher. Otherwise, I love this grinder. I use mine for spices and seeds.
Only used once and all ready burned out. Poor settings, not able to grind very fine coffee.
I wasn't looking for any huge grinder with all the bells and whistles, and this fit the bill nicely. It works as advertised and is easy to clean. No complaints and no issues with it to date.

LOVE this grinder! this is the 2nd one we've had. The other we bought in 2011. We somehow lost the lid to the first one last year & found it after I had given up and thrown the rest away! UGH! It worked GREAT for 6 years! I love that it has an automatic stop. Seems to grind perfectly for whatever choice you pick.
easy to use, easy enough to clean, and does a good job grinding beans from coarse to fine grinds
Grinds my coffee, what else can I say? I like the little self cleaning function that helps scoop the grounds out.
Turns the stuff on the bottom to dust and doesn't grind the beans on the top. U must stop and stir or shake to get a semi even grind.
Bought as a gift for my dad, who drinks a ton of coffee. He said it works really well!

reviews.reviewTitle: and has some nice features. For the price
reviews.reviewText: It does the job, and has some nice features. For the price, I don't think I could have found anything better.

Piece of junk. No consistency in the grind. It has a very small chamber. Have to grind often for just a couple cups a day - like every day. Leaves half and whole beans in the mix. Wish I hadn't bought it for the $12 bucks I spent way back when. It makes me miss my old Hamilton Beach coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice and clean - no more grounds on the table.
reviews.reviewText: This works great. Our old grinder had a top that you had to remove, and it always left coffee grounds on the table. This one seems to leave more grounds under the blade than our last one, but occasionally cleaning it out with the plastic scrapper built into the grinder works pretty good. Makes nice uniform grind. It was interesting to us how much longer the automatic settings grinds - we were grinding way too short a time on our old one.
We love this coffee grinder, we really like how it has so many options for so you can find what grind setting works best for you and your likes
Great for grinding beans, but even better for grinding spices!!!!! Nice cord wrap at the bottom, which makes for easy storage!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder! With many options at a great price ...
reviews.reviewText: Great grinder! With many options at a great price point. I read a review where this grinder was in the top five. I like the grind options for when I'm doing French press or auto drip.

my wife bought this because she loves to make espresso and all the other products she had used for that purpose were absolute failures... we thought about purchasing a more expensive machine but could not bring ourselves to pay hundreds of dollars just to grind beans for espresso a few times a week...

what a shock - it worked!! even our son-in-law, another espresso lover, was amazed at how much better my wife's espresso-making skills became after using this grinder!

just to show you how happy we are with the product, we are going to buy a second grinder for our son-in-law!

we have had the grinder for a couple of months so I am unable to report on whether the grinder will hold up to long-term use...

reviews.reviewTitle: This is the best. Our favorite
reviews.reviewText: We grind beans every day. This is the best. Our favorite. Like the adjustments. Finally had to replace the old one. It lasted for years.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's great having such a fresh cup of coffee in the ...
reviews.reviewText: I won several bags of gourmet coffee at a winter celebration. Unfortunately they were whole bean and we had nothing to grind them with. We found this on Amazon and it has worked well. It is so effortless to grind the beans to the desired texture. It's great having such a fresh cup of coffee in the morning.

reviews.reviewTitle: I've got an older version which grinds perfectly. For ...
reviews.reviewText: I've got an older version which grinds perfectly. For some reason this takes two runs to grind the same consistency as the older one.

We have roasted our own coffee beans for years. My son-in-law has become interested in roasting, as home roasted is far, far better than store beans or packaged coffee. I gave him my old Mr. Coffee and looked on the Internet for a newer and better grinder. I COULD NOT FIND ANY GRINDER THAT WAS AN IMPROVEMENT over the old Mr. Coffee. Not wanting to ask for my Mr. Coffee grinder to be returned to me, I bought the exact same model again. Over the years this remains our #1 choice for a grinder.
This grinder is very easy to use and comes at a good price. Wish the parts came apart a little more for cleaning though.

I bought this exact same product 9years ago (!) and It just broke (sort of. It still works, but it didn't turn on once so I decided to buy another one to be safe)... after 9 years!!! I used this almost every day too.

It stops automatically at the setting you decide, easy to get beans in/out... the cord can be wrapped under the machine so very easy to organize.... It looks nice and clean too.

For the price, quality and durability, you can't ask for more!
its garbage. we have attempted at all settings, and for multiple periods of time to get the coffee to be ground favorably. NOPE. its all inconsistent and some is fine some aren't even touched.

reviews.reviewTitle: but it grinds my beans very finely and looks nice on the counter
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder has quite a few features that I don't personally need since I'm using a single cup coffee maker, but it grinds my beans very finely and looks nice on the counter. Well worth the purchase price.
couldn't handle the heat, so I kicked it out the kitchen. died within thirty minutes

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought one in October and it died in January ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought one in October and it died in January. Amazon replaced it but it was dead on arrival. Ridiculous. I decided to go with another brand.

Product has settings for course to fine grind, but it does not stop automatically, so you get fine. No idea why it has the cup settings because again, it stops grinding when you stop pressing on it. The upside, the ground beans stay in the bean bin with no chance to clog the mechanics of it.
I liked the features of it but it didnt last more than a few months before it just quite working. Not sure why it stopped
The self-cleaning feature is helpful but not that great, sometimes it's just something for more grinds to stick to. Have to run it twice to get a fine enough grind for espresso
Beautiful Grinder, I like all the settings available. It is easy to clean. Love it!
This is a great tool for grinding your own coffee beans. We bought this brand before & had it for many years before we needed to replace it.
Use this to grind coffee beans . Works very well and I like the deep cup size to grind a lot of beans at one time
For a fresh cup of coffee use your beans. I suggest you feel it up half way to get a better grind
This is cheaply make, hard to take apart, then line up the "striker pin" that aligns to engage the motor. Hard to align.. I am sorry I got it.

It was great while it lasted but it stopped working. One day it was fine and the next it doesn't grind at all, the lights stay on but the button no longer works. I wouldn't recommend this product if you want a reliable grinder.
Does a great job. I still prefer an old school wooden coffee grinder with the handle, but this works well for cappuccino prep. I've been using is regularly for about a year, no issues whatsoever.

Do not buy. I bought one a few years back and after a year plus, it just stopped working. Which was fine because I got my use out of it. So I purchased a second one. I only used it once and went to use it after a few weeks and its completely shot!! Will not buy again!

reviews.reviewTitle: Warning! May produce triangular shaped coffee grounds.
reviews.reviewText:
This thing actually stops grinding when it thinks the beans are ground enough! Simply amazing!

I see people putting down the quality of grinds this thing produces. Get a life! I have no idea what a burr grinder is and I don't care very much. If YOU happen to know the differnce between the two, why are you on this products page reading my review? To look down upon all of us poor unfortunate casual coffee drinkers?

To me, ground coffee is ground coffee. I do not care if the grounds end up square or triangle. Its all the same to me.

In other words, unless you think you're cool depending on the shape of your coffee grounds, I am sure this device will work for you!

Also, the green light matches my coffee maker's light; its like they were made for each other.

quite the innovative little machine. lots of nifty design touches such as the self-cleaning feature, the dual select grinding controls w/ LED indicators, & removable lid, and removable grinding chamber, too! Easy cleaning. surprisingly durable design, and the price is lowest of any grinder i've seen. My previous Mr. Coffee grinder lasted over 10 years!!!
We have had one we use for daily grinding coffee beans. We have used it for over ten years and still works great. So I bought one for my kids in their apartment.
Have had no issues with it, it works well for a small low power grinder. I use it once a week or so, and it works well for that.
Perfect for what I needed. I just started grinding my own coffee because it has such a fresher taste. I love this grinder. Quick and easy to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dont be skeptical because price is low... this is a great product!
reviews.reviewText: Im pleasantly surprised with this little dude. Works great, easy to clean and does the job! Great value for the product you are getting.
Stopped working after second use. Now the lights don't even come on when plugged in. What a waste of money!

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working, all green lights, but doesn't spin
reviews.reviewText:
We use this to grind spices and after a few uses, it just stopped working.

Bought it for versatility, but when it doesn't work, it's junk now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works just as it said it would
reviews.reviewText: This is pretty freaking awesome. New to grinding, this one makes it fool-proof. The metal basin will also help in not holding smell/ taste if you choose to do spices (I personally would buy a separate one just in case). The ONLY con is the cleaning inside - a brush would be great because the swivel inside gets most but not all.

reviews.reviewTitle: ordered 2 of these grinders. FULL REVIEW COMING SOON
reviews.reviewText:
I WILL UPDATE THIS REVIEW AS TIME PREVAILS ON THE USE OF THE GRINDER. FIRST TEST WILL BE 2 COMPLETE BAGS OF COFFEE, NON STOP GRINDING.

6/28/11 - OK so i just got my grinder about an hr ago and i ground up a full bag of coffee in about 10 minutes. the only thing i dont like is that when u push the button to grind it that it doesnt stay on and grind. you have to hold it down till it stop grinding. i expected this to leave chunks or beans but NOPE it didnt. it felt a bit warm after non stop use to grind 1 bag about 3/4 full. but so far it works great.

still using it strong and great! grandma loves this thing and grinds her own coffee too. its a good buy!!

ill let you no more when i test it more.

This grinder's internal wiring shorted out after using it less than three times. Plugged it into kitchen outlet; it immediately began to smoke and burned a blister from the interior side of the plastic case (see photo). Not safe. If you already own one of these, DO NOT LEAVE IT PLUGGED IN. FIRE HAZZARD.
Had high expectations but this product fizzled: it's too complicated and difficult to get the grounds out of the chamber. Yes the chamber detaches but it's cludgy and messy to get the coffee out.

reviews.reviewTitle: It grinds fairly well (mostly an even grind), but ...
reviews.reviewText: It grinds fairly well (mostly an even grind), but there's always some coffee beans left which are whole or almost whole, no matter how I change the settings.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well and I like that the cup detaches so you're not tilting the ...
reviews.reviewText: Works well and I like that the cup detaches so you're not tilting the entire unit to pour out the grounds.

For a blade style grinder this is a great one.
Very easy to use and clean.
the only thing i would change is you have to hold the button down for it to work, you cant push the button and walk away.
Broke the first time I used it. I can't imagine why it's rated well. Smoke from the motor. I followed three directions, did not come close to over filling.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just Do Your Job Works For Grinders, Too
reviews.reviewText: Although it's disguised by a few bells and whistles, this is a typical, modern Mr. Coffee product, simple, basic, and robust. Not as fast as our previous grinder, not as fashionable as the expensive burr grinder we had that lasted 6 months, it just does its job and, if past track records serve, it will do it longer than most faster, more fashionable products. It has multiple volume (cups) and grind selections, but I simply set it once and once it worked exactly as I wanted, then forgot it, as most will. There's some innovation to the lid, as well, which works fine for delivering the beans and emptying the ground coffee. One innovation I had doubts about was a "cleaning" feature, plastic blades that "sweep" the grinder's bowl-- if you like Dark Roast as we do, you know there's always a sticky residue impossible to get out of your grinder. This does a pretty good job of getting it out!

reviews.reviewTitle: This coffee grinder is perfect and fast
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder is perfect and fast. I dont need to grind my coffee for a long time as it does it consistently.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Little Grinder (Mr. Coffee IDS77 Electric Coffee Blade Grinder)
reviews.reviewText: Grinds my Hawaiian Kona coffee beans perfectly! In only a few seconds I get a medium grind for my french coffee press. I only grind enough for one cup at a time and it's perfect for that. It's loud, but it is grinding coffee beans. You do have to unwind the cord, which is great because then you wind it back for easy storage.
The girlfriend owned one before it lasted 2 years this one's working great so far
not well designed product. Even though I like the was it grinds my coffee it is very hard to clean and takes a lot of time. If you value your time buy another grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: A must for everyone who wants to grind fresh coffee beans often
reviews.reviewText: Replaced an old one that stopped working after almost 10 years of daily chores. Grinds with precision - depending on the settings - and it is a breeze/no mess to use compared to all the similar ones out there.
Pretty good. Pouring out the grinds could be better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not what it used to be.
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this to replce an identical one that was 6 years old. The new one does not have a powerful enough motor and the beans are not adequately ground. A big disappointment since the old one worked perfectly.

The two top brand (and expensive) grinders I own left chunks of bean no matter how long I kept the machine going. I would get coffee that was gound too fine, with chunks. The reviews here convinced me to try this one and I am very pleased. The measuring capability, grind selection features and the removable water tank are great. There are no chunks left after grinding. There might be some coffee fallout when I transfer to the coffeemaker, but I've never seen a coffee grinder that did otherwise. I keep it handy rather than stuck away on a top shelf.
We just wanted to grind some coffee, nothing fancy.

While it does a good job grinding, it is really annoying to snap the lid on. You have to have it on perfectly to turn it on. I wish the lid just fit on easily and that there was a normal button or switch to power it. Too much of a hassle so I am considering replacing it.
It did not work. I was so excited to try this as there are many good reviews but took it out of the box and it just does not do anything; had to return.
Excellent unit, do not let the cheap price fool you this is a nice unit and I use it every day. Cant beat real home ground beans.
Very simple to use, this is my second one. Used the other so much it fell apart after about 7years of use. Did not think twice about purchasing another one.

Gave it 3 stars only because it was inexpensive and it would do OK for espresso only. The problems: the automatic control is useless unless you are making espresso. It will grind everything at every setting into a nice fine powder - not good for drip makers, and certainly bad for presses. I want press coffee, so I tried using manual control to stop and start the blades, even pulsing a bit to try to get good distribution of consistently sized grains. There was nothing I could do to get this. Every time there was a distribution of fine powder along with big chunks. Actually kind of par for the course with blade grinders, but I was expecting more with all the fancy controls. Just a blade grinder, and not bad for the price if you prefer espresso.
Certainly can't complain, just wish it would turn off on its own. But it does grind up the beans very good!

I ordered the IDS77 on the strength of a Consumer Reports review. They felt that, as a blade grinder, it did a pretty passable job of equaling the performance of a burr grinder. Perhaps their sample did, but my unit was Dead on Arrival DOA). The problem was the grinder wouldn't run because the actuator button was faulty. I sent it back to Amazon at no charge (what a great company) and selected a Hamilton Beach 80374. It was a few dollars more but I've had no problems with it and it looks great.

I hadn't really planned on buying a grinder but I added this to an order so I could get the $25 house and kitchenwares discount and I'm glad that I did.

It's not easy to find an inexpensive model that lets you select the grind. This one lets you select fine, medium or coarse which is all I need. More expensive models have more choices, most of which would never be used so why pay for them?

It's very easy to use. The manual tells you how many tablespoons of coffee to use depending on how many cups you are making and what grind to use depending on what kind of coffeemaker you use. Of course, you can adjust the amount to your taste. The unit lets you select the grind and number of cups and grinds accordingly... stopping automatically at the appropriate time depending on your selections.

The real test for me is not having any grinds in the last cup I pour from the pot. So far I've only tried the medium grind for my automatic drip coffeemaker. Perfect.

Cleanup is easy too. All in all, a great buy for the money.

I never knew it was possible to mess up something as simple as a coffee bean grinder -- but somehow the folks at Mr. Coffee have managed to do so.

First, it has two buttons one for the number of cups you want to grind and another for the type of grounds you want (ranging from fine to coarse). Both buttons are completely worthless. They serve no function other than to give the false sense of comfort that you are customizing your grounds.

Secondly, this this is SO incredibly loud and obnoxious I have to let me family know before I use it else someone's gonna get startled. Loud and obnoxious sound permeate the kitchen and all of its vicinity.

Third, this goes back to my first point of the useless setting buttons. The grounds will come fine (very fine) regardless of setting. I've tried dozens of times with different beans and setting and always, always, always it completely pulverizes the beans back to their carbon pre-historic origins.

It's cheap, but you get what you pay for. I'm currently looking for a reasonably priced Burr-method grinder. But this thing it's a pretty horrible product.

reviews.reviewTitle: A good grinder with minor annoyances
reviews.reviewText:
The Good:

- Price. Very inexpensive.
- Easy to clean. The drive has a mechanical fit similar to a blender, so the grinding chamber can be removed and is easy to clean.

At this price, you can't go wrong if you're looking for a decent grinder, or are wanting to start grinding your own beans.

The Bad:

- Fill as you-use. No hopper to retain beans and dispense the correct amount for grinding--you must measure each time.
- Grind settings. The grind settings adjust the grind duration based on the programmed number of cups to grind, and the coarseness desired. I find that the unit I have tends to grind the beans more finely than I'd prefer.
- Lid fit. The top lid fits over the grinding chamber, and doesn't want to easily mate with the chamber. It is necessary to get the proper fit, since the grinding button is a pass through on the lid that must be held down until the unit finishes grinding. You may release it early if desired.

Overall, the easy-to-clean nature of the unit overcomes it's shortcomings, since having clean surfaces is very important to making the best coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: My favorite burr grinder broke after years of daily use
reviews.reviewText: My favorite burr grinder broke after years of daily use, I saw this & thought it might be just as good at a better price. Nope. While it does grind coffee pretty well without a lot of large pieces of beans left behind, it is very awkward to use. The top does twist, swiping much of the built-up ground coffee off the plastic inside. But not all. Pouring the grounds out is beyond awkward, the plastic top doesn't swing fully open, so you balance the opened top, holding it upside down, & shaking it into the filter. Not that easy. The entire top cup unit does come off. BUT - it is not easy to get back onto the base itself!! I got so frustrated, I stick to just flipping the whole thing upside down. Two other annoyances: 1.where the cord exits the bottom of the unit it is made so the cord refuses to stay in the plastic notch it is supposed to. So it is always unbalanced & sitting on its own cord. 2. I absolutely hate the annoying lights that are always on, to show the selections for number of cups. It's criminal to waste electricity on a nuisance light, I unplug this thing every day it because this annoys me so much.
Broke within 5 uses. Power light cones on but will not grind. Cheap plastic materials.

5-stars for being the best bladed coffee-grinder I've used. I certainly can't say it's completely consistent, like pretty much any burr grinder would give you, however, I have discovered that if I set the amount of grounds one-step higher than the actual amount (say I put in 6-cups worth, I'll set it to grind 8-cups), I get a much more consistent grind I haven't noticed an issue with powered beans passing the paper filter; a permanent/gold filter may be more prone to this.
I really appreciate that it will automatically turn off, all I have to do is hold the button until it turns off. But in my experience, setting the amount to the actual amount leaves a handful of half and quarter beans which is a complete waste.

At $18, this is the best budget bean grinder purchase you can make. Recommended if you're cheap like me.

Two things I don't like that may be worth noting:
 The cord... it's maybe 2-feet long, tops.
 The green lights stay on when plugged in, there is no off button, so I only plug it in while in use.

This Mr. Coffee is different with the CHAMBERMAID SYSTEM! I just wanted to sound dramatic with that term. Basically, it's a plastic insert that scoots the coffee into piles, thus making it easy to fall out. You just move grab the top of the insert and move in a circle and you wil see little indivual piles of coffee where the plastic nodules used to be. I like it I think!

I've owned 2 of these. The first is about 10 years old and is still going strong. The only reason I replaced it is the little fingers inside the grinding changer that help dislodge the ground coffee wore away from years of coffee grinding against them.

The replacement has died in just over a year. The motor got so weak it would stop grinding after about a second and you would have to restart it a few times to finish the grind process.

Fortunately for me, the new grinding bowl fits the old grinder motor so my mixing parts I have a properly functioning grinder.

I dont know if the quality has slipped or if I just got unlucky but the new one was no good.

1) pour beans in grinder
2) push button
3) drink coffee

What I got was, pour coffee in, press button, nothing....
Take apart, reassemble, make sure every thing is connected, push some buttons, nothing...
After more button mashing, I finally got some beans ground, still not sure how that happened.
If you go with this unit, maybe give the manual a read before crunch time.

I wanted to like this coffee grinder... The different settings seemed handy and I liked the little plastic pieces inside the cup that help scrape out coffee grounds. But it's just a terrible mess. Even after checking to make sure the pieces were secured, every time I pressed down to grind the coffee, the grinder would scoot across the counter, spitting excess grounds out the sides and all over the counter. This isn't really the biggest problem, though. The biggest issue is that pressing down on that tiny button in an awkward place is very painful for my hand and wrist, sending nasty shooting pains all the way up through my fingers almost to my elbow within a few seconds of pressing down. So even without the obnoxious shaking and mess, I stopped using this immediately. I can't use a coffee grinder that hurts!
I don't know if I somehow got a faulty device or what, but it's almost like the motor used is far too powerful for the little plastic device and so it vibrates too intensely.
So unfortunately I really can't recommend this grinder. It has neat features but it just isn't well designed.

The chambermaid cleaning system is a gimmick; haven't found it to be all that helpful. I still have to rinse out the bowl and wipe it down really well with a paper towel to get all the risidual grinds out.

My only concern with the grinder that docks it a star is that the plastic feels very thin and cheap. Everything works great and nothing has broken, but it does feel fragile. To remove the bowl and lid, both have to be twisted to unlock it. It just feels like if you twist too roughly, it could break or crack. Time will tell.

For the grind options, I think this is worth the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: I got sucked in by the "chamber maid".
reviews.reviewText:
I chose the Mr Coffee coffee mill  in spite of the lame name  for its removable bowl & chamber maid cleaning system that theoretically sweeps chamber walls quickly and easily.

First thing I noticed when I plugged it in was that its illuminated buttons  What, in case I wanna adjust it in the dark?  add two more perfectly pointless LEDs to the ridiculous number of little LEDs already s****ng power here. Some things need LEDs; a coffee mill doesnt.

It grinds the coffee well enough, tho you have to stand there holding the button down till the timer stops it, which sort of defeats the point of having a timer, no? The press n' pour lid . . . designed with a wide opening for easy filling and dispensing with less mess just gets in the way & its a pain in the a** to clean out. I was especially disappointed with the chamber maid cleaning system I chose it for tho.

Admittedly Im fussy, but any ground coffee left in the bowl quickly gets stale & adds its stale flavor to my next grind, so I want it clean. The chamber maid consists of a set of three rotatable plastic splines curving along the inside surface of the bowl. Probably works pretty good with a coarse blend, but a fine blend like I use gets in under the splines, making it that much harder to get the bowl really clean. Oh well, it was a nice concept & worth a try. At least the bowls removable & thats an improvement over the old kind.

I washed it per instructions and place of hearts in the drainer. 6 + a half hours later I want to reassemble in use but... The parts still were not dry. Myself and my co-workers were sent home halfway through our shift because trucks were delayed due to the weather. I got home more than 10 hours after the package arrived and there was still moisture between the large button on top and the lid. If you are someone that likes fresh ground coffee a couple of times a day, as my family and I do, this is not the grinder for you. That is unless you enjoy cleaning damp coffee grounds out of every crevice of the machine. Very very disappointing

reviews.reviewTitle: Mr. Coffee Grinder is a Grind
reviews.reviewText: After the first use it was apparent this coffee bean grinder did not live up to its hype. The flip-up lid has to be held open to dispense the grounds or the top must be removed entirely and its not that easy to put back on when one is half awake. The blade takes up so much space in the bowl that its difficult to extract all the grounds with a scoop or spoon. The plastic device that "cleans" the bowl does nothing that I could not do with my finger. The grinder has to be unassembled in 3 parts to actually clean the bowl (remove the lid piece, remove the center piece, and wipe the bottom compartment). Its also not as quiet as the advertising would lead you to believe. I already own a GE model grinder that has is a lock-tite lid and a grinder bowl, which works just fine. The GE model also has a grind setting from coarse for percolators to fine for expresso. It also has an automatic switch that shuts the unit off. GE model cost $9.95 versus $30 plus for the Mr. Coffee model. Recommendation: Go with less expensive model and spend money on good coffee beans.

reviews.reviewText: CAUGHT FIRE! Be aware, if you buy this, until you know its sound, DO NOT LEAVE IT PLUGGED IN. Mine caught fire the first time I used it. I walked away for 10 minutes and it caught everything around it on fire. Amazon sent me a replacement that also started overheating and smelling of electrical burn. I purposely watched this one, in case it had the same problem and when it started overheating I unplugged it before it caught fire to. I reported this to Amazon and they are doing an investigation. I implore all of you considering this grinder, PLEASE do not leave it plugged in unattended until you know it isn't from the same batch. reviews.reviewTitle: GARBAGE BUT WILL DO THE JOB WHEN NO OTHER CHOICES AVAILABLE
reviews.reviewText:
OVER DESIGNED - UNDER FUNCTIONING. I have been spending time in a friend's kitchen which is understocked. He had a basic grinder, the other low quality Mr Coffee one... which broke after a few uses (coffee beans, flax seeds, raw cashews, walnuts, guess it was just an inferior product). Since I cannot live without a grinder and am in the burbs here, I went to Walmart to get a coffee grinder. The only two on the shelf were guess what? Mr Coffee, the POS model that just failed me and this flashy POS. Well I didn't want to buy this but of the two it had to be this because I couldn't bring myself to buy another of the one that just broke!

Over designed - meaning many useless "features" - why have 3 grind levels when they all do THE SAME GRIND??? Why have a bunch of LIGHTS to use electricity when NO ONE GRINDS ANYTHING IN THE DARK... Why have a piece of plastic in the middle that doesn't help remove the contents - no it just gets in the way when replacing the lid. The short cord means you have have to unplug it and move the thing to the place where you need to dump out the contents. And oh THE LID, well whatever you are grinding, A LARGE AMOUNT of it will end up on this WAY OVER DESIGNED LID and YOU WILL NEED A BRUSH of some sort to clean that lid because the fool that designed it put a LOT OF CREVICES on the inside of the lid.

In short I HATE THIS POS AND THE OTHER POS GRINDER FROM MR COFFEE.

reviews.reviewText:
I recently bought 500lbs of starbucks coffee and i got it whole bean after my friends and some instagram famous individuals tell me that ill make money if I "stay on the grind" or something like that.

Well, I bought this grinder and got to work.

now my house smells great but I now have tons of ground coffee... and I still havent made any money... what am i doing wrong?

I've had this grinder for several years. Last night I tossed it and bought another one.

I used mine for grinding spices. It worked quite well, my only complaints were that it was loud and hard to clean. The bowl had these plastic ridges down the side that you couldn't remove. They made me nervous, but I didn't have an issue.

Last night, I ground some spices, and starting mixing them into the meal I was making. I was startled to notice little specks of black. I looked in the grinder, and sure enough, the black plastic had broken and been grinded along with the spices. I was horrified. At least what I was grinding was light colored, had it been coffee, I'm not sure I would've noticed the plastic in it.

I find this to be hazardous. It may work well for a few years, but the design is flawed. After a number of grindings, it will eventually break.

I replaced it with a grinder that doesn't have ridges or plastic in the grinding bowl.

About 10 years ago, I bought a coffee grinder very similar to this in price, a Hamilton Beach Custom Grind. It served me well for a decade, but it no longer locks. Based on its adjustable grind and cup size, automatic shutoff, and similar pricepoint, I bought this. I hate it. I HATE IT. It does not do a good job grinding an espresso grind. The settings dont seem to correlate to much of anything. Coffee sticks to the sides. You have to disassemble the whole thing to get the grinds out. It is not ergonomic. I can't just push the grind button and walk away (what is the point of the automatic shutoff and settings then?) I get coffee grinds EVERYWHERE, a problem I didn't experience for a decade of heavy coffee drinking. Its cord storage is convenient (I suppose?), but still doesn't compare to what I had. I am probably going to try returning this awful little lump of disappointment and frustration and spending a little more to get something that doesn't fill me with rage before my first cup of coffee. Or I will just try to use my beloved, mostly broken old grinder.

This coffee grinder was an impulse purchase and I was fully prepared to return it because I didn't expect it to work as advertised. To my astonishment, the darned thing actually does a pretty good job. I have tried several coffee grinders over the years and have ended up giving all of them away to friends and family. I gave up on burr grinders because they are messy, hard to clean, produce a bitter powder, and are so noisy you almost need earplugs to use them. The blade grinders I have tried produced an inconsistent grind size and you have to experiment with the number of seconds it takes to get the grind right for the quantity of coffee you want to make. If you want to make more cups or less, you have to experiment all over again with the number of seconds you need to grind the beans. I ended up just having the coffee shop grind my Kenya AA beans for me and I buy smaller amounts so the coffee won't go stale before I can use it all.

This Mr.Coffee grinder is the only one I've ever tried that I think I can live with. First of all, this is a $19.95 grinder and not a $300 precision instrument designed to produce a perfect cup of expresso. Within those parameters, it does a really good job. The electronic grind and cup quantity settings take all of the guess work out of using a blade grinder. With this grinder, you use the guide on the side of the unit to measure your beans, choose a grind setting and the number of cups of coffee you want to make and a processor apparently calculates everything for you. You just hold the grind button down and the machine turns itself off after the correct number of seconds. No grind time experimentation is needed and the machine seems to get the grind just right all by itself. Cleanup is a snap, just remove the bowl from the base unit and put it on the top rack of your dishwasher. The ground coffee is actually easier to empty from the bowl than with most blade grinders. Rather than having to turn the entire unit upside down and shaking the grounds into your coffeemaker, you just remove the grinder bowl, turn it upside down in a small plastic bowl, and tap it against the counter to get the coffee out.

The reviewer who complained about the short cord length apparently did not realize there is 3 feet of hidden cord wrapped around the inside of the base of the unit. All you have to do is pull it out.

While durability must be proven over time, I'm most impressed with this $19.95 grinder. Even if it only lasts for 2 years, you could afford to buy 30 of them for what a small professional grade burr grinder would cost and it's actually easier to live with than the pro grade grinder would be.

About 6 years back I decided to replace my Mr. Coffee grinder with a burr mill. I got a mid-model Krupp mill. I forget the model number. No matter what setting I used I got, approximately 1/3 fine, 1/3 medium, and 1/3 coarse grinds. I double checked the setup and requested help from product support. No joy. I dumped the Krupp and went back to my Mr. Coffee.

In the past I had an old style hand mill with adjustable burrs that gave perfect grinds, but it was an 1890's style and made a large mess in the catch drawer and took up a huge amount of counter space.

My experience with electric burr grinders is that they have too much speed and not enough torque. Granted, my experience is dated. A lower speed allows the ground coffee particles to fall through instead of being swept up and reground finer. A higher torque keeps it from jamming.

After 10 years my grinder finally bought the farm and I'm replacing it with a similar model Mr. Coffee. Yes, it does leave a few unground beans, but not many, and the grounds are at least more uniform in size. Can't beat it for the price.

Ive owned two of these and overall they are a good coffee grinder, albeit with a persistent flaw. First of all, to get a good grind the approach is one of pulse-shake-pulse. Trying to get a good grind without pausing to shake results in unground beans left in the middle of the hopper. (This is a consistent problem with blade type gronders.) Forget the timer features, just pulse and shake until you get the grind you want.

The flaw comes in the wiper assembly in that over time the plastic blades of the wiper break, thus inhbiting the wiper feature that helps to loosen the ground coffee from the bowl. That having been said, the wiper feature is really handy for loosening the grounds from the bowl. The bowl is detachable, which is a huge plus in that you can pour the grounds out over the kitchen sink, thus keeping stray grounds off off of the countertop. The bowl is also washable. These two features put this grinder heads and shoulders above the similarly priced K brand grinder, which I also own and find to be messy, inconvenient to get the grounds out of, and also is not submersible.

The washable bowl feature allows this grinder to do double duty as a spice grinder with no lingering aftertaste problems as the bowl can be easily washed out with some dish detergent and water.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job but not for heavy use.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this at a retailer a couple yrs ago but didn't give it much use. The other day I decided to grind down a can of house coffee from Aldi that I didn't think was ground enough. The grinder container is small so it would take me a while to do it but I was ok with that and filled way past the fill mark . Half way through the process I felt it getting warm and smoke came out. After that it would not run but the lights were still on. Did a little research and discovered that a variety of kitchen appliances have a thermal fuse in line with the motor to prevent it from burning out in case of overheating/loading. Once I took it apart I found the culprit hidden under some tape in line with the motor. I removed it and bypassed it to test and sure enough it came back on. I have ordered a similar thermal fuse (higher temperature and amperage) since I intend to use it more heavily. At this price I suspect people won't bother with it but I like fixing stuff. I will add pictures to assist anyone willing to try.

I love this coffee grinder. Its small, very stylish, affordable and does the job. Of course, its not perfect and not the best grinder one can ever have. But for my purpose its good enough. The only thing I can complain about is the cord being too short and the plastic inside the cap broke after using it for a few times. Not sure if anyone has that issue but regardless of it breaking, the grinder still works. The plastic inside the cap works like a brush to loosen up the coffee grounds. I wish its sturdier. It would be nice if theres a brush included with the machine. Now ... the auto shut off functionality, I havent really paid attn to it. I just use my own judgement. The cap is removable making it easier to transfer the coffee ground to a container and for easier clean up. The size is perfect. The cap is bigger. You can make more coffee compared to other smaller brands of coffee grinder. So I cant complain much. The grinder doesnt cost a lot. Its not an expensive grinder. It has a full year replaceable warranty fr the company and they are very easy to talk to.

First of all, this grinder is very difficult to clean. It was never easy to get the grounds out of the bottom. The only way to properly clean it is to take the lid off and the cup and wash them. Problem is, the screws on both started rusting immediately. That should have been my first red flag. Eventually, the lid kept getting harder and harder to slide on, until this morning I tried to do it and the tiny little button mechanism from the lid just snapped right off, stuck in the bottom part of the machine. I can't even get a good picture because it's so hard to see. Either way, it's useless now and I'm on the hunt for something better.

Just go ahead and take your money and throw it in the toilet instead of buying this. This crappy grinder broke after just TWO GRINDS. DO NOT BUY IT. It is now sitting in the bottom of my trash can. SUCK IT, Mr. Coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice Features, But Mine Failed After Just 5 Days. I Exchanged It For A KRUPS Grinder Instead.
reviews.reviewText:
This was originally my first choice to replace an older Mr. Coffee grinder that had given years of good service.
Unfortunately, my new unit failed the first week after about 5 daily uses. On the fifth day, the unit just would not turn on. I don't know whether the motor died or the on/off switch died. But I would up returning it as defective.

While it worked, I liked the choice of Coarse/Medium/Fine settings, and the slightly larger than average 'bowl' capacity for the beans.
I didn't like that the contact on-off switch seemed temperamental (and may have been defective out of the box).
Compared to some other brands, the design of the hinged top makes it a little more awkward than most to pour the ground coffee into a receptacle.

I was pleased with the Fine grind results during the brief period it worked.

After this failed I tried the Hamilton Beach coffee grinder, which I have also reviewed. That Hamilton Beach unit is more basic, and I wound up returning the Hamilton Beach also and getting the KRUPS grinder as my final choice. I'm happy now with the KRUPS.

I liked this Mr. Coffee while it lasted, but since it failed I can only give it 3 Stars. You may have better luck than I did. I'm happy now with the KRUPS brand unit.

I hope this is helpful as you comparison shop online. Happy brewing, everybody.

reviews.reviewTitle: I am SO disappointed in this
reviews.reviewText: I am SO disappointed in this! :( I have a 25 year old Farberware L4200 that is just starting to make some funny noises when it grinds coffee. So, I thought I should get another one in case it stops altogether. I tried this one when I brought it home. It's going back. It's amazingly cheaply made. Those little plastic things are not at all helpful; they're very flimsy and cause static. Some of the coffee goes right under them. That's another thing. The grind uniformity leaves a lot to be desired! Some is powdered and some is big "sharp"? looking shards. Washing it is ridiculous with the plastic arms also. Just not a fan of them at all. I've never had a problem with coffee or spices or oatmeal or anything sticking to the sides of the one I have now so I wonder why you even need to have them? Is it because it's a cheapy plastic? I know things are manufactured to break easily and not be fixable so that people keep buying new things (and throwing the old stuff into landfills :/ but I don't think this thing would last long even by today's standards. :(

reviews.reviewTitle: No longer good quality. Not worth the purchase
reviews.reviewText:
Thanks, Raju V. Lalwani. You could have written my review. I have changed my mind from the 4 star I gave a couple weeks ago. My son did replace my old one as Christmas gift as I asked. The original was great for years but more recently not grinding as evenly leaving bits and pieces. I figured the blades were just getting dull.

SO DISAPPOINTED in the new one. Its blades have no sharpness to them, worse than my current original one. Can even feel the difference Between both! I WENT BACK TO USING MY ORIGINAL ONE THIS MORNING. glad I did not throw it out yet! And its quieter.

Now I will have to find out about returning a gift item and probably inconvenience my son in process. Bummer. Mr. Coffee has dropped the ball. I can see quite a few other reviewers (400+) feel the same way.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mr. Coffee 12 Cup Electric Coffee Grinder with Multi Settings IDS77-RB
reviews.reviewText: We had the previous model of this Mr. Coffee grinder for several years before we finally wore it out. We absolutely loved it, so we ordered this one (IDS77-RB). An excellent improvement is the longer cord, which was much needed. However, this model is inferior with respect to grinding. After the grinding cycle is complete, unground and partially ground beans remain. This never happened before. Naturally, I'm not a happy coffee drinker.

I LOVE this grinder! I read reviews where people complain about the little plastic arms in the bowl that swivel to help clean out the coffee after a good grind. The blades do not reach the arms but at the beginning of the grind, I imagine that the hard coffee beans wear it down as they spin against them. Is there possibly a tiny bit of plastic bits in my grind? Perhaps. I feel like theres a LOT worse crap we put in our mouths. While I don't believe this is acceptable, and maybe it would still be a great grinder without this feature, perhaps some stainless arms would be better? I don't know, I don't design coffee grinders.
My previous grinder we switched to a non-coffee grinder and it would get a rancid smell in it from grinding flax seeds. It did NOT have a removable grinder cup and was extremely hard to keep clean since it was not submersible in water. I threw it out. It looked exactly like this one but I don't believe it was a Cuisanart brand. -> http://www.amazon.com/Cuisinart-DCG-20BK-Coffee-Grinder-Black/dp/B00004S9CY/ref=sr_1_98?s=home-garden&ie=UTF8&qid=1434386784&sr=1-98&keywords=coffee+grinder. But it was fine if it never needed to be cleaned and was only used for one kind of coffee only. ie. husband hates "flavored" coffee so we could not use it to grind it without leaving the flavor in it.

I AM in the market for a second grinder at the moment. While this is easy to clean and use for other things like spices or powdering granulated sugar etc., because it gets used every day for coffee and rarely gets washed, it's kind of a pain to rinse it out right before you need it to powder something that needs to stay dry. I HAVE used it to powder sugar as well. It had a teeny bit of coffee flavor but we didn't mind. Honestly, I was not very meticulous about cleaning it that day. I've had this for about 4+ years and still works like new but the little swiveling arms have worn quite thin in the area of the blades, however they have not broken. I also bought one for my sister and she loves it too.

I will be trying a different grinder to use only for non-coffee items, in the name of "product testing". ;) Probably will go with this one -> http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00JFHHMN2/ref=ask_ql_qh_dp_hza

reviews.reviewTitle: This isn't a bad product for the price
reviews.reviewText:
This isn't a bad product for the price. My only problem with this (and this is a biggggg problem) is the nooks and crannies that you can't clean out . . . even with a brush. Like, a good grinder should be perfectly cleaned with a brush, you shouldn't have to wash it. Unfortunately, this Mr. Coffee needs to be disassembled and washed when you want it cleaned because there's grooves in it you can't reach with a brush. Hence the coffee builds up in there and gets stale. This is a huge design flaw and it's a giant pet peeve.

Honestly, I think most of the reviews on this site are written by people who are relatively new to making slow coffee (pour overs, french press) - and I say this because I'm surprised no one else has voiced the same concern . . . which might be due to lack of exposure to coffee making? I don't know. Maybe they're fine washing the thing every week or so.

Fortunately, this was a gift so I'm not too upset. But I would never personally buy this grinder. I mean - it does the job, grinds the beans alright. Although personally, I like the KRUPS grinder - it's quieter, the grinder time is manual, not automated, so you are in control of how ground you want your beans. I think that would be the smart choice if you want quality for affordability. More than likely I'll be replacing this grinder with the KRUPS.

(I purchased this locally, so it will not show as a verified purchase.) I have always used the similarly-priced Krups grinder - and they last me usually around 7-8 years which I figure is more than fair considering the price and that the unit sees use sometimes two or three times a day (we *really* like freshly-ground coffee, and have now-adult children we have also raised to *really* like freshly-ground coffee. It's the gift that keeps on giving.) Yes, I know the burr-grind is a preferred method, but after being given a relatively reputable brand burr grinder for a Christmas present many years ago that failed 6 months in, for the price I was happy with the plain ole Krups blade grinder. After a later-evening work shift ended I received a ZOMGCOFFEEGRINDERDEADGETANEWONENOW text message, and had to resort to grabbing the Mr Coffee grinder due to limited retail choices open at that time that might carry the Krups. This Mr Coffee grinder does the job. The pretty lights - beyond the initial 'Oo, pretty lights' phase - and the function they are meant to illustrate aren't much more than 'Oo, pretty lights'. I grind with an eye on the beans until they have the appearance that is best for drip machines. Any automated grinding is useless to me. *However*, being able to remove the cup to dump the grind into the brewer basket is nice - so, there's that. I don't hate it. It does what I need it to. We've had it for three years, I think - again, fair for the price - but when it dies I am not married to replacing it with the same grinder.
