The thermal fuse tripped in under five minutes, and that was it. The base was warm to the touch, not even hot. There's no automatic reset when the motor cools off, once the fuse blows this unit is DEAD.

The manual says: The motor has overheated, thermal fuse is broken. CALL AUTHORIZED SUNBEAM SERVICE CENTER.

How hard would it have been to install a simple self-resetting thermal breaker? Judging by the positive reviews, I have to wonder if the earlier revisions were built to fail so easily.

I don't often write a review of anything, but this morning after the usual suite of inconveniences centered on this otherwise eventless activity, I thought I should share my experiences. Short cord. Yes, you can pull it out. Mine only comes out so far. I have tried everything short of breaking the plastic cover. Consequently can only stand by a wall socket. Biggest complaint: it makes a mess. The top flips open. When removed, the top tends to dangle in course of removal, spreading grounds everywhere. The motor is weak, or maybe the combination of cheap cutting edge and weak motor causes uneven grinds. Cannot fill very much in cup to grind, otherwise VERY uneven grind. Was an impulse buy. Too many pieces should make buyers wary. Go for simplicity in design and efficient cutting edges. Make it all happen in one move. Recommend paying more for satisfaction and longevity.

My wife is very particular about freshly ground spices and it actually tatse much better than any pre-ground spices. For a small family of three Mr. Coffe grinder works magic. It really worked tirelessly before being shot after 4 years.I replaced the old one with a new one the next day.
IN most cases we use water to make a paste of spices and it holds up very well. If you are from indian subcontinent and need a spices grinder, look no further.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worst Coffee Grinder I've Ever Owned
reviews.reviewText:
I hate this coffee grinder more than any other cheap piece of plastic I've ever owned. There is a special place in hell for gadgets like this that are over-designed and still cannot even do the one thing they were made to do. Take my review with a grain of salt I guess because there are plenty of good reviews. But my experience with this was awful. First of all, this thing is LOUD. Not just LOUD but one of those aggravatingly loud sounds. The cord is ABSURDLY short. You basically have to hug the wall to use it. The only good thing is it was a conversation start - everyone got a kick out of the short cord - "Gotta cut costs somewhere" they'd almost always laugh. There are TOO MANY PARTS. I don't know how there are so many parts to this. It's a coffee grinder. There should be a LID. That's it. One part. But inevitably when a guest would try to use this thing and empty out the grounds, plastic parts would fall apart and bounce across the floor. And FINALLY - I don't think I ever got a single grind that actually FULLY GROUND. It would appear ground, I'd put it in the filter, start the coffee, and inevitably there would be quartered, halved, and sometimes FULL BEANS that would rise to the top of the filter after the coffee maker finished. I never understood how a coffee grinder could not grind coffee.

Look...coffee grinding for the common man should be simple. The unit is not simple, nor does it grind coffee well. Do yourself a favor and buy something like http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00004SPEU/ I did. And a group of us went out back to collectively feel good about throwing this Mr. Coffee grinder in the dumpster. Sometimes we still talk about it and smile.

reviews.reviewTitle: Died in the first six months...
reviews.reviewText:
Purchased elsewhere, but after less than six months it's already dead. Somewhere in the switching mechanism, it's no longer making good contact.Since it's glued/sealed shut at the bottom, no repair is possible without breaking it.

Used to grind beans for two daily

Absolutely superb grinding skills- you can even choose your own type of grind and how many cups! These come in RED at Target and it is very fun.
I thought there was something wrong with the cord, it was way too short, the other reviewer is right, it is tightly coiled along the base and can be pulled out with strength. I kept this grinder over another brand because it has the added feature of a pointed pour spout- it is sooo convenient to pour directly into your filter.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's Ok as far as cheap grinders go but hard ...
reviews.reviewText: It's Ok as far as cheap grinders go but hard to get an exact espresso grind. Over grinding or under grinding for right texture is a challenge.
Does not produce an even grind what so ever. If you want your beans ground to dust with large chunks left behind, look no further. If, however, you'd like good tasting coffee, try again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Press and hold the button down to grind coffee beans
reviews.reviewText: There is the push button to grind beans. However you have to press and hold it down, thenit will automatically stop after done with grinding.

reviews.reviewTitle: I got this two years ago and it still works ...
reviews.reviewText: I got this two years ago and it still works well....I'm getting a new one because it makes a mess to pour out grinds into expresso basket and difficult to clean. I mostly work over sink but grinds get over counters when untwisting basket or taking off lid despite tapping it to dislodge powders.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke after only a few uses
reviews.reviewText: I got this to replace a cheap grinder I've been using for many years which still works but is very small. After 5-6 uses, the Chamber Maid cleaning system detached and was destroyed by the blades. This happened on the same day as a new Mr. Coffee French press broke, also after only 5-6 uses. I got these both in late December and neither lasted through January. I'm done with Mr. Coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: 1 full chamber = 1 pot of coffee most of the time
reviews.reviewText:
a full chamber makes 12 scoops of coffee for me, perfect for most pots of coffee!

I do wish the cord was longer. The chamber comes off and is easy to clean or store fresh ground beans in the refrigerator.

The 3 settings for grind are exactly what I wanted, and the price was good too!

I've had this for about 18 months now and used it until today. I replaced it with a burr grinder because it's difficult to get a consistent grind with this. The plastic cleaning scrapers disintegrated months ago... I must have drank them. Regardless, for the price you can't go wrong. I will keep this grinder for a backup.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fantastic! The best coffee purchase for our home
reviews.reviewText: Fantastic! The best coffee purchase for our home. 8 months later and still works like it is brand new. Love the settings & easy to remove top. Bought in 2016, and the price dropped closer to Christmas, it was a steal. Knowing how well & easy it works now, I would pay for it at full price in a heart beat.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Coffee Grinder for the Money!
reviews.reviewText: This Mr. Coffee grinder is the best grinder I have used - for the money, or even twice the money. I have owned at least 6 different grinders over my life as a coffee drinker. Several blade type, a few burr mills, and an old hand grinder. This one is the nicest functioning and easiest to live with. When I start having beans flown in and I home roast, maybe I'll invest hundreds on a grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best on Starbucks for some Reason?
reviews.reviewText: This works great on starbucks coffee (dont know why) but when I use it on other smaller brands of coffee 9/10 times the coffee comes out watery or I have to use so much grind I go through bags too fast.

reviews.reviewTitle: Used in a coffee club - lasted about a year
reviews.reviewText:
This grinder is nothing like the one I have at home, but it was great for the auto-off feature; as long as it didn't reset the # of cups and course settings!!!! It never really ground the coffee fully, even at Fine / 12 (for a 10 cup maker).
Lastly, the grounds release twisty feature the basin includes got one break after about 9 months, and now is totally unusable - leaving grounds / dust in the bin. Overall, looking for another brand to replace this one.
Its pretty great! Had mine for a year, no issues. Very easy to rinse and put away.
Very bad the thermal fuse got damage after very few times

I have had 2 of these for about 6 years. One for coffee, one for nuts, herbs, etc. Both are still going strong and do exactly what I need them to do each time. Super easy to clean too which is a hugh bonus! Just put the bowl and lid in the top shelf of the dishwasher ????
it's ok that's why i'll buy another. had one since 2010 and maybe used 40x. the part that failed is the "chamber maid cleaning system." look after the plastics.
Love this grinder. Fast shipping and great price!

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes having fresh ground coffee every day, easy!
reviews.reviewText: I have used it nearly every day for 5 months now. Easy to use and works great! Love my fresh ground coffee!
Great price and delivery was fast

I'm disappointed with the short cord. The cord is 10 inches long. The plug socket in my kitchen is 12 inches from the counter top which does not allow the unit to set on the counter. I would have to hold it to use it. The booklet that comes with it states they use a short cord to prevent accidents with a person or pet becoming entangled in it. I'm returning it tomorrow. I have a grinder made by Krups the cord is long and I've had no "accidents" with it. I use it to grind spices so now I need another one just for coffee. I will have to check to see if they all come with a short cord these days.
It is really good and useful. Price is fair. I can recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor quality, poor design, poor performance
reviews.reviewText:
Negatives:
-Does not evenly grind coffee, unless you want the finest possible consistency.
-Spout does not accommodate coffee and some (ground) coffee typically spills out when pouring into our coffee maker.
-Awkward and poorly placed "start/grind" button.

The grinder promptly burned out and stopped working 4 months after purchase. I agree with a reviewer that said it was "over-engineered". Total piece of s#*t

reviews.reviewTitle: Was great until it stopped working.
reviews.reviewText: I used this grinder maybe once every few weeks, and after only one year it stopped working entirley. When I plug it in the lights turn on but the grinder juts won't start. Very frustrating! If it had a reset button or something that would be great, but as of now it's just a dud.

reviews.reviewTitle: and it still works great. I've only recently used it on a daily ...
reviews.reviewText: I think I've had this model for almost ten years, and it still works great. I've only recently used it on a daily basis. I use it with my Aeropress. I am buying another for work. I hope it hasn't changed. Not ideal for a coarse grind for French press.

He little plastic diverters inside the grinding cup broke off after about 20 uses. It sent plastic bits into the ground coffee. I had to break all the diverters off to make the unit useable again. I would not recommend something that has had so little testing put into it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked great for about a month.
reviews.reviewText: I used this for a short amount of time and then stowed it away for several months. When I got it back out to use it, worked for 1 second then poof, dead. I have a Mr. Coffee brewer that has worked for ages but unfortunately this did not have the same quality. Disappointing. One other complaint is the length of the chord. Why so short?

This grinder has produced increasingly inconsistent grinds. It's not a burr grinder, and it's not meant to be. But I get whole beans along with fine powder, no matter how long I grind it for. In addition, the cheap design of the scraping blades means that they break and the scraping function becomes useless pretty quickly. Overall, I'm not pleased.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for spices and egg shells
reviews.reviewText: I bought this mainly to grind egg shells to add to homemade dog food and spices, so I wanted something I could really wash. It makes egg shells into a powder very quickly. The only issue we have is the top does not seal well so some of the dust escapes and makes a bit of a mess.

Just when I thought I had bought the worst designed product ever (my mr. Coffee coffee maker), I bought this and couldn't believe this was actually worse. Too many pieces, you need to stand there while grinding, it only holds enough beans to grind one pot at a time, and the shortest power cord known to man. Don't waste your money.

The programability is it's best feature. I don't want to time the grinder or view it to see if it's done. But the cord is ridiculously short (26 inches). My Mr. Coffee maker's cord is the same length & if your outlet isn't right there, (& mine isn't) you will need an extension cord. There is no reason for this as Sunbeam is just being cheap. Safety can be a good reason for heavier appliances like deep fryers, etc., but coffee grinders?????
I used it once. Works well. I am very happy with it.

I really wanted to keep this grinder but at the end I must return it.

Deal breaker annoyances: Must hold button during grinding; Must stay plugged in else settings not remembered; If left plugged in appliance sips 0.1 amps just idling (what for?); basket designs means messy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Extremely short cord is a joke
reviews.reviewText: I took this out of the box and the first thing that immediately had my head shaking was the ridiculously short cord, maybe 8 inches long if that? I had to get out an extension cord to use the thing unless I wanted to grind coffee beans holding it up next to the wall sockets. The other thing about this grinder is the design just seems too involving to use on a daily basis - I just didn't care for having to twist the grinding chamber to empty the grounds, and twist the lid off to clean it, and then "line up the arrows" to put everything back in place. The only plus is that it does seem to grind the beans pretty consistently but the cons I've just mentioned make this a product that's going back to the store today.

This is an excellent grinder. I got a cleaning brush from my local coffee shop and it is even better! I use it on the finest grind in my espresso machine and it turns out perfect. Nothing is left behind. I have on occasion ran it a double batch to ensure that it is completely ground. On the fine grind I found that I got buildup of grounds at the bottom (tight corners) so as I said before I got a cleaning brush and no more problems.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds the same regardless of settings and breaks easily.
reviews.reviewText: This Grinder is terrible. very manual. regardless of all setting it grinds the coffee the same. the plastic piece inside broke shortly after purchasing and makes it's difficult to clean.

I used to own a braun coffee grinder but this one is superior. I no longer to have guess HOW LONG to grind the coffee. I experimented a little to find the right setting for the dark/light brew that i liked. That didnt take long now I get consistently excellent coffee. If you are tired of guessing and what the same coffee everyday then buy it. If you like to be surprised by the dark/light bitter or not of your coffee then dont buy it buy a braun.
It's loud, gimmicky, quite hard to clean and there are no instructions for cleaning it though the blurbage implies a cleaning system.
Does what it needs too. VERY LOUD
second one - last years

reviews.reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviews.reviewText:
I was not expecting a whole lot from a grinder that I paid twenty bucks for at wallyworld. It grinds coffee well enough for a drip coffee maker, but the grounds are not terribly consistent.

I did get a bit more than a year of near-daily use out of it, but now it's broken. The inner plastic chunk of the grinding chamber broke off, and now it's useless. The motor assembly works fine, and it feels like such a waste to throw away something that is 90% functional. But seeing as that extra 10% of functionality is the entire purpose of this product, it's time to find a new grinder.

I would only recommend this if you're strapped for cash and need a grinder quick, or if you don't grind coffee with any regularity.

reviews.reviewTitle: I loved mine. But I dropped it off the counter ...
reviews.reviewText: I loved mine. But I dropped it off the counter and broke it. Ground my coffee well since 2011. RIP Mr. Coffee.

The cleaning system disintegrated after a week of regular use. The grind is inconsistent, often missing entire beans. And there are simply too many parts for what should be a very simple device. I'm going back to the twelve-year-old no-frills grinder that I never should have tried to replace.

After reading the positive reviews here, I purchased this grinder at Target. I took it home and ground enough beans for a 12cup pot. It seemed to work fine and produced a decent grind (for a blade mill). The next day I loaded the bin to grind beans for another pot. Nothing, the mill was dead. I called Sunbeam service and they said that there's and internal fuse that likely went when the unit overheated. What, one pot and it's dead? I'm getting my money back! This unit isn't inexpensive, it's cheap junk.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't Believe They Still Sell This
reviews.reviewText: It did such a horrible job with coffee, I had to buy another brand. I tried using it for spices, but the little spice that it did grind comes out all over where the lid meets the base. Get a Krups.

I have had this for several years. Not to long after I purchased it the bowl scraper broke, but I kept on using it. Now a part broke off on the lid under the button labeled press to grind. It pushed down to make the coffee grinder grind the coffee. I know that it is cheap, but not worth the money.
Good quality and easy to use
Purchased to make almond meal, does a great job at breaking nuts dwn, has 3 setting, but is very loud & has a very VERY short cord, easy to clean, & is a ok size.

This is a stupidly designed coffee grinder. There are plastic parts on the inside that are supposed to help clean the grinds and scrape them off of the sides of the jar. Well, the design is bad because not only does it not do the job but it is also flimsy and snapped into pieces this morning. I am now worried that I am actually ingesting little bits of plastic every time I drink my coffee. There are simple grinders out there without these fancy accessories that last much longer. I prefer the Black & Decker one at Walmart that is nearly the same price but is much easier to work with. Do not buy this.

Worst coffee grinder ever. First of all, my cheap ole Hamilton Beach would allow me to push the button and let go. You have to hold the button for this one to keep grinding and it's more expensive? Also, my old Hamilton Beach lasted for about 4 years, this one is falling apart after a few months. The little plastic arms inside the grinder have come loose from the sides and keep the lid from closing without a wrestling match. Save your money. Go cheap with the HB!

This is the second Mr Coffee grinder I have owned. The first, bought several years ago performed well for a couple of years of daily use until a piece of the plastic basket broke off. I was otherwise happy and so I bought another one. This grinder broke in exactly the same place, this time after no more that 6 mos use. Even for a low cost grinder this is unacceptable. Mr Coffee would be well advised to spend a couple of more dollars to use metal or sturdier plastic in this part. The grinder is useless without it. Buy something else!

The other reviews give some great information for the specific details of this product. But I only saw 4 start ratings. I have been through a number of coffee bean grinders, and this one I have had for a couple years and been perfectly satisfied with it. I wanted to get another one to use for grinding herbs, but I was gifted a burr mill. Aaag! Aweful. It made me aware of just how great this affordable little mill is. It grinds evenly, always works. For 3 years.

I love my coffee grinder! This one works so good and un like other grinders it keeps grinding if you want to have finer grounds. I also use it for spices as well! I use my coffee grinder pretty much daily and have never had a problem with it!
I've had it for years and works perfectly every time.

reviews.reviewTitle: worked for a couple of months only
reviews.reviewText: It lasted about two months and stopped working. Very dissappointed.

I've had my Mr Coffee grinder for about 5 years. It still works perfectly! I've never had a problem with any parts breaking. I love the auto-shutoff. I know exactly which settings I need for however much coffee I'm making, and in whichever brewing device (coffee pot, french press, Aeropress, etc). It is a little loud, but so what? So are blenders and food processors, and that's basically what this thing is. I just toss a dish towel over it to muffle the sound a bit and save my ears.

I do not recommend this grinder. The self cleaning "chamber" feature is great, but after a couple of months of use, the plastic arms broke, up at the top where they "tee" with the circular ring. What this translates to is a lot of fiddly work to get it back together after washing it. It's so bad I rarely wash it now, and I am -- yet again -- researching for a new coffee grinder. Sigh.
I have this coffee grinder for years now, it is the best ever ! different grinding settings , for coffee or spices (powder) , goes to the dishwasher ! it is wonderful !
Simple no frills. Very basic. Has button for amount of coffee and grind. Works well. Easy to use and clean. Compact. Will fit small spaces

Bought this unit at a big box store and found that
if you but in the full amount of beans to the full mark,
and set on the coarse setting, you will get beans that
are not ground. I tried a little less beans on the coarse
setting and still the same. On the fine setting you get
powder instead of ground coffee. Am returning it tomorrow.
Seams to me that this is a cheep grinder and you get what
you pay for.
Works perfect the first time, everytime

This little grinder is difficult to use. The cord is too short (15" includes the end of the plug), and it's very messy. The bowl scrapper does not scrap the bowl well. It's a real pain to use. I would not recommend this grinder.
It's very messy; cannot get out all the coffee; doesn't grind evenly; very disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: works fine, but not for espresso grind
reviews.reviewText:
Owned this for a few months to replace a similar product purchased at Walmart a few years ago. Like most of the rest on the market, it will grind your beans, it will make a little bit of a mess with your grinds, it will NOT grind fine enough for good espresso.

Adequate performance from a bottom of the line product.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... button down until the grind is complete--this seemed really annoying to me and is the main reason I returned ...
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder is very small and you have to hold the button down until the grind is complete--this seemed really annoying to me and is the main reason I returned it.
Awesome; works great; easy to disassemble and clean!
I bought this brand coffee grinder used it twice won't work

reviews.reviewTitle: Why not buy a mini chopper instead of this?
reviews.reviewText:
I don't own this product, but because I spent a lot of time researching grinders, I thought I'd give you my feed back:

I've recently started to drink coffee and needed a grinder. Researched burr grinders then this, but after reading that the plastic wears off, I decided not to get this model.

I then thought about the krups 203. However, before I decided to buy it, I remember I have a mini chopper. I tried it, and I'm able to quickly grind my coffee beans as fine as powder if I wanted to. I bought my mini chopper at good-will for five bucks. The model is similar to Cuisinart MM-2M Mini Mate Chopper (it looks exactly like it in fact). It has 240 watts max. I'm happy about it, so I won't be buying a coffee grinder. However, if you guys are thinking about grinder your coffee, consider the EHC650 as it's only about twenty bucks, and I think i thas a better blade design than the MM-2M. I rather buy a device that can grind nuts and all other useful stuff such as flax seed than to be stuck with a coffee grinder. Hope this helps. I don't understand why anyone would want to buy a hundred dollar plus grinder these days. My mini chopper can literally turn the coffee bean into dust so there's no need for a burr grinder, though I've never used one.

But this? No way when I've read that the plastic eventually wears out. Why can't these company simply make the container out of glass? I'll be willing to pay an extra five bucks. Let people have the choice and you'll be respected.

I used this about 5 to 6 months then it stop working and the inside plastic piece broke that is suppose to clean the basket.
I used it everyday for coffee and it worked fine until it started having problems to power on.
I will be trying something different. will not replace with this model again.

reviews.reviewTitle: grinds to fine, this is great
reviews.reviewText: grinds to fine, this is great! Loving it! It has not broke on me, I have never seen more powerful grinder so far!

reviews.reviewTitle: Making a teenager happy every day! What more can you ask for :-)
reviews.reviewText: My son uses this on a daily basis and loves it. As for the tiny cord, unwrap it! It is wrapped around the base on the inside.
works just fine great for the price

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Baby food processor..Oops its a coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText: Yeah. I brought it to grind coffee. But apparently ended up using it as a baby food processor. It does good work as coffee grinder ..but much better work as baby food processor. Its perfect for single portion baby food and my baby gets to eat freshly prepared food everyday. Happy baby .. happy Mommy
wish i had gotten one sooner, great buy

I have always been curious as to why someone would want to grind coffee beans rather than buy hem ground. A friend brewed me a cup from fesh ground beans and I was hooked but had no idea of how to grind the beans. This grinder was so easy to use, explained all I needed to know and now I am buying gourmet coffee on Amozon. Great value for the cost.
works great

The cleaner arms inside the bowl have broken after about a year. It looks like the blades actually shave the plastic arms into your freshly ground coffee. Oh, and it grinds very poorly, I have to run it 2 to 3 times to get the job done.
I'm so impressed! It's quick, efficient, and performs really well. I use it on the FINE setting and it grounds it perfectly. Love it so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: I enjoyed it for a year
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed it for a year, but then it broke. I don't enjoy that at all. anyone have a more durable recommendation?
works as its should.

I've been wanting a coffee bean grinder for a while and this one seemed to have the most features for the best price. Well this unit lives up to the hype. Works perfect, very consistent grind, and does the job that is needed. Clean-up is actually very easy, no drawbacks whatsoever.
Terrible company and product. I got this from Walmart and have only used it twice then it stopped working!!
Good

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked fine for a little over a year
reviews.reviewText: It worked fine for a little over a year. It was used nearly daily. Just stopped working one morning. Smells like the motor burnt out.

reviews.reviewTitle: I hate the short power cord
reviews.reviewText: I hate this grinder because of the really, really short power cord. I keep spilling grinds because I can't pull it closer to unload the grinds. Constantly spilling everywhere. Hate it!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Which makes it almost useless without it
reviews.reviewText: The plastic interior rim broken in a year. Which makes it almost useless without it.
Took almost no time for the plastic wall scrapers to break. I am certain that some plastic is getting into the ground coffee as well. Poorly design for this feature alone.

My review is from actual use over one year.
I gave myself time to learn the best way IT wants to work.
I bought to own several grinders, this one was a gift.
I would NOT buy this one for myself. Buy it to aggravate someone.
_____________________________________________

10 reasons to NOT buy this, Piece-of-C! (there's more reasons, here's just 10)

1.) Cord is too short. (Add 4 inches more and it be useful. (All about GREED)
2.) VERY NOISY (Thin cheap plastic only amplifies the noise. (MORE GREED)
3.) Convenient flip top spout. (UNLESS you like making a mess! Convenient? NOT!)
4.) Grind choice buttons. (Total waste of beans! *)
(* By not grinding beans to a fine powder, you're just wasting beans. You're NOT using the whole bean and you're not getting the whole flavor out of the bean)
5.) IF your one who wants to cut back on caffeine, buy this piece of `Bull Scat'.
6.) IF you're the many who wants to keep their sanity, look at the lesser expensive grinders.
7.) This unit is a perfect example to look elsewhere to find that, LESS is MORE.
8.) Bean wipers. (IF they touched the bowl, it might work)
9.) Cleanliness? (NOT A CHANCE! Cannot clean under the wipers. EXPECT mold to grow there! E-YUK)
10.) Twist off lid. (OH MY GOD! *)
(* OMG)
You're going to make coffee in the morning and your eyes are dreary and squinty, the VERY LAST thing you need is aggravation. This grinders flip top is hard to find its tabs to twist into the bowl. Once you manage to get THAT together, your second (aggravating) task is to insert the bowl onto the base. IF you don't get it in the right direction it WILL NOT twist to its correct position so the hidden push-tab can start the motor. By now you don't need coffee, you're WIDE AWAKE from this aggravation.

Mr. Coffee, go BACK to the drawing board, get RID of those who designed this garbage and KISS it. KEEP IT SIMPLE, SAM!
Great product
Only have used it once and...so far so good. I like the options to select the amount of coffee for the cups that are being brewed and the option for the type of grind you want. Easy to clean.
I purchased this item for my fiancee's birthday. She really loves her coffee. So far no problems and it dispenses the correct amount. A very good purchase for the money.
Used it about 4 times and it died. Not happy :(
Just what I wanted

Works very well.
Use this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great value! Does the job perfectly
reviews.reviewText: This is exactly what I needed. Grinds coffee and spices, nice variety of settings. Easy to clean. Can't beat it for the price.
Seems to work fine, but when you use it the bucket is coated with coffee, and it's not like I am going to wash it every day, so buying it pre-ground sure seems a lot easier.

reviews.reviewTitle: after a very short time it fails to grind the beans fully leaving chunks!!!
reviews.reviewText: I like the setting and automatic grind feature but they are useless after just a few months when it fails to grind the beans completely. And yes I made sure not to overfill it.
It does what I purchased it to do.
I needed a grinder for occasional use for coffee so wanted something economical. This suits me just fine.
Does what it's supposed to do

Bought this grinder for my Chemex office setup. The grinder leaves beans 60% ground and the rest of the beans are only pulverized but not ground. After brewing coffee lots of beans float to the top unground. Would not recommend.

title: Mr. Coffee 12 Cup Electric Coffee Grinder with Multi Settings, IDS77-RB
features:
Make sure this fits
                by entering your model number.
Automatic coffee and spice grinder with variable settingsCoarse, Medium, or Fine
Chamber Maid Cleaning System sweeps chamber walls to reduce mess and waste
Precisely grind for the amount of coffee you are brewingfrom 4 to 12 cups. Cord length: 25 inches

qAndA.question: Why do you have this categorized as a burr grinder when in fact it is a blade grinder????
qAndA.answer: Good Point. This is not a burr grinder, yet Amazon has this listed as a burr grinder. Please fix.

qAndA.question: The cord is only about 6 inches long..... crazy, have to have an extension cord to reach an outlet
qAndA.answer: The cord does unwind from the bottom. I thought the same thing at first!

qAndA.question: has anyone used this to grind flax seed
qAndA.answer: Right on the box it says "Use a Blade Grinder for more than coffee. Grind spices too for a fresh sprinkle of cinnamon in your coffee!"

qAndA.question: Can I use this for a french press?
qAndA.answer: yes, it has settings for number of cups and another for type of grind..just set to a coarser grind. It's a great little grinder for the money.

qAndA.question: Does this have a timer so it can grind automatically?
qAndA.answer: Once you select your preferred grind setting and number of cups, you will need to press and hold the Start button. You will have to hold the button during the entire grinding process, but there is a timer which will let you know when grinding is complete.

qAndA.answer: that is another really nice feature I forgot to mention in my review is that the amount it grinds can be changed from 4,6,8,10,12 cups (push a button on the side to change) and coarseness can also be adjustment from fine, med and coarse (push button on the side)

qAndA.question: Just received my grinder today. While reading the directions it states 'Use only coffee beans in this unit, do not grind nuts or spices'. Why not spic
qAndA.answer: My GUESS is that the odor of the spices won't go away and spoil the grounded coffee later. But really, you should ask the manufacturer.

qAndA.question: how large is the whole bean storage area? Will it hold a pound of coffee? A half pound? A cup?...
qAndA.answer: No it will not hold a pound, it will hold enough for 8 cups of coffee.

qAndA.question: Is the removable bowl portion with the blades and sweeper dishwasher safe on the top shelf?
qAndA.answer: I dont have the instructions that came with the grinder, but I would say by looking at it probably not.

qAndA.question: is it designed to grind 1 or 2 cups of coffee?
qAndA.answer: The blade grinder can hold enough coffee beans to make 4, 6, 8, or 12 cups of coffee at at time. The beans are filled to the line for the amount of beans you want. It is not designed to grind large quantities of coffee beans at one time. Hope this helps!

qAndA.question: can i use this for espresso?
qAndA.answer:
Yes you can. There are 3 settings:
Course, Medium & Fine. Fine would be your espresso setting.
If this answered your question and you would like to buy this grinder, you can do so by following this link:  see more

qAndA.question: what are the measurements?
qAndA.answer: It is approximately 4" x 4" x 8". One measuring cup (from the grinder) grinds enough coffee for one 12 cup pot of coffee.

qAndA.question: Has anyone used this to grind nuts and seeds? I already have one for coffee but hope this will work to grind almonds.
qAndA.answer: Pretty dang sharp...I don't see why it wouldn't....coffee is really a seed after all..like the pit of a cherry

qAndA.question: 110v?or 220v?
qAndA.answer: It only requires a 110 plug.

qAndA.question: the cord is too short?
qAndA.answer: It is a cord that is about the same as any other kitchen appliance that is set on the kitchen counter and then plugged into a wall outlet on the wall above the counter. We have no problem at all and find that the cord's length is more than we actually need.

qAndA.question: Has anyone used this to grind salt?
qAndA.answer: I have no used it for salt. But I used it for rice and it broke after the first use. But I received a replacement one that works okay. I would use this grinder "at your own risk"

qAndA.answer: Answer not available

qAndA.question: Have anobody tried this on chemex beans?
qAndA.answer: Not yet!

qAndA.question: can this work with 230V?
qAndA.answer: Answer not available

qAndA.question: does it grind fine
qAndA.answer: Yes.

qAndA.question: can I grind indian whole spices like cinnamon, cardamom, corriender seeds and also can I make a paste or chutneys?
qAndA.answer: The coffee grinder can be used to grind spices. However, if your coffee grinder is used to grind spices, we do not recommend grinding coffee in the same unit, or vice versa, as residual flavors may affect your coffee or spices. This grinder is not recommended for making paste or chutney.

qAndA.question: It has 12v or 110v ? Do i need to purchuse any adapter ?
qAndA.answer: It has the standard 110v plug with cord. You do not need to buy anything else.

qAndA.question: What is the measure of beans for each two cups?
qAndA.answer: To produce 2 cups of ground coffee in the IDS77 coffee grinder, we recommend using 1.5 tablespoons of beans. For 4 cups, we recommend 3 tablespoons. For 6 cups, 4.5 tablespoons, 8 cups, 6 tablespoons, 10 cups, 7.5 tablespoons, and for 12 cups, 9 tablespoons.

qAndA.question: How many grams or oz of coffee can be add to the cup and ground at one time? 4-12 cups don't tell me how much coffee I can grind each time. Thank you
qAndA.answer: The amount of coffee that can be ground at one time will vary depending on the size of the beans and how coarse you'd like them ground. To better assist you with this inquiry, please give us a call at 800-672-6333. For your convenience, we are available 9:00 am to 6:00 pm Monday - Saturday, EST.

qAndA.question: I dont get what the cup setting does. regardless of how many beans i put in, it still grinds everything. the manual suggest how many tablespoons of ground coffee to use for a certain number of cups. i want to know what measurement of unground beans i need. the volume will decrease once you grind.
qAndA.answer: On page 6 of your manual, there is a Coffee Measurement Chart. It indicates how many tablespoons of UNground beans are needed to make the desired amount of coffee.

qAndA.question: Does it come with some way to measure the right amount of beans for whatever amount of coffee you want to brew? Or do I grind and use what I need.
qAndA.answer:
Hello - it doesn't say anything on the box and can't take it out of the package but I think you would just grind what you
need for whatever kind of maker you have and how many cups you want. Did you want to order it? thanks, Karen

qAndA.question: i want to use this to grind coffee for a regular coffee maker nothing fancy, how long do i keep the button pressed? Say about 6 cups?
qAndA.answer: No idea as my motor melted immediately. Would not but

qAndA.question: What would cause it to stop working all of the sudden...i see many comments regarding the same issue...very disappointing! why?
qAndA.answer: It's possible they got water somewhere they shouldn't have or that they overheated it from holding the button too long. The first one they sent me didn't work at all but they sent me a new one the same day as a replacement and it works perfectly and is clean and I haven't had any issues with it I use it often.

qAndA.question: Is this 220v 110v? I want to use in Fiji?
qAndA.answer: I can't find anything in the paperwork or on the grinder itself. I have only used it in the US.

qAndA.question: What is the maximum number of ounces of coffee beans this grinder will grind at one time?
qAndA.answer: Not to exceed 12 TBSP, TBSP = .17oz

qAndA.question: Every setting does exactly the same thing. Do I have a defective unit?
qAndA.answer: Not sure what you mean. Do you mean when you put beans in to grind them on different settings ? I really only use the medium grind and have not tried the fine or coarse grind. I think it all has to do with how long it grinds before it automatically shuts off so if you're grinding the exact same amount of time before it see more

qAndA.question: Can you grind for only 2 cups. Picture indicates 4 cups and up. One person said you can grind for only 2 cups.
qAndA.answer: I can guarantee thathat you can grind for 12 cups

qAndA.question: Is it quiet or nosy like some old grinders?
qAndA.answer: It grinds the coffee fairly quietly, and quickly, which my wife appreciates.

qAndA.question: Is this coffee grinder is plug it in or battery operated?
qAndA.answer: Plug in.

qAndA.question: What is the best way to clean and maintain this grinder?
qAndA.answer: Top rack dish washer works for the detachable part. Also just water and a sponge right after a grind do well. I bought this product some months ago and use it/clean it about twice a week since then.

qAndA.question: how many watts
qAndA.answer: The IDS77 grinder is 170 watts. Thanks!

qAndA.question: I just received this product and it works great, but the cord seems extremely short. How do I get more cord out or is it actually that short?
qAndA.answer: Turn it over and pull additional cord that's wound inside the base. I don't know how much is there because I like the shorter cord, but there's more there.

qAndA.question: How does the chamber Maid cleaner work?
qAndA.answer: Good question! The chamber maid system has three plastic "spatulas" which are slightly thicker than toothpicks that rotate around the edge of the blade grinder while it is grinding. It is supposed to keep the bean particles in the center of the grinder so that the blade can reach them. It can be taken apart for cleaning!

qAndA.question: how many watts has it?
qAndA.answer: I believe it is a 120 Watt

qAndA.question: How many ounces can be grinded at a time?
qAndA.answer: Good question! We have measured the quantity in Tablespoons. The minimum amount that can be ground is 3 Tablespoons for 4 cups of coffee. The maximum amount that can be ground is 9 Tablespoons for 12 cups of coffee.

qAndA.question: How is it programable?
qAndA.answer: There are buttons on the front/side. Choose how many cups you plan on making and the "grind" type and it'll grind the proper amount. Hope that helps.

qAndA.question: Can it be used to grind spices?
qAndA.answer: I got a new coffee maker for my birthday with a built in grinder and have used this for spices. It's pretty loud and you've gotta make sure you clean it after. But it does work

qAndA.question: I used mine and it started smoking. How do I return it?
qAndA.answer: Check with Amazon website. Or check the booklet inside box with instructions.

qAndA.question: can this be used for apricot kernels?
qAndA.answer: We do not recommend using apricot kernels in our grinders.

qAndA.question: So I just fill the cup with coffee, put hlw much I need and it just grinds that much, or does it grind everything in the cup?
qAndA.answer: It grinds everything you put in the cup.

qAndA.question: Is there anyway to clean the outside of the grinder? The area is covered by plastic and it doesnt see to detach.
qAndA.answer: Well, you just wipe it down like any other plastic appliance in whatever way works for you. I dont think its a big problem.

qAndA.question: does this have a hidden cord chamber?
qAndA.answer: The cord wraps around and is hidden in the bottom of the unit

qAndA.question: What is the input voltage? Does it work on 220 V?
qAndA.answer: Thank you for your interest in our Mr. Coffee brand. All of our products that are sold in the United States are manufactured and UL approved for 110-120 voltage. We do not recommend using them in different countries due to the difference in voltage. Additionally, doing so will void your warranty.

qAndA.question: why is this product listed under burr grinders if it is a blade grinder?
qAndA.answer: I'm not sure but it is definitely a blade grinder. It works great though but definitely a blade grinder.

qAndA.question: What is the maximum capacity of this grinder in cups of whole beans?
qAndA.answer: Well on the side it says "12 cups[of finished coffee]" or "9 tablespoons" of coffee beans. When i look at it, it looks like it'll hold a cup of coffee beans. I've never put that much in, as I like daily fresh grinds. Hope that helped.
